description: why am I paying for a class where I have to teach myself?

The professor does passive teaching which means that it will require you to do a lot of studying on your own and practice problems. Try to obtain as much help to learn and then apply that by practicing. A good tip to survive this class is to write down problems on your cheat sheet.

DO NOT TAKE HER. Not understanding with regards to extra circumstances, there are very few things that could happen which would result in her showing any sympathy with regards to letting yoiu submit an assignment late much less doing it not for credit. I went to the hospital but she still gave me a 0 for an assignment with a one-day time window

Her lectures are not helpful but a good place to ask questions and practice material. She has a lot of resources in Canvas and provides help from other assistants. The class requires a lot of practice on problems and study for midterms not taking the final.
Folks, do not take this class :)

Typos every test. Made some tests incomprehensible.
Unnecessarily strict and weird grading system. Apparently it's going to be changed in following quarters, but from my experience, it was not good.
Some tests took over a month to get my grades. In a 10-week course, that's unacceptable.
Maybe it's better now, but it wasn't good for me.

Doesn't teach, so you have to read the textbook and learn on your own. Class time is either used for exams or in-class problems. Good amount of HW but still manageable. Uses a weird grading system called specification grading. Most exams were fair if you read the textbook and did practice exams. Material got easier after week 3. TAs are good.

Professor Gassko's teaching style is ineffective, leaving students confused and disengaged. The lack of clear communication and unhelpful feedback creates a challenging learning environment. Overall, the class experience fell short of all my expectations. Take Hayes or any other professor for this course.

Professor Gassko lacks effective teaching methods, making the class confusing and unengaging. Poor communication and unhelpful feedback hindered my learning experience. Along with this the grading system in the class is made so some students have an A the entire course while others have an F

Professor is non existent. relies on students who work for her to run her entire class. The expectations have been changing nearly every week and Its been 7 weeks and I still don't know what the graders for the exams want from me. They just say "Not yet". The lack of an actual syllabus makes it a whole game for is to hunt down what we nee

Just dropping by to leave my weekly 1 rating. Gassko is still awful, the TA lectures are generally a waste of time, and Zybooks is so bad that I've started reading different textbooks that actually properly teach the material. This isn't coming from a place of spite or frustration either. So far, I've only missed a single outcome. She just blows.
Too much hw, she doing nothing and let us self learning.

it's barely the end of week 2 and a lot of students are already stressed and feel defeated by the grading system. prof gassko doesn't teach much during lecture and all you can rely on is zybooks. the feedback the readers give you on your assignments are vague and unhelpful. please please take this class with a different prof no matter what.

This class is just a complete joke. Incompetent teacher that lets her TAs do everything, including writing her exams which are way too hard for the 50 minute timeframe because the TAs have already taken the course before so they cannot gauge beginner-friendly problems. Just pathetic.
She called her students pathetic
Does not care about students. Course was easy tho

This class is essentially a "self-study" class. Take thorough notes on textbook readings and you should be fine. You don't have to attend the lectures but go to the discussions. Try to utilize EdDiscussion a lot because the TAs are very helpful.
She does not care about her students. Midterms were super long and difficult. Huge anxiety.
Apart from her awful teaching, don't ask her to help you write a reference. She would reply very slowly (2 weeks) and told you she couldn't write for you. Her delay really made me mad...
Professor Zybooks basically. Too much textbook learning and no lectures. Has some lecture videos but they don't explain anything and the presentation is not well prepared.
So much work and it's really really hard. The concepts are difficult to grasp but it could have still been taught much better and clearer in the lectures.

Difficult tests that test whether you have truly mastered the material and are able to apply it to other things you've learned. At the same time, the entire bulk of the learning is self-learning and group assignments. Don't expect lectures to make concepts more understandable, oftentimes it makes them more confusing. Big curve tho.
She makes the test extremely difficult by giving only little time. She doesn't teach in lectures. Everything we did is group discussion.

Gassko's explanations are unhelpful & group activities confusing (she doesn't publish written answers to these, only have other students explain their answers). I was genuinely scared of failing this class, but she gave a BIG curve at the end. Jonathan Ta is a great TA, even offered to have 1-on-1 Zoom's to help students. Take Irani if possible.

She doesn't teach. Period. Relies heavily on collaboration among students which works for some but you're basically screwed if your group isn't smart. She doesn't give direct solutions for homeworks or group discussions.

Doesn't teach the class and lets TAs run the class.Uploads videos on canvas that you have to watch and makes you buy a zybook subscription so she doesn't have to teach you.U pretty much have to teach yourself everything and somehow understand the scenarios or confusing questions she makes up. Don't take her if you don't HAVE to.

Worst prof I have ever taken. She does not teach at all during lecture time. You will have to learn everything by yourself. To make matters worse we use zybooks for hw which has no solutions manual so you have no clue whether or not your doing the hw right. What a waste of my time.
I'm just wondering how she becomes a professor at this school ???
Lectures are basically non-existent. You're going to have to learn everything on your own from the readings, but you might get a TA in your discussion section will actually teach the course material.

Very kind and astute professor. Cares for her students but her explanation of difficult topics can sometimes be confusing. She tries her best to accommodate students' (i.e. adapts to feedback, buffers grades, etc.) The class is hw heavy but you learn a lot. She offers lots of points from diff assignments so don't worry too much ab your grade.

You need to spend countless hours if you want to get an A in this class. I was fortunate enough to take this class with the people I dorm with. I also showed up to class and met up with classmates outside of class frequently to get an A in the class. Couple exam questions were difficult and none of my dormmates knew how to solve it.
Basically had to teach myself with ZyBooks and YouTube videos. People who got 90 to 93% received a B+ in the class. I got a 94% in the class and received an A- instead of an A.
She seems nice and cares about the class, but she's not good at teaching. I never showed up to class and got an A by teaching myself with the textbook. The class isn't hard but can get tedious

This quarter, she dropped the lowest assignment in each category (hw, tests, quizzes, etc). She was not hard but she made the class unnecessarily difficult. Ticked me off that she did not allow us to view our grades via canvas and doesn't tell you what her grade cutoff's are. She's barely available. Essentially a self taught class. Mandatory for CS

Weekly quizzes (40%), final only 10%. Homework tricky b/c graded on correctness & not allowed to get help, even from staff. Dropped lowest grade in each category w/ 2+ assignments. Not the best, not the worst. Lectures not very helpful, but sometimes she says something that helps you on the quiz, so go to them. TAs & LAs aren't the best help.

Accommodating, nice, but does not teach. Discussion lectures were more helpful in learning material, but I did not attend a single lecture since week 3 and did fine. All of the learning is done on your own on the Zybooks. If you need help, she is most likely not the one to help you.

The class was heavily self-taught using Zybooks and the homework load is pretty heavy and is graded off of accuracy. Tests require you to do thinking outside what is taught in the textbook. Make sure to pay attention to the wording on her tests as it can affect the answer choice. Expect to put in work if you want an A.

There is a lot of stuff you will have to do (reading, homework, mastery and lecture comprehension checks, etc). However, if you manage to do those and do well on the tests, you will do fine in this class. The final is 10% so there is no need to worry about it if you have a good grade. I can't really say anything about the in-person classes though.

You could read all of zybooks, watch her "lectures" and read one homework question and have no idea what she is talking about. What you read is only the surface of what you are expected to know on the tests. She seems like a nice professor but she is a horrible professor.

Tests are 40% of your grade and are significantly harder than items you'd come across in homework. Lots of self-teaching as the pre-recorded lectures are not very clear and cover the surface of what will actually be covered on the test. The tests being harder or different than what's on hw and lectures is what brings Prof. Gassko down in rating.

Mrs. Gassko genuinely seems like a nice woman but she basically doesn't teach, all learning is through Zybooks. She assigns an unreasonable amount of homework each week, again self taught. The subject matter is hard enough already, but the way she organizes her curriculum makes it miserable. I urge you to not take this class.
Horrible Professor avoid wishing I did the same.
She assigns so much unnecessary work and doesn't even teach. So I always skip her lectures and only rely on the Zybook. Horrible class. Would definitely NOT recommend
dont do this to yourself.
Her lectures(pre-recorded-person) are just genuinely bad... Lots of tedious and repetitive work

Horrific professor. Don't take her, she doesn't teach at all. Everything is done based off of zybooks and exams are not easy at all, which account for 40% of your grade. Also, you can only use zybooks or you'll be called out for cheating -- can't even discuss homework with anyone.

Gassko never listened to feedback from students and she cared more about cheating than actually teaching material. Her lectures were prerecorded and werent helpful in reviewing for anything. HW & Mastery Check up were insanely hard to do but were graded somewhat fairly (would take off 0.05 points) TAs/LAs only care about making the exams hard.

Gassko is actually the WORST professor I have had. She does not care about her students and doesn't listen to a single feedback. The class is so hard, if you just pay attention and read the textbook you will fail the test. 45% of the grades are from tests which really impacts your grade... THE SHEEP

Gassko is actually THE best professor I have had. She cares about her students and try her best to help her students by reading every single feedback. The class is so easy if you just pay attention and read the textbook, only 45% of the grades are from tests where the rests are just trivial stuff like reading and participating... THE GOAT

"Your observation that exams are harder this quarter than usual is correct. Because of the remote nature of the exams we no longer can ask simple questions, so we have to make them more concept-oriented." Don't take her online, punishes you for taking her online with insanely hard exams not even similar to hw. Not worth the stress, take irani.
Lots of work but the content is fairly simple so it is very manageable. Quizzes and group discussions are effort-based. If you read zybook and turn everything in on time, it is an easy A.

The class content itself was fairly simple and easy to understand. Regardless, there was still a quiz, written HW, test, group discussion, and zybook HW every week. Written HW was very time consuming. Attending test review sessions helped a lot for the weekly tests.

I took this class remote, and it was straightforward: weekly readings, quizzes (based on completion), homework, and short exams. Overall, it was very manageable. I would recommend joining the ICS Discord. She also gave opportunities for extra credit. As long as you do the Zybooks readings, you will be fine!

Even though it started out rough the first 3 weeks, it later on got easier. She tries her best in order to help students such as each hw assignment(medium) being 1% of your total grade, quizzes (hard) and discussions(medium) graded on effort, and lowest exam and hw assignment grade being dropped. Be prepared for the workload to be heavy.

The workload is questionable but the grading scale is very lenient. Harder HW easier tests, Quizzes graded in the effort. Don't get the hate to her as much, she is a very nice professor. Mainly learning was done through zybook, lectures not really important to watch. If you do the work and try your best you will get a guaranteed B.
Some homework is heavy but she's nice.
Crazy workload donno wut to say.

Don't take this class with Gassko. The whole class is unorganized and test difficulties vary drastically. They are extremely easy one week and extremely hard the other. Homework and Discussions are worth the exact same which makes no sense. She doesn't really teach either. The whole class is based off the ZyBooks.
Do not take this professor. You will regret it. She is a boomer and can not teach. Avoid by all means

This is the worst class I've ever taken in my life. The homework, quizzes, and reading are overwhelming and you have to show all work which means a mathematical proof for every problem. The homework is graded on accuracy and you basically aren't allowed to ask for help. Avoid this professor at all costs. You will regret being in this class.

Worst class I've taken in UCI ever. The instructor seems to always seek ways to improve her teaching, but I feel like she only knows how to make lots of weird rules and make the whole class even more messy. And the grading is toxic. You got to show lots of work on some very easy problems otherwise you won't get full credit. So gross! Awful!

Gassko is the negation/complement of the tags. Lectures are super awful and unorganized. The amount of homework and quizzes are just terribly ridiculous. You'll learn nothing here, take logic somewhere else, or do yourself a favor and don't take it. ¬You are one of the best teachers.

Worst professor. Try to avoid her at all costs. Workload is unreasonable for the material; get ready for constant homework. Schedule, grading system, & syllabus is confusing. She is not willing to help you and exploits failures for her own entertainment. Zybooks purchase is required, and all learning is based in Zybooks (don't expect her to teach).

This class was very overwhelming, especially as an introductory ICS class: Monday  weekly midterms, Tuesday  HW (a lot), Wednesday  lectures w/ embedded Qs and Zybooks, Thursday: Discussion posts, Saturday: Quizzes. Definitely a big time commitment and primarily self learning from Zybooks.
I LOVE HER. SHE IS AMAZING. HER RECORDED LECTURES ARE REALLY GOOD.
Whether it's her weekly mandatory discussions that lack any structure or her overwhelming workload schedule, Gassko is inept for an online class during these times.

An absolute mess. There's too much work assigned and it gets in the way of students balancing their classes. Lectures and discussions don't help and as a result a lot students use resources which get them flagged for academic integrity. Maybe if the class was run better, students would actually be able to do the work on their own! Avoid this class!

This class is a mess. The course load is ridiculous. A bunch of Zybook hw due every week, weekly reading assignments, weekly tests, weekly quizes, weekly mandatory group work. Useless lectures. If you ask her for help on a problem, she won't show any work explaining how she got her answer. She'll just tell you something confusing. AVOID TAKING HER.

I would not even go to lectures besides for participation points. There is way too much homework assigned. Quizzes are extremely time-restricted. The workload is inconsistent with the difficulty of this class. Avoid this professor at all costs.
She gives more work than all my other classes combined. Never will I take a class with her ever again.

The workload does not make sense. Homework and quiz every week. 5 exams including finals. She even asked for participation. Homeworks will take you like 5 hours. Need to learn by zooybook yourself as well as go to lecture because of participation point. I've no idea why this easy course has such big workload. Worst professor! Avoid her!

As far as teaching, yes she sucks. As far as the class, you basically learn through the zybook and the material is easy. Hw was tedious. 4 midterms and a final which were all fair imo, but I found the hw to be graded a little harshly. Its not as bad as everyone says, its just her teaching that sucks. It could be much worse

Her lectures are sometimes confusing, but her tests and homework are very fair. Homework is once a week and takes a couple of hours. Tests are open book and is tested on the material in the book. Participation counts, unfortunately, and lectures are mandatory. Otherwise a pretty fair class.
Would give a 0 if I could. Professor wasn't even here this entire quarter yet she gave more homework than all 3 of my other classes combined.

Counted participation during a global pandemic. Didn't have a syllabus. Disappeared in the middle of the quarter. Would often go over the allotted class time and when students complained said "you have no where else to go" even when they had a class right after. Would never read zoom chat.
Totally don't know what she is doing in lecture

Literally makes everything complicated for no reason, like different sites for homework and questions Lectures are completely useless, so most of your learning comes from the online textbook and homework, but you still have to attend these lectures for participation. Imagine forcing students to participate in lecture during a global pandemic.
Worst Professor ever met so far.

I just respect Professor Gassko. I do not know why students do not say good things about her but she is the best professor I have ever seen at UCI. She is very caring. She always helps students and answer to their questions. Her lectures are fast but if you do hard work it is very easy to get A in this class. Her exams are not hard but pretty easy.

Uses the "flipped classroom" model to the extreme. You must understand the reading fully before class. She barely skims over the basic concepts in lecture before diving in to the advanced applications of the concepts taught. This makes many students critique her teaching since they can't comprehend it. The exams that count are super easy though!
Good professor, extremely helpful in OHs. Tests are easy as long as you read zybook.
Really the WORST PROFESSOR I have ever had at UCI so far.

Prepare for self learning 99% of the time because she can't teach. Homework n quizzes are ridiculously hard and they arent even on the exams. Tests are fair, but worth a lot. 6D is a difficult class so if you want a good grade then better off taking with Irani, or put extra effort in self-learning.
She does not know how to teach. She will probably be better off at some high school than UCI.

Not good at all. She makes her exams so difficult. I study for hours and still bomb her exam. She is terrible at teaching. Just self study on your own if you want to actually do well enough. I am barely getting a C. This course should be online instead and Irani should make something like that.

If she stops saying terrible jokes, I will give her a 2-stars. For this quarter, everything went wrong in 6D and especially unfairness in the final exam decision. She needs to think for the students not only for herself, and gives students real encouragement to study not fake ones.

Not caring and approachable professor, can't explain the questions. I have to self-teaching 100% from the Zybook. ABSOLUTELY she wastes my tuition and time. The most ridiculous thing is they gonna remove you from piazza if you complain about the test.

To be completely honest, she sucks! Her lectures leave me so confused, and I have to rely heavily on her textbook to get any learning done. She attempts to change her class each quarter to make it better, but in reality, she is just adding more busy work that isn't necessary to the class. I hate her. She sucks

Took 6B and 6D with she. Exams are super easy for both classes, much easier than the homework and take-home quizzes for 6D are probably the hardest but theyre graded on the effort. Caring, passionate, just dont know how to teach.

I took ICS 6D in spring 2020. She just doesnt repair enought to answer all the problem in Zybook and expected you know the format on solving homework (that you have to self tough). Get ready to study this course by your self. Im so lost when taking this class. This is so confused that I dont know where to ask questions

You have to teach yourself in this class from a platform called Zybooks, which is dull confusing and a waste of money. She is no support as in class she comes up with brain teaser questions that had not been showed in the book. Avoid her at all cost if you can she useless in this class. Students only come to class for her clicker questions.

She's a pretty bad teacher overall. The class depends on you being able to learn from Zybooks, which confuses me because I pay $4000 for tuition every quarter, yet I still have to pay more to learn online?? Also, her homework questions are very vague, and her test questions are vague too. When you ask her for clarifications on piazza, its vague too

Though there are 4 midterms, they are extremely easy as I get full points for two and minor deductions for two(0.5 points off). While homework are somewhat challenge, they are worth only 5% of the total grade. Her office hours are helpful, willing to answer questions. Recommend.
You are not only learning the course but also learning self-learning.

Lectures are boring and not that helpful. They're not mandatory but were obligated to attend for iclicker credit. The material is all self-taught through zybook. Midterms are fair, but can be deadly if you miss a couple of questions. She cheesed us with a hard final :(. Gassko herself is a very nice individual.

If you're a student who relies on GOOD professors like me :) then this class is not for you. This whole class is self-taught through the online textbook, ZyBooks. I learned nothing from Gassko. Everything from this class, I learned from ZyBooks, my peers, and my tutor, who was MY teacher for 6b. 4 midterms and 1 final.

If you want a professor whose caring, sweet, and passionate about teaching you then I highly recommend taking her for ICS6B. Stay on top of the homework and reading and it becomes really hard to get a bad grade in this class. There's plenty of opportunities to get help. She can be clumsy with notes sometimes, but the lectures are very useful.

She's okay. Mostly self taught on ZyBooks. I've never had a class that had 4 midterms. The midterms are not hard, and are pretty fair, but are also short so if you mess up, it really messes with your grade. She has a weird grading algorithm so you don't know your grade until the end of the quarter which is really crappy. Overall not bad.

I really like this teacher! Tbh, lecture might not be useful to some people ( thou I find it kind of useful) . AND I HIGHLY suggest to really understand and read the ZyBooks and do the HW properly!! (because most of the exams is similar to the practice HW). She also give Extra Credits for HW (thou not a lot) and "helping" other students in Piazza.
The easiest class in UCI. Lots of homework but you will be fine.
Should pay attention to avoid score mistakenly lost. Hw were so many. Midterms were easy so average/deviation were high/narrow. It was similar to final. So, mistake may affect on your grade.

ICS 6B with Gassko is not the worst thing in the world. The class is mostly self taught with as you will do most of the learning through your homework assignments. Lectures are pretty bland and boring, but she gives clicker questions for participation and it can help reinforce your homework learning. 4 Midterms and a final so lots of tests!

If you have the option to take a course she teaches online, do it. She really doesn't help much in lecture and all she tells you to do is practice on your own without giving you any guidance whatsoever. She is quite old school and her lecture slides (not even sure they are hers) don't help at all. She is not underrated, please do not take her class

Professor Gassko is underrated. Although she has an accent, her lectures are clear and she makes sure her students (if they are paying attention) understand what is going on in Zybooks. Her grading system is very detailed and clear, and her tests are very fair if you study and do the hw.
lectures are useless but she does iclicker, zybooks has everything you need, homeworks are way harder than midterms and final, no curves cuz everyone does really well

Gassko is now much, much harder. Avoid her at all costs and take Irani instead. She uses this stupid 2 midterm and 1 final system now that basically screws your grade if you do badly on even one of them. Again, her tests are hard now so most people got Cs or less on these tests. Avoid like the plague.

I took Gassko for 6B and 6D. The majority of the grade is made up of the midterms and final exam. The rest is worth 10-15% of your grade. I would recommend skipping class(iClicker is worth 1.5%), and just focus on reading the ZyBook and doing the homework(just to prepare for the exams). Her final(50 points) had a problem worth 8 points, be careful.

Lecture is 1.5% of your grade. Homework every week and a quiz (graded on participation) is annoying. Content is easy. The midterms and the final felt as if she was mocking me, unbelievably easy, but if you make even one mistake it will be costly. Must read and participate in interactive online textbook.

Gassko for 6B is amazing and caring. People just like to give her a hard time. The class itself is not very difficult and the midterms feel more like an elementary school style assignments (I am being 100% serious). Really didnt put any effort into the class, didnt go to any discussions, and still got an A. Zybooks and iClickers are used.

She's hard to understand a lot of the times (not just because of her accent). I usually go in the lecture kinda confused, and then go out even more confused. Her tests are not easy anymore, she's made them harder. She gives a lot of homework too that is long and tedious.

Even though you will mainly be relying on the textbook (zyBooks) to learn, she is very accessible and cares about her students. There are weekly homework that can be tedious, but her tests are fair and relatively easy.

She's not really a helpful professor since she likes to go over questions in lecture(more like doing TA's job). Quizzes can be annoying. The class is all about logic so people will have different feelings about how hard it is. Zybook explains the concepts well but some of the questions are not helpful.

i took her for 6B and honestly it wasnt too bad. Bad mistake to take her again for 6D. She became stricter and the exams were different. She also takes course material from another professor and the TAs make the exams. So, she does nothing but lecture, a few office hours and respond a little bit on piazza. Honestly, one of the worst professors.

The textbook teaches better than her which is a shame because lecture attendance is kind of mandatory (iClicker participation). Homework assignments can be pretty long and make up only a small percentage of your grade, but they help prepare you for tests.

Not a very good professor, but this class is an easy A. Lectures are pretty useless, but they only count as a small portion of the grade. The ZyBook is good, so reading it and doing the homework will teach you the material. The tests are very easy and usually less than 10 questions long. Would take again, easy class.

People are really harsh about Gassko, but in reality she is a very caring professor. She gives lots of examples during lectures to ensure you understand the material. She urges the students to take care of their health and to ask questions and participate in class. Her lectures are long and slow, but it's great if you don't understand the material.
If she didn't talk I would have given her a higher score 8/10

The lectures weren't great, and the iClicker questions were only worth 1.5% of the grade. You learn everything on your own from the zyBook and get help on Piazza (really helpful if you don't get certain questions and/or concepts). The midterms and final were really easy, and I studied a lot but I definitely over-studied. Gassko was a kind lady too.
Gassko is a nice lady.

The online textbook will be your primary learning source in this class. Gassko seems to have good intentions, but her lectures are often regurgitating the information we read in the textbook prior to the lecture. She does little to expand upon that information. Lots of tests, but they're very easy. Lectures can feel like a waste of time.

Arguably the worst professor I've had. Constantly confuses herself and students have to correct her ; she clearly doesn't understand the material she teaches. Class uses a zybook, which makes it relatively easy for you to teach yourself. If you are motivated, the class is an easy A even with the lack of competence from the UCI end of things.

She is a very poor lecturer. Makes a lot of mistakes in class and going to lecture is mandatory which is pretty annoying. However, as long as you do the homework and read the zybooks midterms and final are crazy easy. As long as you are at least somewhat motivated to do well you should get an easy A in this class

Gassko is amazing. Bless her. She has four tests/midterms every two weeks and a final, but don't worry because her tests are ridiculously easy. Most people finish within 30 minutes and leave. Participation matters because of IClickers but it's only 1.5% of your grade so it doesn't really matter. If you read the Zybooks you'll get an A.
Midterms are easy even though the homework is daunting. Her lectures can be confusing, it's best to read the zybooks and self study. Not the best teacher, but an easy class to pass.

Gassko is one of the few professors that actively reply and help on Piazza, which makes me think that she wants her students to do well and cares for them. She's really nice too. It's a shame she's not a very good teacher. Tests are easy, homework is long and tedious. Most people only go to lectures for iClicker points.

4 midterms, final, 9 hws, iclicker questions (you have to get them right), and zybooks credit. Midterms were really not that bad but I overstudied the hard stuff. Her lectures and hws make it seem like the tests are going to be so hard but theyre not. Lectures are boring and not helpful, the zybook taught me Boolean algebra. Eh professor, ok class

I passed ICS 6B because of zybooks. LEC not that helpful bc she gets confused and makes mistakes Make a friend, it helps with studying confusing material She counts if you get iclicker questions wrong or right 4 midterms: EASIER than the homework I love it Homework(5%): due each week and its LONG (I did 3/10 LOL) Discussions suck and not mandatory

She is a stubborn old lady and makes some mistakes. But her project and test are not that hard if you come to class and study her notes. Since the program project are pair programming, I have met a lot of people who do not pay attention to that at all. This is not a class that you can expect an A easily, I mean if you dont study at all.
First programming class Ive ever taken. She isnt the best at explaining, but what she does in lecture makes a lot more sense if you read the textbook, and maybe do the practice problems.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASSSSSSSS!!!!!!! If you are thinking of taking this class instead of Soc Sci 3A..... think again. I thought this class would be fun but now I'm failing. She is horrible at explaining, makes errors on purpose, and does not give you enough time to catch up with her code. She leaves a lot of information out, and just bad all around.

Gassko is a really smart lady. She might not be the best lecturer but you should be able to ready the ZyBook and be fine in the class. Attendance is mandatory and there are in class quizzes every week which kinda sucks, but they aren't that hard. Final was easy as hell too. She was good for 6D, idk about other non-zybook classes

Every week there will be a quiz on the homework due that week; quizzes are pretty easy they are based on your hw problems. I would say, I attend lecture just because of the clicker questions. I honestly learned the material on my own thanks to zybook. I took her for 2 quarters, she's not too bad. You just learn on your own and you'll be good.

She makes her class manageable enough that you can barely do homework and study the day of quizzes that you can pass with a C. But her lectures were so bad and so boring, and so useless to go to that you can get unmotivated and annoyed while you click on a random answer for iClicker. Disappointing professor for a class required by many ICS majors.
Unless you have to take her for a major required class, don't take her class. She is horrible at explaining things and goes so slow.

She is very boring in class and not a very good teacher. She makes so many errors it's hard to follow the main concepts. The material in this class was really easy and self-studying was not at all difficult. Her quizzes and tests are based off previous ones, making them very easy and predictable. Overall, easy class, terrible teacher.
Gassko is a good person, but not a good instructor. She doesn't know how to teach in a efficient way. And sometimes the lectures can be silent for several minutes.

She waits for people to answer questions on the overhead before continuing on. Sometimes it could be up to a minute of silence until someone raises their hand. You can't shout the answer out either, you have to raise your hand. The class is only 10-weeks long, we can't have silence in lectures. She's a nice lady for sure, but as a lecturer, ehh.

The lectures are slow, but she can very helpful answering questions. If people participate in answering her questions, the lectures go by faster. She is a great resource in lecture, so ask questions and participate in discussions!!. For quizzes, don't miss points because of simple mistakes, always review your quiz if you have time.

Lectures are pretty useless but there is iclicker session(1.5%). There is no test but 9 quizzes. There is one chance to drop the lowest grade. Getting a high grade is not hard as long as you do the homework and read the book. She gives good grade, so I like her.

How did UCI even hire her? The delivery of her content is extremely slow and dry. The ZY book will be your teacher but you still need to attend class for iClicker participation. At office hours she is often ambiguous. Although her ICS 6B final was an easy A, I suggest avoiding her especially for ICS 31.
She types so slow that we don't have time to get on to the next part to prepare for the labs. She is also unorganized and makes so many mistakes.
Awful teacher, she cannot explain even the most simple concepts as she gets lost along the way trying to use metaphors that do not make sense. The homework solutions provided are also not very clear.

Lectures are pretty useless, with confusing explanations, although she gives lots of time for questions. Attendance is essentially required due to iclicker. Although her lectures aren't great, she is very helpful in office hours, hence my rating. If you take the time to approach her, she is actually pretty good. Easy tests / quizzes as well.

Does not teach efficiently, wastes time by purposely making mistakes and is just a slow teacher overall. That being said, she does not prepare you for quizzes(once a week) and labs(once a week). The labs(done in partners)and quizzes started getting difficult after week 3. Don't be afraid to ask others for help in lab sections and read the book.

The absolutely worst professor I've had at UCI. Can't explain coding concepts clearly, really boring voice & thick accent, and makes a bunch of mistakes while coding in lecture. Does not prepare us for labs at all, and quizzes can have material she hasn't even gone over in lecture or lab.

You want to skip lecture but there are iClickers. You know no one pays attention when she asks whats 2x2 and no one responds or when she purposely makes mistakes and no one pays enough attention to correct her. Responses to questions on piazza gives more questions than answers and sometimes hw is not even from the book so examples do not correlate

Gassko is a great professor if you like contemplating what mistakes you made in life to end up in this lecture. If you ask her a question prepare for a vague story about "mountain stones" or something that is somehow supposed to lead you to discovering the answer for yourself. Labs are 30% of your grade, after the 3rd week lecture was way behind.

Does not explain concepts clearly and is not very helpful when she responds to questions in lecture. Her "hints" on piazza are more cryptic than anything and her lectures are even worse. It's very obvious that no one in the class is following along.
Extremely slow typer, makes lots of small errors and can't figure out how to fix them, has an accent, boring voice. Weekly quizzes, no midterm, one final
a respected professor, but be prepared to learn by yourself

Her quizzes weren't hard, I just second guessed myself sometimes, but she did drop the lowest quiz. Her lectures require iclickers, but she didn't clearly give the correct answers to her questions. Zybooks was super helpful and Muntaha was an amazing TA. Easy final. Structural induction sucks. Gassko is a nice lady though.
Very easy class. Easy quiz Easy final. Professor is very nice. Like her
Easiest ICS class ever. The final took literally 20 minutes. Really easy tests.

There are 4 tests which were all pretty fair and she gave us a beautifully easy final to boost everyone's grades at the end. People finished in like 15 min. Just go to lecture for clicker points and make sure you understand the HW and you'll get an A. Very sweet lady, would definitely take again.

Gassko is a super sweet lady, and she really cares for her students. I mean wow, shes very genuine! I really did not follow her lectures though. The textbook is much more clear. People also talk a lot during her class. I believe she needs to take more control over that aspect. Quizzes are fair. Study the text and do homework, and youll be golden

Her tests and final aren't that difficult if you did and understood the homework. However, homework is graded on correctness, not completeness . Lectures are slow and unclear at times, so you'll have to do A LOT of studying on your own. She's a very sweet lady, and the class is fair, but the way she gives lectures may frustrate some people.

She is very nice and a great person to have conversations with, but her lecturing is meh. You'll learn more from the book on your own but she does have a few rays of light in her lectures sometimes. Tests are fairly easy. There's a lot of homework and it's actually graded on correct answers. Overall, great person, not so great lecturer.

Her tests are fair, but her lectures aren't great. She spends some time after examples to discuss the wrong answers but sometimes doesn't specify which letter answer was correct. Handwriting is typically hard to read. Fairly large amount of homework assigned which may get repetitive when multi-part problems are assigned that test the same concept.

she's seems like a nice sweet lady but not the best at teaching, 6D material is hard and she's not the greatest at explaining anything, homeworks can be very annoying because of multiple parts and proofs etc and are graded on accuracy which can be rough, quizzes aren't bad if you know what you're doing, has iclickers for participation

I actually like her because her tests are so easy. Just don't expect to learn from her lecture. Reading the online textbook and practicing the exercise problems in the book are pretty enough to get full marks.

As a person, I think she's great. I appreciate how she's always smiling during her lectures, and I can tell she loves teaching. But as a professor, not so great. Her lectures are very slow and vague. I honestly feel like I learn more from the students in the lecture rather than from her. You'll learn A LOT more by thoroughly reading the textbook.
Likes to engage with the class.
Great teacher with great teaching style. She curves the grades. Went from a B+ to an A.

One of the best profs at UCI hands down. She's very clear about expectations, posts practice exams which are exactly like the real thing, and wants you to succeed. This quarter, only Monday discussions were mandatory, and lectures were async online. Loved her, wish she taught more courses.

Great professor. Her lectures are easy to understand, and she's very sweet and easy to talk to. The way her course goes overall is very predictable and you won't be given a surprise. You should well-prepare yourself for each exam though because they will tank your grade if you fail one of them (like I did), but she does curve.

Basically an online class, foundation for the ICS 6D flipped classroom structure. I'm confused about the rating difference between her and a certain ICS 6B/D prof; they're the same structure and I found both fine. Exams were identical to past offerings and lecture videos are simplified breakdowns of zyBooks, which help prep for really easy exams.

Great professor! She uses a zybook, which is at times a little boring, but her in-person and video lectures are super helpful, the zybook has tons of practice, and she posts a ton of resources for tests. STAY ON TRACK TILL THE END. The first three tests were easy, but on the final, the average score fell by about 20 percent. Still got curved.

Solid prof, nothing I can complain about. Class isn't too hard, especially if you spread out the reading/homework over the week. Hybrid structure is great, only need to show up for one discussion weekly, and no lecture unless exam. Make sure to start the induction homework early, it is SUPER long. Good exam support with practice exams.

This professor is great. The amount of resources provided makes this course very manageable, with readings that teach pretty well. Her video lectures are quite helpful, she has all her past teachings on her website including past tests, with more recent ones that have the exact same format of her current exams, making it a lot easier to understand

If you have to take 6D, please do yourself a favor and take it with Professor Irani. Her lecture is by far the easiest to understand, and her exams are a good reflection of the concepts that's she's teaching. Unless you never show up to class and only show up for the finals, then you'd be in good hands. 5/5 reccommended
GOAT prof. Super nice and helpful. Absolutely loves it when you ask questions. Clear communication of what will be asked on the exams; previous midterms and finals available for reference.

Thoroughly enjoyed her class. Well organized and helpful. All exams were fair, but she really stresses counting topics at the end! I still go back and watch the old lecture videos when in need of a refresher. For a deeper understanding than the Zybook, reference the Rosen & Epp books!

Very good professor who gives clear criteria for the class, very useful resources and lectures for learning the various concepts, and is very clearly caring. This class was relatively easy and if taken seriously is a near guaranteed A. If an option for 6d, Irani is the way to go every time.

Irani is an incredibly generous professor. The workload might seem a lot at first, but it barely takes any time to do, to be perfectly honest. Only Tuesday discussions are mandatory and I used to leave after finishing both the required questions. She curves heavily.

Professor Irani is a very good lecturer. Her lecture videos helped explain and reinforce the zyBook concepts without just repeating the information. The grading felt quite easy, but this was likely because the class was online. I would definitely recommend taking this class with her.

As long as you follow the lectures and readings as they are due and start your homework a little early, this class is an easy A (my B is just from slacking and taking other hard classes). Professor cares a lot about making sure the students do well. If Irani is an option for 6d ever, you should do what you can to make sure your in her class.

Honestly she's a great professor that truly cares, but I believe that her level of intellegince surpaces her understanding of what its like to be an undergraduate studying a hard math class. The test are hard and short, miss one thing and you basically fail. As someone that' bad at test taking, I did bad but left understanding the material well :(

I can see how the material can become challenging but she is very good at explaining concepts and makes her tests very easy. The only reason I give her a difficulty of 2 instead of 1 is because she gives 3 midterms and 1 final. Material is easy to make calculatio mistakes on and even a small mistake on one of the tests is heavily reflected on grade

This class is really easy to do poorly in since the 3 midterms and the finals constitute 88% of your grade. That being said, there is a lot of practice tests you can do that will be almost the exact same as your test. The exams were more than fair. Homework however is way too long for such a little portion of your grade. Small curve (around 2%).
great lecturer; teaches concepts well; uses Zybooks; last 2 tests are harder than the first two (when she does the 4 tests a quarter)
Great teacher, her online instructions are clear. homework is straight related to exams, If u put effort in understanding the materials and preparing the test. easy to earn an A
Set schedule. Everything was very clear. I felt that I had to study a decent amount to get the grade I got -- but the tests were pretty fair.
One of the best ICS professors.
She is one of the best professors at ICS department. Everything was clear and organized. The tests are not too hard but challenging.

6D Overall, shes a good professor. However, at the end of the quarter she didnt care about our grades! The only thing that was important to her was fast grading. Thats why she gave us two confusing exams with NO partial credit, which is so hard if you miss just a number you wont get any credits! 4 tests, lots of HM and mandatory discussion!

Folks, Irani is a good teacher--much better than the person I took for 6B, folks. Class was online, you did most of your learning from going through the zybook chapters, followed by a short video of her explaining a concept/doing examples. Can't complain. Very nice and knowledgeable.

Best experience I had so far as a transfer student was taking a class with Professor Irani. She set the bar and I didn't realize it was rare. Well-organized, sanely structured class, sets you up for success as long you're studying and prepared. She's also really nice, I wish I had spoken with her about her career and asked for advice. But I was shy

Prof. Irani is amazing! The best professor I've had so far. Her lectures are very clear and zybooks is a really good etextbook. Her tests aren't too hard and she makes the class easy if you put in the work. Definitely the best 6b teacher and I got a pretty easy A in the class. Take her if she's available!

The lecture attendance is mandatory. There is a lot of homework to do and some of her homework questions are very hard. But the homework is only worth 5% in your total grade. As for the quizzes, as long as you understand all homework questions, it should be fine.

Makes the course unnecessarily difficult. Boolean Algebra is such an easy topic that anyone who works hard and has a brain should get an A+ To combat this, she gives exams with ONLY trick questions. Her TAs were useless and graded hw and exams very stingy. Lectures on easiest type questions, hw and old exams medium, current exams tricky

Amazing professor. She wrote the textbook herself and have tons of knowledge about this subject. Took her for 6B in Fall 2017. Midterms are slightly harder than previous ones but I would say they are really fair. Homework can be stressful if you decide to do them all at once before deadline. Overall an amazing experience 10/10 would recommend.

Sandy Irani is incredible with her lectures. She does the problems on the lectures slides live in class, and then posts them online. Her textbook for the class is also something she wrote, so whatever she explains in lecture will be easily understandable when reading the text. She decided to do four (easy) midterms and no final for Winter 2017.

Irani is a great lecturer! She creates her own lecture slides and works through the material in class with many examples, which she also posts online. Her tests are a breeze if you just go to lecture and do the required homework. Also winter quarter of 2017 she decided to have four midterms and no final! (no cumulative test to study for)

The material can be hard, but her lectures are really easy to follow. She goes through a ton of examples and posts her notes online. Her tests are really fair and if you do and understand the homework then you should do fine on the tests. She even has past tests for you to look at. This quarter she decided not to have a final (woot!)

Professor Irani is a great professor if you like having a good lecturer and if you like professors who are well organized and well prepared. Her course is well thought out and it has all of the resources you need to do well. She is probably the best ICS 6D/6B professor a student can take.

Irani is the most competent math teacher I have ever had. If i could go back in time and replace every math teacher with her, I would. Her lectures are excellent and always clearly impart what it is we're learning, which is a quality that is surprisingly hard to find. Go to lectures, go to discussions, read the book, and the tests will feel easy.
Sandy Irani is a good choice for the ICS 6 series. She's clear on her lectures but sometimes you can get lost while listening to one. Put your time and effort into this class and you'll get an A

She was a great teacher! The text book she wrote is pretty much what she will say in the lecture and she is really clear and concise about everything she says and does. She always stops for questions and she always answers the question. Her writing maybe a bit hard to read at times but overall she is a great professor. 10/10 WOULD RECOMMEND

I personally always used the textbook and never went to lecture and I got an A. I think the most important thing is to understand all the written homework and the readings and you will be fine. I didn't like her lecture notes because they were a bit messy. I wouldn't say this class is an "easy A" because you do have to put effort into it.

Prof. Irani is amazing. She wrote the textbook she uses! How many other people say that? That being said, the lectures are repetitive from the textbook. Beware, the final is harder than the tests. Attendance is not mandatory, but she uses attendance data to set the "curve", if any. Take her, you won't regret!
Amazing professor! She is very clear, and you learn a lot!

Irani is an amazing professor. She is really clear in her lectures, and also really clear in what she wants from you. The only problem I had was that the TA wasn't too fair in grading the homework. Other than that the class was fairly easy, and her tests aren't too bad especially if you just go through the book and study off the homework.

The class really isn't that bad. She respects her students and all the lectures are really, very straightforward. I skipped a few of her lectures and had no problem keeping up with her textbook alone.

Sandy is a wonderful teacher, I would take any class she was teaching. She is very clear about what she wants from you. Gives straightforward tests, and tells you what to study for them. If you do the homework and reading exercises, you will do great.
HW and quiz every week. She gives a lot of example. Quizzes are easy, final is ok.
Most organized professor I've had, and I really appreciate that. :)
Best Professor Ive ever taken. Exciting, funny and the inspirational. TAKE HER CLASS if you want a wonderful time and like to learn!

Took her for boolean and discrete. She is very organized, and if you do all the weekly reading and homework you will be fine. Maybe the only bad thing about her is her handwriting, but I didn't really care. Take the first few quizzes seriously, since the topics are easy you can get full grade, and quizzes are 60 percent. Take her!

She's really helpful and explain concepts clearly in lectures. Quizzes are easy if you read the book and do the homework. Not too much reading and homework each week. Will curve based on students' performances in final.

This was an easy class. Just do the weekly homework as best you can, and understand the solutions that she posts for the things you couldn't figure out, and you'll be fine for the quizzes. Lectures will usually help understand material for the homework, but you can still easily do well even if you don't go to all of them.

Professor Irani is one of those people who understands her students. Her assignments, quizzes, and exams are all fair, and she earnestly tries her best to get everyone in her class to pass. She responds to questions quickly and clearly, and willingly listens to any concerns her students may have. She is so nice, and one of my favorite professors.

I took the class during the summer for 5 weeks ICS 6D. Irani is probably the best prof you can get for the ICS math series. If you ask her questions, she'll make sure to help you understand a problem. She sometimes make a few typos while writing on the board sometimes, but she will do her best to make sure you understand the materials.
Really easy class with the online textbook requiring little reading. Clear notes in class that she posts online. Weekly hw can be done the day before. Weekly quizzes are easy.

She's a really good professor! She knows what she's talking about and understands all the concepts thoroughly behind the material. Great at explaining and easy class overall. 50% quizzes, 35% final, and then 15% HW/reading

I'd not take him again. He's basically talking to himself, doesn't really interact with students. Pre-class quiz is difficult, tons of homework but relatively easy, and weekly quiz is easy. There's no midterm but a normal final. Prepare to study on your own if you choose Ziv.
Very disorganized, read off the book during lectures. When answering a question he could be vague or not really answer it.

Everyone would complain about this class because Ziv is a little all over the place, but overall the class is whatever. Lecture and discussion are not required to attend. Zybooks is used in this course. Every week, there's a participation graded quiz, a homework assignment graded on correctness, and a test on that week's chapter.

Avoid him if possible. He doesn't really know what he is talking about during lectures, and he basically copied all the course materials from other professor. He never replied to emails or anything, just prepare to learn by yourself. However, if you finish all zybook readings and do homework, you should be able to get B or better.

Ripped every aspect of the class off of another professor, and yet somehow made it worse by shifting the order of quizzes/tests/homework leading to lower grade averages. Then reorganizes everything 2 weeks before finals. Unresponsive on piazza and emails. Lectures were useless; only read the textbook. If you do HW carefully and before tests, easy A

Prof. Ziv is one of those profs who only goes through zybook during lectures. He's not accessible outside class either, when I asked him a question he would only refer me to the TAs. Don't know what his other classes are like, but avoid him for ICS6B

The worst instructor I've had. He doesn't care about his students. Will ignore questions and concerns about basic, valid things. Syllabus was posted weeks into the course. Course structure was completely nonsensical and made it very difficult to prepare for tests. All he does is read from the textbook. Can't believe I payed for this course.
Reads the textbook as lecture, is incredibly disorganized and does not respond to emails.

Personally, Professor Ziv has been the worst teacher I have had at UCI so far. He truly lacks the ability to teach his students as he is unorganized and unstructured with his class rules, assignments, grading, etc. He responds late, and is very selfish as he expects the class to be at a certain standard when he does not reciprocate that back.

Shamed students for asking questions and never fully provided logistics for the course. Syllabus was finalized late. Don't bother asking questions on Piazza, friends help more. Questions were ignored for days/weeks. Entire canvas site + tests were Gassko's. Not a good lecturer, would just go over zybooks. Avoid

Can't say he is the worst, but he is very bad. Threat students who ask questions he can't answer that "Your post is inappropriate, and if you keep asking, we will close down the piazza for everyone". In the finals week, we can't even see our overall grade on Canvas.

Worst and laziest professor ever. Avoid him at all cost for ICS 6B. Does not care to teach or answer student questions on Piazza. Class is extremely disorganized. Tests and quizzes are harder than what is being taught. Rarely, if at all, will the TAs or the professor help you if you have questions about the homework or test.
Lectures read off of zybooks, give too much homework, and puts in too little effort. The syllabus wasn't finalized until week 5. Procrastinates more than any student I've seen and he's getting paid!
Don't know what his other class is like, but never take his 6B class!!! The worst and laziest professor I ever met.

He copied and pasted the course from Professor Gassko, but changed the structure of the course in a horrible way. Ziv's lectures are an audiobook and he does not put much effort into teaching. Do not take 6B with Ziv, it's too much work.

He doesn't know what teaching is, but he does know how to read zybook during lecture, borrow (or copy) materials from other professors. Unless you can learn by yourself very well, don't take this class.

Great professor IF YOU ARE GOOD AT LEARNING ON YOUR OWN. Professor will go over most of the materials during lecture, but they were too packed to comprehended. In a typical week, the reading probably took me 8 whole hours to read, 5 hours to do the hw, and 4 hours to do the quiz. The good thing is that he something mess stuff up and we got curved.

The course is super disorganized. He doesnt even care to change the syllabus that he copied from another prof. Test is vague too. Always have incorrect answers in his test and he doesnt want to fix it either. Lecture is read off from the zybook. Best thing u can is practice from Zybook. Lazy to change and update material, did it in last minute.

He takes his class material from other teachers, but either doesn't edit them to show changes or makes errors. Class was super disorganized with syllabus giving lots of conflicting information. Other than that, his lectures and discussions are extremely boring, and gave the same information as the online textbook. The lectures had synchronous exams

I don't know how she got this job. Does not know what she is teaching when it comes to MIPs, is super bad at teaching, and the class is overall super disorganized. TAs does all the MIPS coding teaching, and the professor just teaches everything else. Overall does not recommend
She is so bad, I wouldnt ever take her again. Didnt know what she was teaching for MIPS coding and the TAs were unorganized, bad class structure

Super enthusiastic lecturer, energy was infectious despite being a morning class, and her passion shone in the way she taught. Exams, homeworks and labs were reasonable if not on the easier side. Biggest complaints are the TAs, and the lack of accessibility of the professor.

She is not accessible at all! She talks extremely fast, doesn't record lectures (although she should because it's hard to understand her), and her slides are everywhere. I learned everything from her TA team during discussion which helped with my understanding but when it came to exams, they make a lot of mistakes.

yo croski. I have a 2.9 GPA, failed most of my CS classes and had to retake them. This class was a whole different story. Didnt read the textbook, go to lecture, study for the tests or do anything. Easiest A+ of my life. Nobody I know didnt get an at least an A in this class. Highly reccomend for the brampton yutes that need a grade boost.

nice professor. bad teaching team.

The teaching team makes so many mistakes and does not take accountability for them. They expect students to correct the team's mistakes and will mark students' correct answers wrong then refuse to give points back. The professor is nice though and deserves a better teaching team.

The lectures are too quick, and explanations are hard to understand. The slides are unorganized, and information is hard to find, and some slides and answer keys have misinformation. Extra time has to be taken to study outside of class, since lectures are hard to learn from. Staff is unresponsive.

if you had to go through prime irene gassko 6B with spec grading, bozorgzadeh is genuinely 1000000x times worse. the lectures don't really make sense, the slides are incomprehensible, and the TAs are nonexistent. the ed discussion is a destitute wasteland where it takes 2 weeks for anything to be responded to. its a self taught course.

70% of grade is exams, 20% is assembly projects, and 10% is homework. Very poor grading system. Rarely you will find a slide without a mistake. Sample exam solutions have billion mistakes. Exams have corrections that are made during the exam time. No one responds on ed discussion. Professor doesn't respond to her email. TA's don't respond.
Midterms + finals weigh about 70%. TAs upload wrong answers. In person their answers conflict. Lecture slides are just bunch of images. Gotta study by yourself.

Most unorganized class ever, I can't even begin to describe what a pain this class was. The TA's never respond and are so unhelpful, no one wants to help you learn the topics so you have to learn everything by yourself. the midterms and final are 70% of your grade. the material would be fun if there was actual structure. would rather retake 33 + 6b

Very disorganized class… She doesn't provide lecture recordings and the slides are messy. 3 exams and 1 final. The exam contents are completely different than the practice exam and it's way harder! TA never respond to questions on ed…
absolute worst class ever.

she seems really nice and i think this is her first time teaching this course so she used Dutt's lecture slides (which are horrible, sometimes just pictures with no explanation) and so i had to self study a lot. trust issues with this class bc TAs would have the wrong sample exam solutions. exams were not similar to the sample exams. hw was easy.

Truly a horrible experience. This class was all over the place and there was no support from TAs or the professor herself. TAs will update the solutions to practice exams (only because students corrected them) at 11 pm the night before the midterm. Very disappointed, considering I enjoy the content of the class.

Lecture slides nor lectures were very clear, so the textbook is very helpful. If you have a fever on test day, they'll still make you take it day of because you didn't inform them that you were planning to be sick beforehand. The last midterm was very different from the sample, unlike previous exams, so beware. HW and labs aren't too bad.
im taking 51 and 45c together, shes better than nadia ahmed.
No one responds on ed discussion.
VERY BAD PROFESSOR AND TAs!!!!!!!!!!! Entire course needs to be rewritten.

This entire class was/is a gigantic mess. The slides are confusing and inconsistent. They use different conventions on every example. The homework questions are vague at best and ask things that were never mentioned in lecture. There is a shocking lack of communication between course staff and students on how to complete assignments.
Great professor but with bad TAs. 3/5 for professor is because of TAs. She deserves 5/5 because of good lectures.

I was worried about taking a class that my friends claimed was one of the toughest in our major. However, the professor was an effective communicator, and taught at a slow pace, making it easy for me to follow along. Although the course relied heavily on discussions for projects, but the exams primarily focused on lecture material. Best prof in ICS

Drops lowest non-final exam, lecture quiz, and hw assignment. Final had 10% of extra credit. Recordings available on yuja. sample exams helped.

As many tries as needed on labs, only 1 extra test case per subproblem.

Very disorganized class. TAs often gave conflicting answers, slides in some sections were inaccurate, hw questions very ambiguous.

She missed the first day of lecture, and that kind of set the tone for the entire quarter. She is a kind person, but I found her lectures hard to focus on, and some of her teaching was straight up wrong. I wished she gave better examples. Exams had many typos and confusion. Overall a very disorganized class, but my experience was not miserable.
There is never partial credit for any of the homework and  exams good luck if you miss a question with 8 points.
The quizzes and exams are brutal, the lectures do not cover any of the materials in the exams.

Weekly quizzes, 4 projects, 3 midterms (one on Week 10) and 1 final. Stopped going to her lectures and studied the notes instead because the lectures felt like a waste of time. They weren't engaging and I didn't comprehend the material from her lecturing. The TAs do most of the teaching for Assembly language bc she can't. Easier than Wongma tho.

Although I do not like the way the class was structured (very very test heavy), I would still take it with this prof as it'll be easier than wongma. 

TBH I do not think the prof knows MIPS/assembly (only the TAs/tutors know)

Hw was hard but can get 100s if you try hard
Tests were very niche and not like sample tests she gives

final + tests = 60%

Dont know how easy this course is when its online, but it aint the case now. I REPEAT, IT AINT THE CASE. The in person exams are HARD. She will tell you to study in one direction and the exam be in another direction. She will tell you something will not be on the exam but turns out ON the exam.

This course was very disorganized, but fairly easy. The TA taught all the assembly concepts, and the Professor seemed to not know about that part of the class. MIPS lab projects were autograded with infinite submissions so they were easy. Quizzes were easy to miss some points on but 2 are dropped. Exams had lots of partial credit so not too bad.
Not super responsive and very hard to get in contact with. However, lectures are clear and the class is super easy.
She ghosted our piazza. She get's things wrong. She forgets to upload lectures sometimes. Very inaccessible. Labs are fair.
Study practice exam

(online) She is kind and engaging during lectures, but it's difficult to contact her outside of class since she doesn't check Piazza or email super often. Your best shot is to go to lab sections. The labs were quite easy but might be hard if you haven't finished ICS 32/33. Exams/quizzes had few questions so points were hit or miss, but doable!
Week 9 exam was too unfair. You may contact with prof and TA only by lecture(zoom), but not by email, piazza or whatever.
Never ever take this course online. There are only one TA responded on the piazza. Tests are so unfair. :(
I would really avoid

Lectures were fine and well-taught, discussions went well, labs were relevant and challenging. However, the logistics of this class need a serious overhaul. TA's and Prof were impossible to contact, not lenient given extenuating circumstance, bi-weekly quizzes were a mess, questionnaires (basically a post-lab test) were too difficult. Just a mess.

I'm not sure how her ICS 51 class was before the pandemic, but her online class is a total mess. The professor and the ta's all don't respond on email or piazza, so no one ever knows whats going on in the class. There are weekly quizzes but there are constant incorrect answers, lab questionnaires/quizzes are way too hard, week 9 exam was too unfair

I personally really enjoyed her lectures. Sure they might have been a bit messy but if you went to her lecture and watched her assemble everything on the spot, things made a ton of sense. Assembly has a huge learning curve but after the first project youll get the hang of it. Grades are evenly weighed too, 30% 35% 35%. Loved the class and prof

personally found her lectures the only way to learn but a lot of my friends hated them; textbook barely used like twice for homework problems; do well on the first quiz cuz she'll drop one of them; only go to labs run by Emad he teaches assembly and explains concepts really well

her lectures are an absolute mess, she does not really understand the material she teaches and just reads her slides and draws messy pictures. if you dont get exact output on labs, no credit. ta's in this class are absolutely useless.

Has non-mandatory ZyBook(don't get it). Lectures/discussions/labs are optional except for quiz/test days. I didn't attend class, still got a B-. I got a 60% on the final, 100%'s on the projects(takes like 1 full day at most to do), and averaged 8 on the quizzes. Lowest quiz dropped, but the quizzes are out of 10, making it easy to lose points.

This course is not well-organized, and her lectures are poor and not worth going to - they can get quite confusing as she rambles and doesn't explain things well. The slides are not very well made either. Requires an expensive Zybooks for the course. Quizzes are similar to the samples, and assembly labs are pretty easy, and there's only 3 of them.

Quizzes  sample quizzes, same with the final so no curveballs. Explains and works problems out. Posts slides online. Assembly labs are not bad if you put in effort. >50% people get 100 percent on them. Much better choice than the other professors for this class. Bad thing: makes you do zybooks ($80) for credit and you use a tiny part of it

I didn't go to lecture very often but when I did, she mostly just went over readings from the homework. I felt like the class was fair. There was plenty of time for the assignments, TAs and Piazza were very helpful, the quizzes weren't too hard, practice quizzes were available, and there was extra credit for participating on Piazza. Good overall.

She tends to tell, not show, and when she tries to show, not tell, she is mediocre at best. I've noticed more empty seats in her lectures as the quarter went on. Our zyBook was pretty good. Labs were difficult, but they were in MIPS (not x86) and there were only 3 of them. Quizzes usually have MIPS; see her sample quizzes to study. Not my fav prof

Lecture can be super long and dry (you will zone her out very often, because she just talks for long stretches of time, without having something to point at). However the class has been fair and her practice quizzes are exactly like the actual graded quizzes. Assembly programs are meh, but we didn't have to write much assembly on quizzes.

The concepts of the class is really confusing and there's a lot of stuff (concepts in lecture, assembly in discussion, and the labs are take a while to do). She draws diagrams and stuff in lecture that help but it's still confusing, I had to reread slides. However she is super generous with curve at the end. MUST go to discussion to learn assembly!

Does a good job making the material interesting. Will go on tangents, but relevant and interesting ones.  Provides plenty of study material (old quizes and tests). No midterm but quizes every other week. If you understand the material covered quizes shouldnt be hard.  The class has fairly challenging labs but you have plenty of time to do them.

Missed the first class and has been rushing the material ever since. She can't explain any of the material well and rambles on during lecture. All online notes are extremely unclear and solutions always seem to have the wrong answers or use the wrong numbers. Her requirements are extremely unclear for quizzes and materials are extremely unorganized
Man, what can I say

She claimed LA is a great resource for helping us study, and want us to reach out to human more instead of internet. Which is even more frustrating for a course that is already messed up
Let him who values his sanity and breath eschew this course, for madness lies herein. Pursue not this study, if thou dost cherish a sound mind and a tranquil life.
honestly, why did the school even hire her
exams full of trivial questions, doesn't teach anything. uses all her class time explaining all the confusing rules and systems she requires students to follow.
very enthusiastic but has no absolutely idea how to teach
mean, insufferable, brags about herself all the time but not actually teaching things

a lot of busywork, complicated instructions and requirements but not effective at all

Every thing is self taught, brags about her duaghter  EVERY lecture. Gaslights students

I was on the waitlist during the 1st week, and when I was added to the class list at 11PM on Sunday of the 1st week, I saw a ton of unfinished assignments.Based on Canvas, there wasn't anyway to submit late assignments. And then there was a lab exam for Monday and a lecture exam on Tuesday of the 2nd week. I hadn't even learned anything yet!
No, need to say more
if this was my first experience taking a cs course i'd probably cry. alfaro is a nice woman but idk if this class is really effective at teaching. personally would give her a 2.5
