No pre-experience with Python, never coded. She gives 4 retake opportunities for 8 exams, and I didn't even use them all. If you took the time to read over the material and practice a lot with her past exam questions, then you should be fine for the lab exams, and the lecture exams were basically just vocab-based, just memorize your things.

Everything is self taught, the only way to somewhat learn from her is going to her office hours, two tests every two weeks, labs are hard, and the lectures are mandatory and not helpful . Please do yourself a favor and don't take her unless you want to learn everything on your own.

She's a nice person/good lecturer depending on her mood that day. If she's in a bad mood, she literally ends class if someone doesn't answer her questions and leaves you to learn on your own. The textbook readings sucked but they were helpful. The class is easy if you have previous experience in Python but it could be pretty difficult if you don't.
For an intro class, she didn't teach anything. The class was very test heavy and wasnt helpful when asking for help.

Essentially had to teach myself 95% of the material. The workload was heavy and exams were frequent. She is harsh and unreasonable. She even locked the course on Canvas right after the quarter ended. The Zybook was helpful, lol.

She seems nice, but the class structure wasn't beginner friendly. Attendance is mandatory every day. Assignments due everyday. Labs were hard and lectures were not helpful. Bi-weekly exams were very stressful. The workload made it hard to keep up.

The professor was friendly and taught okay, but I didn't like the structure of the class and the TA's were soo unhelpful. There were two exams every other week and it was pretty stressful. Class was also mandatory and everyday. The labs were way harder than the material taught in class. The last exam dropped my grade.
Doesn't lecture at all, basically self taught. Avoid
Alfaro seems like a really nice lady but this class sucks. She doesn't teach well and the TA's/LA's are useless. Did not learn anything, super hard tests. Ended up finishing the 30 series through CC.
It's so frustrating to be tested on material we've never been taught.

Wouldn't take this class again. Has extra work after finals(why???). Participation activities, such as formative assessments, don't seem helpful at all, and the quizlets provided were also very basic and did not help with lecture exams. Lab exams were far more difficult than the lab practice problems.

RUN! AS FAST AS YOU CAN!
Honestly, if you're not a major or you don't need this class as a prerequisite, there is ZERO reason to torture yourself for ten weeks. PROF AND TAS ARE HELPLESS.
Maybe UCI shouldn't have let her monopolize this class — it basically means no one's holding her accountable, so she just gets to do whatever she wants on stage.

I was excited to start learning Python during my first quarter at UCI, but felt like I was experiencing the same disappointment that a lot of people here had, too. Overall difficulty of the class, exams biweekly, and expected to complete work every single day, it's highly unrealistic. Also, the TAs weren't very helpful via EdDiscussion. Good. Luck.
no need to say more
There are so many exams and tons of homework. The professor barely teaches, so it's basically all self-study. I feel like I get backstabbed all the time.

This has to be one of the worst classes at UCI; the classes require code memorization on briefly covered topics, which places a heavy burden on individuals with no coding experience whatsoever. I was lucky to be knowledgeable in Python, but I still often struggle. Some of my peers are really stressed over this singular class alone.

Subpar professor who lacks teaching skills and social awareness. Self-studying is the only thing that'll help you in this class as the textbook is almost useless, exams are weird and the practice she provides you with doesn't really prepare you for them.
Plzzz avoid the professor for a wonderful first year of ur college and python beginner experience!!!!!
She didn't teach class at all, you basically all need to learn by yourself. And the textbook is too expensive and you need to take exam nearly every weeks
Crazy professor
Everything is self taught(still mandatory attendance, makes students feel like first graders, is a joke I hope ICS 31 is changed for the future years.

This damn professor doing way too much treating us like we're in middle school. Someone give her a reality check and make her realize that she's teaching full grown adults and not 7 year olds. Lectures are useless but are mandatory for participation which is stupid. Her lab rulesets are the dumbest thing ever and make negative sense.
Always self-study but the test is really hard.

really bad way of teaching a course and very messy study structures plan, and 90% times exam and 100% self study and only 1 actual lecture per week, that too 60% time devoted solving a paper, and teaching is done in office hours

every lecture is a bit of a waste of time but participation is required. class structure very confusing for no reason, that even the TAs and LAs are not on the same page about a lot of things. i learn more just through zybooks and chat gpt.
Great professor! collabortion matters! improves relationships between students by group assignments and partners. Easy class overall.

I'm struggling in the class, and I have five years of programming experience in other languages. Don't take her unless you have to. Lecture and lab are either group works or exams. She does not do anything but leaving a bunch of works you need to do outside of class. The exams are heavy. If you care about your gpa, you'd better avoid her.
She teaches nothing but tests everything. Also, the exam is hard. We need to study everything by ourselves.
Too much assignments

I LOVE HERRRRR! She's such a caring and a great professor! I swear to god if there is a chance, i will def take her again!
always bragging about her own stories and not lecture anything useful

If you do and understand all the work and take advantage of the 4 retake opportunities (8 total exams, so you can retake half of them), I felt that it was pretty easy to do well in the class (I've never done python before). For the coding exams, she gives practice problems that are very similar to those on the exam.

Really easy course, and structure of class allows professor to be really hands-off. Very little work during the first half, but picks up during the second half with papers to write. YMMV as TAs grade very differently, but in my experience it was mostly a busy work class.

Hurry up, you won't want to take her class. There are two weekly tests, extremely low grades, useless classes, and she doesn't teach anything except for group tasks. If you're still hesitating whether or not to take her class, run away from her for your GPA.

Pretty awful. You'll have two exams every other week, one coding and one written, which got tiring very quickly. They're also worth 75% of your grade. She barely lectures in her mandatory lecture where you'll spend half of doing busy work in groups. You also have to show up to lab twice a week. Avoid if you're new to coding and can't self-study.
she is NOT teaching anything useful in class. a bad teacher and a lot of homewprk
do not take her unless you have to. she is NOT teaching anything useful in class. self learning is important

Overall a decent professor. The course material difficulty sorta jumps all over the place, and the course was somewhat disorganized. The project we did took a long time, so do it early, and in lab and lecture exams were generally pretty easy

DO. NOT. TAKE. ALFARO. Unless you absolutely have no choice, do not take Alfaro. There are two tests every other week, and your weekly work is participation activities, textbook problems, challenge problems, labs, videos, a quiz (graded on accuracy) and a study guide on top of all the studying you have to do. The tests are graded so harshly.

The material is difficult if you don't have prior knowledge but professor Alfaro structures her course well. Practice the quizlet and the chapter 13 problems and you should be fine. She also allows 4 retakes on lecture and lab exams. Don't let the ratings scare you, she is not bad at all. Put in the work and you will pass (plus she guarantees a C-)

Guys, trust whatever comment there is on RMP, do not take her, unless you have to. She's unreachable, never replies to students' emails, the leture is completely useless, she makes lab mandatory mid-way through the quarter, overall DO NOT take!

New to python student review:
Work: 12-16 hours (outside of classes) : lectures are videos  - zybook assignments

Mandatory attendance: 2 to 4 days a week. 2 exams bi-weekly (do study guides & videos again: medium difficulty)

Alfaro: Caring - dislikes lecturing -> leans on videos
(+) 4 retake exams
(-) Made Friday attendance mandatory
(-) work:(

Lectures felt pretty useless. Lab/Lecture exams biweekly. She does offer retakes. Taught primarily off of zybooks. Class is easy if you've coded before, but otherwise moves relatively fast, especially the second half of the quarter. 

Definitely ask for help at office hours or with TAs if you have any questions you will need to.

True that she doesn't teach, but she will go over concepts if you ask. It's hard to teach coding, but she tries. Very structured class; hard to fail. A lot of work. Class is easy if you have some prior programming knowledge.

As a person, she's very sweet. However, her class is extremely difficult and she isn't the best lecturer. Her LA's and TA's also aren't very helpful. They usually just say "I don't know" to questions. Good luck.
genuinely one of the worst professors, just talking with no purpose, course structured very badly. Coding not hard, but terrible terrible professor.

Her video lectures were a complete waste of time... not even close to actual lectures, but more like small talk. You won't gain any deep knowledge of the concepts, just for lecture exam (sometimes not even that). All of the above applies only to lecture, not lab. The lab is easy, especially if you have prior experience. Well, u got no choice :)

Horrible professor, she doesn't know how to structure her office hours. I have to literally wait for 45 minutes just to get to speak to her for 5 minutes. She does a lot of saying that she cares about her student, but honestly, she doesn't! Good luck taking her class thinking it will be good for you!

Ask yourself: When was the last time your teacher made you follow a seating chart? If your answer was "in high school', I have great news for you: You can finally relive the wonders of having to sit with random people for absolutely no reason when you take Shannon Alfaro's class! 

There's also 2 exams per week and the paper one is pretty rough.

This class depends on how much time you put into self-learning. She will not teach you at all. If you are completely new to coding, DON'T TAKE this professor's class. I wonder why professors exist if they don't teach. However, If you put in much time, B- is doable. I couldn't put enough time in ICS31 since I also took calc and ICS6B.

6+ assignments every week, a lecture and lab exam every other week, 0 useful lectures, 99% self-taught from zybook, and way too complicated classroom structure. At the beginning of the course, I didn't want to believe the numerous bad reviews. Simply topics are made challenging and overall this class is pure frustration. Awful

I've been going through the recent reviews and cannot believe how I am relating to these comments! Professor Alfaro is simply not just the one to take, just looking at the sheer amount of one star rating she got (212 right now), and not trusting them, I fully regret my decision. DO NOT TAKE THIS!
RUN! Attendance Mandatory, Boring Lecture, lots of homework, there's always a different professor in spring for ICS so please save yourself!

RUN!!!!! Reading all the recent comment, I understand why she's a 2.2 as of right now! If you're still thinking about a decent GPA and a class where you get to study and understand it, run from this one!

Do not take this class! This professor makes her useless lecture mandatory, she doesn't know how to teach. All she does is just make you learn through zybooks! Ur tuition is being wasted here! Please save yourself from her! There will always be a better alternative professor during the Spring quarter! Please do yourself a favor and leave!

I just took this Professor Fall 2024, I highly recommend you guys to stay away from this class since there will be another ICS during the spring quarter, it is simply just not worth the time! I hope you guys are ready for ar ride and think this is an easy class! The professor also never replies to her email, so GOODLUCK!

I do not recommend you guys to take Alfaro if you guys are not ready for it! All the lecture were useless to your grade, but it is mandatory. She never replies to her email and please just save yourself from next quarter, there will be a different instructor that will be better than her!

Professor Alfaro does not lecture, however the class is structured with a lot of resources for students to succeed, if you put in the work you can do it. Test retakes are available. A lot of homework every week. Group work on Thursdays and you have to do labs with a partner. Time consuming so I wouldn't take this class with other difficult courses.

I have just taken a class with professor Alfaro, trust me if you're not good at coding this class is not for you. The professor never replies to your email, so it's up to you and your TA. If you think this is an easy coding class then think again!

Despite her overall rating, she's not all that bad of a professor. She really cares about her students and offers retakes for every exam, whether it's programming on the computer or on paper (the only exam without a retake is the final). As a bonus, if you've taken any entry-level CS course before, this class will be pretty easy.
She is an average professor, but you have to teach everything by your own. She does not prepare you a lot about the projects and exams. However, if you put much time in self-learning, B is Doable.

She was a great professor and cared about her students. Assignments weren't too difficult, there were just a lot of them so it's easy to fall behind. Make sure to go to her office hours if you really need help, she's super nice. Make sure to get things done ahead of time and study for the lecture exams so you can use retakes on lab (TRUST).

SURVIVED MY 1ST CS CLASS. Fast paced, self-study beforehand helps if never programmed b4 (i struggled). Expect wkly hw (zybooks=txtbook; it cost $), vid quizzes (ez) & labs (work w partner, strict deadlines). Biwkly in-lecture (do study guide) & lab exams (hard, prac zyb). 1-2 projects. Lectures mid, assigned groups but 10/10 experience +goated LAs

She doesn't teach a lot in lectures, for some people that may be a downside, but the material isn't that complicated, if you set 3 hours a week aside for this class, getting a B or A isn't too hard. The tests are easy if you do the optional study guides/practice problems, but there's alot. Overall, if you put in the work the class is an easy pass.

First time taking a CS course in my life. She doesn't teach in lectures but gives you a lot of resources to be able to succeed on your own -- zybooks, weekly partner labs, practice exam questions, python tutor, videos, retakes. Lecture and lab exams every other week. Totally fair and doable, people who rate her low just didn't put in the effort.

Exams every 2 weeks and learning is mostly done through zybooks. Don't expect to learn much from lectures so a lot of self studying. There are retakes for exams which was pretty chill and the professor also posts additional lecture material on canvas. Ngl, this wasn't too bad of a class if u put in like a few hours everyday.

Yes she doesn't teach - in the actual lecture time. She teaches through video lectures, watch them! She explains in the first week why she doesn't use lecture time to teach and gives us lots of resources to learn on our own. Also, the final was a group final, not cumulative, and only worth 7% of your grade.
NONONONONONONONO!

If you can, avoid. She doesn't teach and the class is essentially entirely self-taught. Her automated grading system makes everything 100x harder for every single person involved. She is not accessible and the TAs and LAs can barely even answer your questions when it comes to explaining your score on an exam.
ANNOOOOOYYYINGGGGGGGGGGGGGG. attendance MANDATORY, lectures USELESS.

I had prior CS experience (AP CSA, AP CSP) so content was pretty easy to understand (this would be pretty fast paced and confusing otherwise) never learned anything in lectures (zzz) lots of reading and learning on your own through zybooks, but she does have a lot of resources/people you can reach out to. labs mandatory (bane of my existence).

ICS31 is a fast-ish paced class for those who have not learned Python before. Everything is learned through ZyBooks along with lecture videos. Tests every other Monday and Tuesday, and labs are mandatory. Prof Alfaro is nice but if you need help get it early.
Alfaro's ICS31 is a fast-paced course, but she provides plenty of resources. With dedication and self-practice, it's manageable. Try unstuckstudy ai and other tools to stay on top of the work.

I think prof.alfaro get a bad rep. learning programming is like learning a new language. the class is very fast pace and if you are not ready you will be behind but i think she provides a lot of resources and ways for her students to get intuition of programming and the problem solving skill. try to do everything to get most practice!
Very caring professor, accessible outside of class. Easy class if you read the textbook. Easy A. Watch the date. Love from ICU.
too much hw

As someone completely new to programming, I felt as though reading off the online textbook wasn't the most useful way to do things. She barely lectures and class time is mostly dedicated to tests or group formative assessments, which I wasn't a fan of. She is nice and offers support through office hours though. Offers retakes for exams.

If she came up to with the curriculum, then she's a poor instructor. If she didn't, then the ICS31 curriculum is the one at fault. She does give you a lot of tries to make mistakes BUT the jump from week 4-5 is insane the projects are insane you're expected to go from zero to HERO and be super proficient at what she taught you.

She's really helpful and offers retakes for lecture exams and lab exams. If this is your first time coding, be prepared to self-practice and go to all resources you can. Unless your me and just kinda thugged it out. You can get an A and she let us know that if we put in the effort, we would at least get a B. Which was true lol (not done yet tho)

The material is incredibly easy. Alfaro herself is okay-- she's nice enough, caring, and a decent lecturer. 

She structures the class in a way that makes it seem much more intense than it needs to be, and it's fairly test-heavy. The constant attendance gets annoying, and there are a LOT of assignments.

This professor is amazing!!!!!!!! She truly cares about students and their well being, and helps them achieve their desired grade with no judgement for it. She understands that students may struggle, and has really been there to help both the whole class and individual students who need more assistance.
BEST PROF EVER!!!!
She is the Adonis of ICS31, very good teacher and helpful to upcoming programming cs nerds
Not hard to get an A, but we should study by ourself. The professor does not really teach us a lot, however, if you work hard to study, then it will be not hard to get an A-
Really good professor, I heard she made ICS31 way easier than before and teaches you a lot about python. Easy A as long as you attend lab to try and get help and very beginner friendly.

She's a chill and nice professor. You're mostly graded on lab exams (which are based on previous lab questions that are released) and lecture exams (which can test on things that aren't strictly taught but retakes are pretty free). There is group work every week for the labs, but the content is taught manageably, just don't procrastinate too much.

Biweekly lecture and lab exams, lab exams are very easy (just do the zybook past lab exam questions) and you'll be fine. Lecture exams are a lot more challenging and go over topics you don't really think about, but there are retakes. The 1-star ratings are bots, she's a nice person and a fair professor. Easy to get an A

Pretty cool professor and very fun. The class was not too hard and is based on biweekly exams. The content is mostly self taught, but there are helpful lecture videos. Minimal lecturing in class, basically just group work. Labs are partnered, you can skip labs if you finish early. Two big projects. Overall a decent intro class.

after actually taking this professor, i actually enjoyed her teaching style. gave us lots of practice in class and the zybooks activities were digestible. just beware of the projects, they're pretty challenging def don't procrastinate.

She was an average professor. She provides some resources you'll need and is generally nice, but that's about it. You'll learn mainly through Zybooks and other resources you find on your own. For an introductory class, it's alright. How difficult the class is will depend on how much time/effort you're willing to put in, as she won't be much help.

Professor Alfaro really isn't that bad, especially compared to some of the other professors in the School of ICS. While most of the material is learned through Zybooks, she's pretty helpful if you go to her office hours (which 95% of students in the class never utilize). The workload is definitely heavy, but manageable.

She has no lectures and puts them online, so it is hard to learn the material unless you teach yourself. There 2 tests every 2 weeks and 2 zyprojects which she doesn't prepare you for. Overall the class is workable if you teach yourself everything

She's p bad. Bragged about how amazing her students do. Does not prepare u for the BIG zybooks project on week 7 which mainly requires working knowledge of content we covered only a week prior. Ppl who do well have been coding for a long time. Prepare yourself for the week 7 PROJECT!!! but it's still doable ig, not failing the class lol
this class gave me a 504 plan.

I feel like without any python experience, going into this class is straightup awful! Most of her contents is just through ZyBooks, and she doesn't do anything practical in her lectures. I mostly depended on my previous experiences, but the level of difficulty her class has should not be considered an "introductory" course.

Nice person, but as a Professor, fails to utilize her time effectively to teach her students about programming. A lot of the time is you learning on your own reading the textbook, and lecture times and labs are utilized to the best advantage. Also there are exams every two weeks (but not as bad) as you're given a certain number of retakes.

Her lectures may not be the most helpful for you since she often makes it a Q&A session, where she oftentimes takes a lot of time to demonstrate a particular concept. Thus, you'll be doing most of your learning in the zyBooks.

Prepare for the in-lecture written exams and lab coding exams every week, & grind the two big projects.

The content itself is very difficult but the Professor herself is caring and tries to provide help as much as she can. You basically have to teach yourself throughout the course from Zybooks and labs. It is not easy for beginners.

I spent around 30 hours each week on this one class. The labs start out easy but get very difficult around week 5. There were lots of office hours and instructions for each assignment were very clear. Difficult class but has lots of learning opportunities.

Biggest complaints are from the lectures and labs. They are both not used in a time efficient manner. The lectures are not very instructional, if at all, and the labs occur in partners, where you essentially sharing a keyboard. Zybooks has also been mentioned in other comments. The class feels that it is made way more difficult than it needs to be.
Be ready to cry at 2am if you take her class. She is not helpful at all! ONE OF THE WORST PROFESSORS.
She never cares about her students...... She is not qualified as a professor at all.
Trust me bro, do not take her class. I wonder how such a irresponsible professor get into UCI......
learning how to success
The class was really hard for a beginner class but Professor Alfaro was really helpful and accessible outside of class, helping many students during lab/office hours.

i can clearly tell she cares about her students but the first few weeks were HELL bc i had 0 experience in coding, would test us on theory that she skimmed over, etc. leveled out near the end with more practical problems. def do the zybook practice problems (she tests on random stuff from there for first test as well like converting to ascii)
Need to study on your own by Zybook, she does not teach at all. But the grading criteria is fine, yoou can drop lowest lab which is good.

Most of your learning will be self-taught through labs and ZyBooks. The exams for this quarter were separated by lab and lectures every other week. Lab exams were fine, but lecture exams are especially vocab-heavy. For a programming class, I didn't know I would write so many notes. This class was easy for me, but not so much for beginners.

I remember in the beginning of the quarter, I didn't know how to code. 
i still don't know how to code
we love professor zybooks

Professor Alfaro was extremely kind and supportive to all students and there are several opportunities to get an A in the class. You can retake practically every test a week after the first attempt and she gives more than enough time for assignments.

Beware of the 5 star reviews!! They all say the same thing and were submitted at the same time(bots prob). This class will rely heavily on zybooks and not her teaching.  Unless you already have experience coding and can pick up concepts fast, good luck.  Her grading system was very unforgiving and so was she.  TAs and LAs will be your best friend.
Prof Alfaro is super fun and caring, she does her best to answer as many questions as she can during lecture. However, never email her, you will never hear back unless messaged through ed discussion.
It's an ok intro course. The Zybooks work is straightforward and pretty easy, and there's opportunity for extra credit. The project around week 7 is daunting but not make or break.

There's a lot of stuff to do, but the grading is pretty easy. I have a few late assignments and no credits were taken off. I got points taken off from the first few projects, but the later ones that worth more points were all graded pretty lightly.
LOTS OF HOMEWORK

Super cute professor, the lecture is interesting and we play games in class (on zoom) from time to time. Learned a lot through textbook and LAs' office hours help a lot! Programmed my first python project--2048 in this class, fell in love with cs because of this professor and learning assistants.

It will be tough if you have absolutely no experience, but not impossible. Good luck, and do chapter 13.I believe that the reviews here don't actually reflect how the course actually is or how Professor Alfaro actually is. It's true that you will learn basically everything from the ZyBooks, but in my opinion, it's a good resource.

I believe that the reviews here don't actually reflect how the course actually is or how Professor Alfaro actually is. It's true that you will learn basically everything from the ZyBooks, but in my opinion, it's a good resource.
Going into this class I was scared because of all the ratings I saw on this website and I am proud to say that they are so false.

I was scared for this class because of the reviews but I can proudly say that they are false. Professor Alfaro was extremely kind and supportive to all students and there are several opportunities to get an A in the class.

this professor absolutely SUCKS for beginners, you are better off taking a two week online paid course. she teaches through ZYBOOKS which is the most scuffed textbook for learning coding. lectures are more q&a then teaching/learning, which is hard b/c if you don't know anything how are you going to get anything out of these lectures. 

TDLR: don't

If you have programming experience (a lot), then this class will be easy for you. But for most people, this lesson is a road full of mine. You never know which chapter's content will blow you up. So please choose this class carefully, it is an introductory class for CS majors and a class to prove your strength.

enjoy learning everything from zybooks lol
project grading is a joke

Supposed to be an introductory class to programming, however, teacher does not help you learn but rather just uses the textbook. For people who are not CS gods already this class is dreadful and will make you want to rethink your life choices of pursuing CS.

If you take this professor you will hate everything related to coding. Bootcamp is a better option than taking her class. Doesn't teach so you basically try to understand super complex topics by using the textbook, her ego is through the roof, and she thinks she is funny. Worst professor I've ever had at UCI. Underpaid TA's are saving the lecture.
she sucks
please watch out when taking this class ESPECIALLY IF YOU HAVE NEVER TAKEN A CODING CLASS IN YOUR LIFE. the concepts will be so hard to grasp and she will not teach you anything. you're on your own.

BRO AVOID THIS TEACHER IF YOU ARE NOT A CS MAJOR LIKE DONT EVEN TRY TO SWITCH TO CS THIS IS THE WORST PROFESSOR!!!! I HAD TO BECEAUSE IM A CS MAJOR

SHE DOES NOT TEACH, AND ALL SHE DOES IN LECTURE IS TELLING YOU HOW DID SHE WENT FROM FALLING FRESHMAN YEAR AT UCR TO 4.0 LAST YEAR!! LIKE BRO I DONT CARE JUST TEACH THE CODE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
worst professor, don't take her class, if possible, falsely graded my grade and not explaining anything.

She falsely.accused me of cheating(possibly her retaliation for my harsh faculty review), lowering me from an A+ to A-. The academic integrity center dropped it after I talked to them. Yet the damage done to me is irreversible as you can imagine.
Lectures are pretty unorganized, had much easier time learning just from the textbook. Hard to contact and not always very helpful.
She teach nothing. Just reading textbook. I've been studying on my own for a whole quarter.

Professor Alfaro's low ratings aren't justified. The class was on ZyBooks and we had weekly labs. If you did the readings and time managed well it was doable. Study for lab exams as they were the hardest part of the class. Midterm and final were pretty easy but the practice versions were nothing like them. I wish she used lectures better though.
Useless lectures
Lectures are kinda long, but tests are not hard. Lab exam, however, is pretty hard.

Don't listen to these ratings. Professor Alfaro is by far the most caring professor I have had here at UCI. ICS 31 is not an easy class to teach, and she did it so well. Don't be spooked by the amount of projects/exams/assignments. Everything is doable as long as you put in some practice each week. Would take again without a doubt.

Many droppable assignments. Prof tried to make lectures fun. Group worksheet during lectures was fun. BUT beware of surprises on exams because she often put things not previously taught in class nor on Zybook (online homework) in the exams.

Take it if you like learning things on your own. If you are good at scheduling your own assignments, this class shouldnt be too dreadful. Her lectures honestly werent nearly as helpful as the zyBooks labs, readings, and exercises. The TAs and LAs were all great though! Its a much easier class if you have a bit of prior programming experience.

ICS 31 is a hard class for complete beginners (like me). I think professor Alfaro genuinely tries to help her students succeed and it shows through her lectures and explanations. While she might not be the best teacher I did learn a good amount from LAs and LTs which helped during the course. Overall tough class but definitely reasonable

Alfaro is a good professor, this is just a hard class. This course requires a lot of work through labs and online textbooks as well as projects to really build a strong foundation. Yes it may take you hours to do projects but I learned a lot from her. Shes very accessible, and offers help not just for class but also prepping for future

Interesting professor...not in a good way. She always gives us speech about how to succeed in academic and talks about how she failed her first year but end up with a 4.0 when she graduated. She barely even teach. You have to learn everything on your own. The rubric is unclear and a lot of things in her lecture is conflict to the rubric.

The course is challenging, has a lot of homework, and probably will take most of your time

But it doesn't mean that she's bad teacher. It means that it is extremely difficult course.

She's tries a lot of things to make the course easier and better for us to learn. I genuinely think she is a good teacher. They provide a ton of extra resources too.

I think a lot of Prof. Alfaro's negative reviews are just misogyny. Her lectures weren't the best and could be confusing at times, but she was always open to questions and tried her best. There are many male CS professors that I cannot say the same for. If you put in the effort, ask questions, attend lecture, etc..., you will get at least a B.
I named my bathroom toaster after her

She isn't as bad as her rating suggests. The class by nature is hard so people need to find someone to blame for their own downfalls. The class has difficult assignments but with office hours and good time management it is very doable. The lab exams are the hardest part of the class so be prepared and do chapter 13 on ZyBooks.

This class feels like a direct attack against people with ADHD. Also the professor relies way too heavily on zybooks to teach everything and expects you to put more time into practicing than you likely have. Regardless, she does care about the success of the students.

This professor expects us to give all our time studying for class without realizing the different lives of her students. Students do not have enough time to complete the necessary assignments AND the practice assignments she expects us to complete in disregard to other class assignments, part-time jobs, and other obligations.
Everything I learned in this class was from the lab. Alfaro didn't do anything worthwhile during lectures

You mostly learn from zybooks & if you practice you should do decent, but I honestly really found in person exams so unfair.The midterm review was nothing like the real midterm and most of it was handwritten code which is fine since it is a coding class, but one hour for it is simply not enough. Same with lab exams, too lengthy to finish in 1hr
You can never think about how anti-human the project of this class is. It's simply not something an introductory CS student could accomplish. Taking this class is like dying. I'm dead!

Zybooks teaches you more than Alfaro. Feels like a lot of work, but when you're first learning to program practice makes perfect. Labs are definitely helpful although I wasn't a fan of the partner work all of the time. Zyprojects require you to use everything you know, so sort of cumulative. Learned a lot, prof has a worse rap than she should.

Pedagogy is decent, execution not so much. Most of the learning is done through the reading, and if youre on top of that, then labs become helpful in learning. Just wish she didnt spend an entire lecture block implementing some seminar that couldve been separated into its own course; a second weekly lecture wouldve been more helpful.

Took this class Fall 21'. Honestly takes a lot of self initiative, but isn't as hard as many other reviews makes it seem. Please do readings on Zybooks, and actually do practice from Chapter 13. Make sure your code is your own and your thinking process, else you'll basically struggle for project and lab exam. Be on top of your work and you're good

She does not teach at all, you are left to the mediocre ZyBooks readings. Labs are not suitable for an intro to programming course, and the ZyProjects become insane level hard, couldnt pass this class if it wasnt for the endless trips to the TAs office hours.

She isn't the best lecturer by any means and can be confusing at times, but she doesn't really reflect her bad rating. She gives out plenty of extra credit opportunities and has A LOT of office hours. My advice is to take advantage of OH(literally no one goes to it) and stay a week ahead of the readings to make labs easier. Good luck!

Every weekend I hoped a lightning hit and kill me so I didn't have to be in her class. The class is not hard, yet her grading system makes no sense and you could find your grade down for no reason (you won't know until the very end). The only reason you will learn anything is that your TAs, this class have some great ones. Best luck kids.

The professor herself is good, I'm not sure why people take the class structure out on her. She is open, genuine, etc. The most difficult part about this class is the LAB EXAMS! Prepare for those. Midterm and final are easier. Do your labs and do them on time! Like what you'd expect from a CS course, you're going to work, but it is doable!

Alfaro/ICS 31 isn't as bad as people say. In my opinion, the people who complain the most are the ones who didn't put in their best effort into the class & want to blame someone else. Weekly labs w/ a new partner. 2 lab exams & 2 projects, lowest out of the 4 is dropped. Midterm & final. Lenient grading scale, extra credit opportunities, very fair.

It was actually super easy as long as you stay on top of the work. Really clear expectations and there's a lot of opportunities to get points. There are labs, in class exams, and projects but you can mess up here and there (which I did), and still get an A. Has A LOT of office hours, so take advantage of that! Most of the hands on learning in lab

She isn't as bad as people make her out to be. She has plenty of opportunities for extra credit and also drops the lowest lab exam score. Read the Zybooks if you want to pass. TAs and office hours are very helpful. Midterm and finals were written exams. The only annoyance is that finals this year were very different from the examples she showed us.

Despite the ratings, I promise you shes not the devil she is made out to be. I was scared out of my mind reading this before taking her class, but she really does care for you. She pushes those who need help to attend office hours, and her lectures are great. TAs are amazing as well. Do the practice midterms and finals. Take notes in ZyBooks.

I have NO idea why her score is so low. The class isn't difficult at all, and if you do fall behind, there is plenty of office hours offered. Personally did not like the finals being on paper, but it's fine. If you really want to get an A, it is not difficult as long as you do your work and actually read the ZyBooks and the PAs. Also very nice!

She was worst professor I have in UCI so far. Her grading system is very weird the for the third midterm and final we either take both or pick one, then the of your 3 or 4 exams would be the grade for exam?? If she wants to grade base on three exams, she should drop the lowest one. (if you didn't do well on any one our of the four, it hurt A LOT)

You will have to pay for one online lecture course, which is where you do pretty much all your learning. For the labs, you work with a new partner every week to complete coding tasks. If you do good on the labs and the homework, you should get a pretty good grade. Overall the class isn't the worst I took it with no coding experience and ima pass.
Lecture structure could have been improved

Do not be scared off by all the bad reviews. Alfaro is a great professor and genuinely cares about her students. If you're not doing well in the class then there are plenty of chances to make up for it. Yes, the class is challenging, but it is very possible to do well in if you are just willing to put in the work.

Lectures were useless. Zybooks and office hours was really helpful. Got an A- instead of an A because she marked all ungraded assignments as a 0 (didn't tell us and doesn't show you your grade until grades are released by the Registrar). Class harder than it should have been.

She is not the best professor, but she is not the absolute worst. I took the class with no coding experience and found it challenging but manageable. Her lectures are confusing so just read Zybooks, use Google or go to Office Hours. Lab tests are hard and concept-based, but there is practice problems that I recommend using to prepare for the exam.

The quality of the professor's teaching video is okay, but it was recorded by her a few years ago. I am very tired of writing drafts, peer reviews, and discussions every day, and if you are not careful, he will give you a very low grade. So if there is another professor teaching this class, please be sure to take another professor's class.
For my sake dont take this class, I dont want to hear the wailing and screaming that ensues.

Professor Alfaro herself is very kind, and she definitely tries her best. A lot of reviews say "coding is supposed to be hard" but honestly, for an intro class, what she teaches you vs. what she assigns you for projects are like night and day. Even though I got an A, I felt that I was unprepared for her projects every single time.

The course itself is hard, but I do believe it is over-exaggerated. However, she does always seem to avoid questions or anything she doesn't agree with. Paying attention in class and doing the homework is the minimum to succeed. You need to practice and work on extra stuff on your own to get a good grade in this class.

The zyBook is a great resource for you to learn how to code. But it will be the only thing that you'll learn from taking this course. Throughout the entire quarter I haven't seen the professor responding to a single question on Piazza. The quality of the lectures, the structure and organization of the class - shows you that she doesn't care.

Honestly not as bad as the reviews suggest! She may have been terrible before but she acknowledges it in her lectures and did everything in her power to improve... and she did. She mainly uses lecture time to teach concepts and clarify things and gives a lot of practice. Her tests and exams are very hard, but doable if you put in the effort.

Prof alfaro has a lot of bad reviews and that scared me ofc, but don't be scared shes a cool professor and I learned a lot. I took 31 in winter quarter and it was pretty chill. Mainly you do readings on an interactive textbook, attend lectures, then go to labs. Class isn't super easy it definitely takes time especially if you're new to coding.

I was surprised at how bad her reviews are on here. I think people are more upset by the class being difficult than by her specifically, but that is the nature of the major. Her teaching style is helpful and she covers things in depth in lectures. It is clear she cares about her students and their success, and she does curve grades.

Take this class if you really want to see if CS is the right major for you, it's extremely difficult, as someone with prior experience for a whole year, i've spent sleepless nights working on projects and labs. The only decent thing in this class is the midterm. Go to office hours, they will be your friend. The projects will make u cry :p
EXTREMELY TERRIBLE for CS rookie. ICS 31 became the most terrifying course in UCI under her instruction. I think I don't have to say a lot as the ratings have shown the reason.

Alfaro seems like she cares about her students, but her actions speak the opposite- she is completely inaccessible after the first week (even on Piazza) and she always covers content AFTER exams/ projects, so don't plan on relying on her lectures. If you have no prior experience, this class will require all your attention and will make you cry.

Professor gets a lot of hate but the reality is, cs isn't intended to be easy even if it's just an "intro class". If you aren't a genius, come in determined to put in lots of hours studying and determined to push through. For the people who complain about how hard this class is perhaps you should reconsider if this major is really right for you.

Guys, it's computer science and it is supposed to be hard and tough. expect to code intensively and spend up to 10 hours per week for extra practice to grasp concepts being taught in class. Start projects earlier since you might spend more than 20 hours on both of them. Overall, great TAs and prof, willing to help and be sure to reach out.

Her own Lab questions and projects on zybooks. ZyLabs and projects are 30% of your grade, it consists of 1 zyTest, 1 ZyProject soon after midterm, 1 zyTest or zyProject (you can choose between these 2, but the zyProject is gonna be extremely difficult). Each of those accounts for 10% of you total grade of the course. You'll be very likely to get 0

Her rating on here at the beginning of this quarter was 2, but now it dropped to lower. The problem is she adds her own contents to the online textbook she uses(including Asserts, Code Coverage, and a lot more advanced concepts that are not supposed to be in ICS31)

She clearly abandoned this class years ago and no longer cares for it. The rubrics are a mess, repetitive, and inconsistent. You'll be doing heavy peer reviews because she doesn't give feedback herself and the TAs only give feedback on drafts after you've submitted the final paper. Sucked all enjoyment I had for writing right out of me, terrible.

The rest of the reviews say it all... If you dont have prior coding experience it will be difficult to get a good grade and understanding of the concepts. She doesnt explain them well. If it werent for the LAs I would be struggling a lot more.

The preparation for the first project is a ridiculously long lab that came out of nowhere but just make sure to always do the labs so you're ready for the exams. Take the test at the end DO NOT do the project if you want to have time to study for other classes during that week. Midterm and final are written by TAs but you can study gradescope Qs��

Had to learn everything from the textbook and the material from the textbook is not enough for you to pass the tests and finish the projects. Lectures are unhelpful and confusing. Unclear grading criteria, get points off for unknown reasons. You don't know what grade you have in the class. AVOID(she use a test avg C to show the class is doing ok...

People complaining about Alfaro really didn't use all the resources the class provides. She covers material in a very unique way I agree but it really is more about the layout of the class that I think is impressive. I would take from her again but be prepared to focus and really talk through your code.

wanted to give her the benefit of the doubt going in. Frankly, she is the worst professor I have had at UCI. I dont recommend this class unless you have prior coding experience. The class itself is interesting but the projects and tests are very advanced for beginners and she does not prepare you for the difficulty of the assessments.

The class is alright, tests can be difficult, and labs are ok but if you need help the TAs are there to help. Projects can be pretty difficult if you have no coding experience. Getting help during office hours can be difficult because of how many people attend, so maybe try Piazza. She does try to help as much as she can.
her and unclear expectations (which are completely different from rubrics) made this class one of my least favorite classes at UCI.

Professor gets a lot of flak, but I think it's mostly due to upset students from intro programming class. It's meant to weed people out, so people who believe it's 'too difficult' for an intro class are bound to complain. Professor isn't as bad as score suggests.

Dr. Alfaro is a very helpful and patient teacher. Although the first intro class to computer science is very hard to grasp, she seriously took time out of her days to help us on big projects, even through the night and weekends. Her explanations to concepts were also very clear. Just start projects early, practice coding skills in a timed manner!

Didn't like the organization of this class. All grades weren't posted and some weren't posted for weeks on end. Many instructions and test cases included errors. You have to work for an A and learn mostly from Zybooks and labs. Had to wait hours to get help from office hours during projects, so use Piazza instead. There is a lot of EC however.

Shannon's ICS 31 class was quite time-consuming and complicated for an introduction class. I would advise you start coding before coming to her class because you may be tested on material you haven't even learned yet. She tries her best in order to encourage students to keep trying. Expect tests to be hard but sometimes there's a curve.

I have no prior knowledge in programming and spend an average of 12 hours per week on this class. Instruction for lab project is ambiguous, and lab exam tests for knowledge that is going to be taught in that week. If you go over all past exam, which is provided, zybook, and review, midterm and final should be fine. Overall, not as bad as expected.

The prof basically just covers really basic stuff, but expect the projects and tests to be a hell of a lot harder than what is taught. I feel like CS is just one of those classes where you gotta teach urself a bit so be prepared to read stack overflow and stuff. She's a really nice person but u gotta over prepare for everything and u might pass

If you don't have prior knowledge in CS, you will most likely fail this class. Take APCS or learn some programming before taking Alfaro's ICS 31. You virtually have to self-learn everything in this class because she does not teach well at all. Lab exams are way harden than what you learn in class. Expect to spend days on projects.

She is one of the professors that you will never what to meet again. Her assignments on textbooks are easy, but labs, tests, and exams are much more difficult, especially the final exam that I have just taken. The statements of the questions in exams are not clear, and she never sends emails to illustrate what needs to be done!

Guys come on its Computer Science!!!!! It is going to be hard! You obviously need to put in lot of work on your side to get the grade that you want. I didn't really do that hot, and realized that I didn't put in that much effort. . You do need to learn some stuff on your own tho and you learn best when you research it yourself!
good prof nice personality

She is hands-down the worst teacher I ever had. Her lectures are pathetic and don't cover any of the material you learn that week. The tests and projects are extremely difficult compared to the classwork. She puts on a happy act but really she's Lotso from toy story 3. You need prior coding experience to succeed. Avoid at all costs, I warned you.

This professor is the worst. Her expectations for projects are way too high, and her tests cover content that we did not even study for. Her lectures and exams vary widely in difficulty, and she acts like she cares but does not show that in her assignments. The grading criteria is very specific. One missing space on labs and automatic zero. AVOID!!

this was the worst class EVER. it gave me so many mental breakdowns:) this is suppose to be a beginning programming course but the expectations are SO high. she does not teach & you have to learn on your own w the book. i went to office hours and waited 5 hours to ask a question for my project and they closed office hours w/o getting to my turn.
Project and some labs are extremely hard.

for every project we've done i've had to pull constant all nighters. definitely does not feel like an intro course, office hours are dreadfully inconsistent, as there are not enough TAs to go around each student, and prof ignores piazza questions...

ICS31 is doable. You have to realize that programming is essentially learning a new language--it's hard. Coming into the class with no programming experience, I too got anxiety from the reviews, but trust me, if you put in the hours and dedication, go to office hours, and really learn the concepts, you'll pass the class. Extra credit is there too.

I have no previous coding experience, but I get the concepts pretty well from this class. I don't get why she gets such a bad rating, I agree that the zyproject is very long but it is doable. Plus she gives out extra credit almost every week if you do labs with a partner. Her lectures can get a little bit confusing tho(Just sometimes).

It has been a hard time already cuz of covid, yet her class is on a totally different level. Zybooks is your real teacher. Lab exams are way harder than they should've been. She always brings up "class average" to prove that the class is doing fine, while some people come into the class with experience. AND THEY STILL STRUGGLE. Avoid, avoid, avoid!
This course is too difficult for students who are not familair with programming.

Course content is easy, zylabs are difficult but doable, exams are INCREDIBLY difficult unless you've been an industry professional for the past decade. Have two years of coding experience, put more than 40 hours a week in CS, did all her assignments in time, still could not turn in her Zyproject. Save yourself if this isn't your required class.

This is literally an intro class and it DOES NOT feel like one. The tests and projects are unnecessarily hard and people go to office hours and wait in line for 5 HOURS BECAUSE NOTHING MAKES SENSE. The professor does not care about her students. I have eczema and my flare-ups are extremely bad due to the stress this class has caused me. :)

Literally everything everyone is saying here is true for the most part. Future ICS31 students, beware. The class structure is supposed to be for students with absolutely no coding experience but it sure doesn't feel that way. The Zybook lessons are easy. The exams and some Lab Activities? Good luck.

Absolute love this class! The professor is amazing if you love seeing Fs instead of As. Basically she teaches how to make instant ramen noodles and ask you to make Michelin 5-star meals on tests. Idk maybe I am too dumb and instant noodles taste good too.
Lab exams vs practice problems given to us have nothing to do with eachother, prepare to study on your own with outside resources
If you look at the tags I selected, when I put hilarious, I meant to actually say hilariously bad at teaching.
¬tags
I don't know why people hate her. She is a real gem and loves to teach students. She is always accessible outside the classroom and really knows how to interact with students

Avoid this professor would be wisely choice. The ton of peer reviews and discussion board are not helpful at all. Maybe it helps you to waste you time. The grader are really tough. The writing is not based on T/F, but your grades will be based on the unfair prompts.

This class just gave me depression. However, if you work hard until the very end of her class, you'll get a good grade. Although she makes things 10x more difficult and gives out time-consuming tests from topics we barely learned through the week, don't give up. If I managed to get through this heavy workload, so can you. :)
She does not even qualify to be a professor. At this point, it is obvious that she is making the class as hard as possible to unfairly weed out students

Programming is obviously not easy to learn BUT for an intro class, this class is taught way too poorly. She tests on material inconsistent with what she taught, so the assessments are not fair. This is from someone who has prior coding experience. I wouldn't have been able to get through some of the assignments if I didn't have that prior knowledge

A lot of people love to complain about Alfaro because of the difficulty of the class, but computer science is difficult in general and I feel like it is only amplified in this course because it is an intro class. I took this class twice: in person and during remote learning. Both times, you had to work for your grade but assessments were very fair!

the projects are SO SO SO SO SO awful. expects you to dedicate your entire 72 hours to her assignment. she doesn't even teach anything in lecture, and tests on REALLY complicated versions of what we learn in class. AVOID AVOID IF YOU CAN. this is coming from somebody who ended up getting an A, so it aint even about the grade for me. just sucks.
So horrible. Literally does not care about students. Lab exam is INCREDIBLY HORRIBLE.

She does not listen to her students. She pretends she cares but she doesn't. She actually privated the Piazza post of a student earlier this week because they were calling her out on something and she didn't want the class to see. Tested us every week since halfway through the quarter, really unfair because exams test on super complicated things.
She teaches nothing on lecture while the tests are super hard. The projects this quarter are nightmares.
too hard

Is she actually teaching beginners' classes? LAB EXAM IS SOOOO HARD and lots of homework. And she did not teach anything in class. All self-learning. DON'T TAKE HER CLASS if you don't wanna cry in the midnight coding.

Every one of her assessments (projects) takes days to finish. Even for those with prior coding experience, it takes hours for them to finish, because her instructions and exams are written very poorly, very complicated, and even when you ask her question, she seems confused on her own material! She makes mistakes on her OWN exams!! DONT take her!

She should really read the reviews here and change her teaching style. She doesn't know how to teach the subject well and frequently gets confused or makes mistakes in lecture. Tests on things we barley learned that week and expects us to know how to use them thoroughly when we just learned them a few days ago. Exams much harder than the practice.

She is really caring about students' feelings and if they really learn something or not. She tried hard to prepare students for ICS 32 and 33. Although the lab assignments take long time, these are really good practice for programming. She viewed effort more than grades. She and TAs are accessible outside class. Amazing professor!

Worst professor I have so far. She tested heavily, one major test per week from week 4 to 10, and tested on materials haven't learned. She uses zybook and doesn't teach much during lectures. It's like, why do I need you if zybook already done almost all of the teaching job??? DO NOT take her class! Try to take ICS31 in summer.
This professor is so ridiculous. Everything is unnecessarily tooo hard.

ICS needs to find a different professor for this class. Not really beginner-friendly, assessments are very complex compared to what we learn in lecture and in zybooks, she never teaches you how to put the things you learned together and just expects you to know and teach yourself. Lectures are useless and the assessments are way too complicated.

If u scroll down and see positive reviews for her- dont be fooled. Scroll more and u will see endless pages of negative reviews. I wonder if she wrote those positive ones for herself, she sucks at teaching! claims she cares about her students but she DOES NOT! overcomplicates things, lab exams not equal to what you learn, she deserves to be fired

I never rate professors. but this one I had to. Took her intro class. whatever it was, it WAS NOT an intro class. She teaches you 2+2 and then tests you on derivatives. Thats how bad it is. She needs to listen to her students when they say they're going insane from the amount of work she assigns. It just seems like she WANTS her students to fail.

AWFUL professor. She doesn't answer or respond to when her students have problems or concerns, her assessments are seriously disconnected from lessons, and she herself gets confused & makes many mistakes during lecture. Very disorganized class, and made me HATE the subject. Assigns HOURS of work, takes more time than my upper divs combined. AVOID!

worst professor i have ever had, never seen someone make simple concepts so unnecessarily complicated before. Very poor lectures, she seriously does not know how to teach in general. Severe disconnect between assignments and what we're learning and completely unhelpful on piazza when you try and clarify her poor organization. AVOID AVOID AVOID !!

She does not really listen to her students at all. She assigns things that we have not been prepared for, then when students struggle, she just says "don't give up". Its not fair to ask us to spend so many hours on your assessment. I wish I did not take this class- She is a bad teacher and cannot teach coding well, lectures are very pointless.

We use zybooks to learn material for the week, then in lecture we barely cover what we learned in zybooks, and then the lab projects and exam is MUCH MUCH harder than anything we learned. Meanwhile students are spending hours on some lab exams and TAs are hard to reach, she gives unnecessary complicated assignments that we are not prepared for yet

This is an intro class and she gives labs that are way past what she, and the book, have taught. Her class is easily 30 hrs/wk of work. She is literally the worst professor I have ever had- I've never seen someone make stuff so unnecessarily complicated. If you can, avoid this class. If you can't, good luck.
Lots of complicated lab assignment but completely unnecesssary

Quite possibly the worst professor in the ICS department. I didn't want to rate her until I took ICS32 so I could fairly evaluate her, but I've realized that she made 31 so much more difficult than it had to be. She seems nice enough but there was a serious disconnect between the material we covered in lecture and what we were being evaluated on.
Better than I heard, shes fair and nice in eating
Though this is a very hard class, the professor is a nice person.
Honestly professor Alfaro is a nice person in general, ics 31 is hard in other words for beginners but shes definitely not a bad professor at all!

Honestly, she's not as bad as everyone on this site claims she is. She genuinely cares about her students and generally wants you to succeed in this class. Her lab exams are 10 %, 10% and 5% (for the lowest lab exam scored). I recommend joining a learning community at the beginning of the course bc of all the extra credit opportunities you can earn
Professor Alfaro was responsible and would consider students first! It was true that the course was challenging. However, Professor has done her best! If you failed, it was all about you!
Passionate about the topics. Care about her students. I dont know why she gets such low grade, but I love her lectures!

She is an excellent professor, not only in academic ability, but also very concerned about the life and health of your students. I am very grateful to her as the professor of my introductory programming course. She has aroused my great interest in programming, even though I have never learned programming before.

Even though her assignment is heavy, the instructor is really kind and responsible. It is easy to pass this course as long as you work very hard. Every assignment can change your grade and try your best to do it!
She is a nice professor. However, the exams are tough, thus I think this course is hard for those students who didn't code before... pls prepare yourself before plan to take this course.

Professor Alfaro was very caring about students and gave us a lot of chances to succeed in her class. A good chunk of the grade was just being present in lab and doing the assignments in the textbook. Every time I reached out to her, she was really kind. She has a really bad rep on here, but I enjoyed my time in her class.

Like how many of you are feeling as you read this, I was quite nervous coming into ICS 31 with no prior programming experience. I cannot stress enough how important staying on top of your learning is for this class. Make the time to go to office hours, ask questions and do extra practice at least an hour a day. You will succeed.

Alfaro knows what she is talking about without a doubt. She definitely understands computer science and python. The problem is that she doesn't know how to teach. Most of the lectures end up being about meta cognition instead of python and the lectures are very boring. She is not as bad as people claim her out to be, but still pretty garbage.

Dont know why her rating is so bad. Was rly scared coming into 31 but shes really good/nice/helpful. She was unresponsive to a v important message the day before a midterm, which is why I gave her 4 instead of 5. BTW I had no coding experience and still did well, so the difficulty isnt too bad

Lab exams, midterms, and finals are often written in unclear ways. She'll teach the basics, but you'll never know how to combine concepts, which is crucial to passing the class. You pretty much have to figure most stuff out on your own. But I will say, she's glad to help during office hours, and that's what saved me in this class.

I normally don't write bad reviews. But there are exceptions in life. Alfaro spent several lectures (parts of them) explaining how difficult ICS 31 is (it's not hard) and how you drop out if you don't think you can succeed. I went to three lectures and never went back. Go to lab, do your work, utilize the internet, get an A. Lectures waste of time.

Took it online and the work load is heavier than an in-class work load. Multiple assignments due every week and the discussion posts are long. That said, the class was not challenging in any other way. If you are a fast writer OR don't care about putting some extra time in from home, this is a good class.

Wording for midterm and final is very weird and even a decent understanding over the course material does not guarantee a good grade. There was a question about C programming in the midterm OF AN INTRODUCTORY PYTHON COURSE, and the answers could work in C but not in Python.
Escape from this class. This is only the advise I can give you.
10/10 if you want to learn about metacognition, 0/10 if you want to learn python
Take this class in person.
The TA's are now grading assignments strictly and this class is no longer easy. I heard the on-campus 139W courses are way more chill and easy.

Everything I learned came from the textbook. Good amount of stuff you have to learn on your own. I also don't understand why she decided to squeeze in the file stuff. The lab tutors were also confused. When the final average is a D-, I think its not the students anymore. She also refuses to curve.

This class should be easy and the material IS easy. But if you have no background in ics at all you really have to teach yourself. She teaches the most basic concepts in class that aren't helpful in application to the tests. She gives past lab exams as practice that sometimes don't reflect on the difficulty she will test you on.
She would act like she cares about your grade and life but in fact she don't.
Very very busy work
Really good professor, just read the book and prepare for the tests, you would pass easily

The real problem with her class is not about how difficult her tests were. Its she basically teach you nothing. She probably would argue that you would have to learn by yourself and its part of students duty. However, why would we pay $$$$$ and in exchange to have a person to tell you learne by yourself?? Dont let her destroy you confident!

There's a ton of material she covers, which includes the first half of ICS 32. If a zyBook section is assigned, its crucial to master it by that due date --- those same topics will be tested within that week on labs or lab exams or midterm. It's just A LOT and it helps to have basic programming knowledge - don't rely on lectures for understanding.

Heres the run down.. In order to pass this class, you need to be ON it. if youve noticed that youre struggling right off the bat.. JOIN LARC!!! Such an amazing resource. This class is tough, but if you put in the work and never give up, youre bound to pass. I bombed the midterm and the final but I got perfect scores for the lab exams.

Lab exams are where she tests you on "how to code": using nested loops, creating functions, reversing strings, etc. Midterm and final are more theoretical: the differences between lists and dictionaries, what's in a global namespace vs a local namespace, etc. Both tests also contained nested values, so learn how to navigate those structures.
No curve when the class average for the midterm was an F and the average for the final was a D-. Doesn't make any sense.

She is a OK professor. She has a different teaching styles compare to other professors. I would say her teaching definitely add ten time more difficulties in the class. But with enough practice and understand the materials. It's not too hard to get a B in the class.

As an undeclared student here at UCI, getting into ICS31 was just the beginning of hell. I studied so hard every single week. The expectations and the level of detail you need to know everything really is too much for one class. Lectures are not as important as the lab exams where I pray you do well since they are hard asf. Get ready to work.
Alfaro's class makes me more spiritual because all I do before exams was practicing metacognition and praying

As a student who has no prior coding experience, this INTRO to programming class is not for beginners. The midterms, lab exams, and finals are nothing like what you actually learn in Zybooks. She is the only teacher for ICS 31, so if you want to be a CS or ICS major she will screw you over. I should have gone to another school, save my time and $$.
Took her fall quarter, very bad experience.
You have a better chance at curing cancer than getting an A with Alfaro if you've never done a CS class before.
tests are too hard and tricky zybook sucks
It's a shame that she is the only professor teaching 31. She knows her stuff, but she's not fit to teach people who had never programmed before.
DONT TAKE HER CLASS EVER
class is bad, good luck.

Terrible. She makes plenty of excuses for coming unprepared. Curriculum and expectations follow unclear guidelines that always change last minute. Also lots of mistake making during presentation that overextends time. Does not seem like a subject matter expert.

I took ICS 31 with a diff prof but I've seen how Alfaro teaches this course. Back when I took ICS 31 it was relatively straightforward and simple, but with Alfaro, you learn things that u would learn in ICS 32 or even 33. She goes over WAYY too much for an intro course when she should rlly focus on building a strong foundation instead of rushing it

Its not the matter of whether you know how to program or not. I would say this professor probably learn coding in a very different way than usual people, so her teaching method will not be what youre expecting. Her lab exam is ok if you did code before, but I would say her written midterm has very difficult wording issues.
Just don't take this class for a grade, or don't take this class at all. Most of the tests were nothing similar to what we've learned at all...
Very very very hard lab exam for beginner programmer
good luck lol
WROST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVEY HAD
GREAT PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAVE

She is friendly and open to answering questions if you need help. Although, the labs and lab exams were really difficult because there was a lot of information on there that wasn't covered in class. The class was very difficult and not friendly to first time programmers. Learning was dependent on zyBooks, not much from lectures. Good luck, fam.

grade is decided by lab exams and midterm/final (there are other things like labs or textbook stuff but that is all completion based). main issue with lab exams is that each lab sections has different lab exams The midterm and final are completely unrelated to practical skill (i got As on lab exams but Cs on midterm and final) dont miss easy point
Tough final and no curve
The midterm and final exam are awful. They were not related to what matters in this course, and the questions are confusing. The score you received cannot reflect anything.

Pros: She's nice. Cons: Exam difficulty is inconsistent between versions and she fails to sufficiently compensate for that. Exams are written last minute, and you can tell. Lied about what was on the final (likely because she forgot what she said during lecture when she wrote the test the day before we took it). Assignments are poorly organized.

Just tellin yall...I got a 53% on my final (I had previous coding experience) and was a straight A student in high school (weird flex but ok). Honestly theres no use crying over my C+ in the first quarter of college. It is what it is and I hope I will learn more in ICS 32. I pray for the future students that have Alfaro UwU

She literally writes the worst tests I've ever seen. They don't properly reflect any of the things that you learn in ICS 31, so it just ends up docking your grade significantly. She also doesn't take blame for how bad these tests are...
this is the worst professr ever save yourself and do not take this class at all costs
I have a conspiracy theory that this professor teaches ICS 31 to weed out students in an overenrolled class. I just wish she explained concepts more clearly and was more organized while doing it.
One rating is too generous, I would give Alfaro zero rating. Anything you can name: poor quality of teaching, poorly written tests, disorganize, and the list goes on.

Even though I'm pretty sure I failed my bs of a final, I'm glad I took this class because reading the reviews on RMP for her is HILARIOUS. WAIT FOR ANOTHER PROFESSOR IT IS NOT WORTH IT. She literally emailed the week before the final that our grades are projected to be 9% lower than what it is now, implying she planned to screw us on the final.

Midterm and final were difficult, but I actually do get why she made those questions. It is in fact very important to know the concepts she was asking in the tests, but the problem is, she does not cover those concepts thoroughly. Lab exams are difficult and since not everyone gets same problems, it is unfair for some people. Hope this helps.
Put random stuff that that we didn't even talk about in class on the final ruining everyone's grade. Focuses on the useless parts of the textbook instead of the stuff we actually need to know.

If you think python is an easy language and a bad prof is OK for you because you can study by your own, please wait for another prof. Her lectures are about how she loves us and its students fault for not getting A. And her exams are stupid while only testing everything that you dont have to know.
Worst teacher with hardest midterms/finals that don't make any sense even if you studied for weeks. Avoid like plague
Never would I have thought that I'd be considering switching majors within the first quarter of my college career. Thanks Alfaro <3

I've taken AP CS A, AP CS AB and AP CS Principles in high school and those classes are in java so its very similar to python. The material itself is easy to learn and understand but Alfaro is the worst teacher ever. She assigns readings for homework and her lectures literally read off the textbook. Her exams are way too hard when she can't teach
Lecture: intro to programming Midterm: intermediate programming Lab exam: advanced programming

During the year, I would bang my head onto my computer hoping Alfaros Zybook would be engrained in my head. Now I suffer from a concussion and my computer is broken. Save your life and save your computers life. Dont take this class

I'm part of the crew that did bad on lab exam 2 (tic tac toe). Literally had 1 hour to code and the question made no sense for the first 40 minutes of reading it. ZyBooks makes you code in the way THEY want which sucks. Other people got a WAY easier version of it and they got 20 while we got 4-13 points. She "curved" it and added like 3 points...

If you want to do well in the course be prepared to read half the text before the first lab exam. Her lectures aren't very helpful either, and lab sections don't provide enough practice so try to find material outside of the text. Exams are not application based; specifically tests on definitions when she says she wouldn't. Horrible professor.

lectures teach practically nothing useful, students who should be in 32A said labs were too hard so she made them incredibly difficult for everyone whos a beginner. said she would curve a test with a class average of an F (tested material we didnt learn yet which is unfair) but didnt. As an entry level course, we need a teacher who can teach

This class is far too difficult for an introduction to programming class. Anyone without programming experience coming into this class is going to have a very difficult time. It doesn't help that her tests are extremely difficult and cover topics that aren't even taught in class or are two chapters ahead. TAs are nice though.

She is literally the worst professor ever. As soon as people started asking about the lab exam (average was 9/20), she sent out an email saying she would curve the exam and reupload it that night. Well, its been 4 days since that email, and we have not gotten any response out of her. She ignores anything related to student's grades. AVOID HER

I took Alfaro about two quarters ago and I still have nightmares from her class. I'm writing this now to help out future students to ABSOLUTELY avoid her. She actually doesn't respect her students and joked how we didn't get into a different school. I know she seems nice at first lecture, but trust me she really isn't. Her tests are a joke(hard af)

Just got a 50 percent on a lab exam She expects a intro class to write a tictactoe program within a hour using the content that she didn't cover. Ridiculously unfair I have done similar project in an advanced java before in two weeks

If you are coming in with no programming experience, expect the lab to be very challenging because she will make you do Amazon algorithms. Plus, to pass her midterm, you would need to know definitions because the practice exams are different from what you would expect. Pray that you get a good lab partner because labs are very hard from week 5.

She didn't realize what's her problem is. We are taking a coding class, not a writing class. Her midterm is all about definitions which has no connection to her sample test. We want to learn how to code, not how to memorize the definition. Her lecture is basically reading the powerpoint and I can learn better by reading the online book myself.
Literally repeats information in the online textbook which explains everything better than she does. Someone who does Java tries to teach Python.
Her midterm is about definition of python, it is awful.
