His lectures and diagnostics prepare you for the tests which seemed attainable, while I found the programming assignments the most daunting due to my weak C++ foundation. It's usually at 8 am so beware, as it had significantly affected me

His class is more theory based than other 46 professors, but watch out for the programming assignments! They tend to be fairly easy aside from the first and fourth ones, and unless you're familiar with C++ you'll prob struggle. Enjoyed this class a lot, Shindler is the goat.
I find him overrated. Although he's nice as a person, he's not a good lecturer. I constantly found myself confused in his lectures, and he usually went on extremely long tangents during office hours.
The exam is very difficult. Project grading is very vague and you have no idea where you went wrong. Regrading is very troublesome. You won't learn anything at all from this class.

You are not going to be handheld to learn C++. While Shindler is an understanding person, I can't help but feel overwhelmingly occupied by the workload from the weekly projects, which was not alleviated by the professor going on tangents oftentimes during lecture. Aside from that, the practice exams were very important towards succeeding the final.

GO TO LECTURE. Hands down one of the best ICS lecturers at UCI. The class was a challenge but you have the feeling of knowing more about programming after a project compared to where you were before. If you put genuine effort in the class, and START THE PROJECTS EARLY, you will be fine.

The projects aren't too bad if you start early. Most can be done within 1-2 days. Exams are difficult unless you review concepts at TA conceptual hours in which case you should be able to understand the topics pretty easily.

Very informative and interesting lectures. Attendance is optional but lectures mainly focus on topics outside of the textbook, which are present on exams. Projects are easily completable within the timeframes given. Very helpful towards answering questions and makes time to talk to students.

Because this was his first time teaching 45c, the class had ups and downs but overall his projects taught me so much about c++, and his lectures were very helpful to understand the content. His practice exams were also helpful for the final exam. He really cares about your success.

Rough start, but finished decently. Initially, the projects were difficult and took up the majority of my time. Thankfully, he listened and made subsequent projects easier. Lectures were rather helpful and sometimes provided solutions to parts of our project. Considering this is his first time teaching ICS 45C, he didn't do a bad job.

His lectures and projects are shallow/disorganized. I feel like I've learned nothing from them. To automate testing, the projects are provided with lots of skeleton code (awful for learning C++). Looking at the practice exams, the lectures and projects don't prep you for the final.
keep yourself safe michael

He is good. The only problem is his expectations. You must come to the lecture knowing all concepts you should originally suppose to be learned in lectures, so he could build extras on that. Also, Ed discussion is always 99+ threads since his 5-pages long project description is full of nonsense.

His projects were difficult and even with a 7 pg doc telling you what he wants, it still wasn't enough info. Students had loads of questions about the details for the projects on Edstem. He DOES NOT tell you how he will be grading projects or all of the requirements you need to get a good grade. You have to guess and hope you get a good grade.

This class was fun (but very hard and concept heavy). 6 projects, 2 Midterms and a Final. Lectures are digestible if you actually do the zybook reading before.There is a big focus on concept. MTs are very similar to practice tests (try to take those as real tests to find out your standing). There are a lot of help hours so take advantage of them.

The project workload was extremely heavy and monopolized my attention. It did force me to learn a lot very quickly, which was painful but useful.

Go to lecture and take notes in a text editor. He drops much of what you need to succeed for each project in the lecture, and you can reference your notes to make the projects simpler for yourself.

This may be his first quarter teaching 45C but it looks as though this is his first time ever teaching. Assumes we know basic C++ because we know Python, writes code on ppt slides instead of opening up an IDE or compiler, projects are insanely vague, and lectures are essentially useless. I have never had a professor this awful in my life. Avoid him

He is the most absolutely worse professor I've ever had in all my educational years. He does not care about helping students and just does the most absolute things to make us fail. As a professor your goal should be to help students succeed and not the opposite. I hope admin looks into his way of teachings & agree with me and majority of students.

I want to give Professor Shindler a higher grade, but there are issues with his course. His lectures feel too short, he breezes through concepts way too quickly. He works off of slides, which isn't good if you're teaching any programming language. This was his first time teaching 45C, and there is a lot that can be improved.

I have never in my three years of going to school wished I had a different professor. This person does not know how to teach beginners at all and is not helpful in the slightest. Avoid him at all costs, if you scroll down and look at the last 50 reviews they will say the exact same thing. You will be so happy if you avoid him at all costs.
Does not know how to teach
this man does not know how to teach beginners bro he just knows how to ramble

First the professor started teaching by writing code in class which took a lot of time, so we would end with just 4 slides of illegible written notes, and then he switched to slides which were even worse as they were cryptic and made no sense. Get ready to learn everything by yourself. We have 7 projects which are incredibly difficult.
Goes on many tangents, decent professor, terrible resources

For most students in 45C, it is our first time ever learning C++, so everything is new. I don't think he has realized the importance of introducing a new concept before diving deep into it. As a result, the unresolved questions and doubts are discouraging students from performing well in this course.
7 projects in a quarter and projects are inconsistent in difficulty with lectures. You won't get any partial credits until you have almost implemented the entire project correctly

The projects assigned are incredibly challenging, and the necessary topics weren't even discussed until we neared the deadline. Many students are feeling overwhelmed and are considering late drops. Ridiculously, he is oblivious and seems to be proud of the torturing he had inflicted upon us....
I couldn't sleep and have constan nightmares because the projects are so stressful. AVOID him at all cost.
He mentioned that he enjoys teaching this class, but it seems to me that he takes pleasure in making his students feel miserable daily.
The projects are doable but they are hard. This is his first time teaching this class so I guess he's still adjusting the pace.
The discrepancy of difficulty between his lecture and assignments are horrendous

His lectures are inconsistent and confusing, you can see that people just stop showing up because it is not helping. There are only limited lab sessions with limited help, most likely you won't be able to get help there because the line is extremely long and there is only one LA available at a time. Good Luck.

His grading is ridiculously difficult for projects. Doesn't grade individual functions, so if even one is wrong and causes a compile error your grade is a zero, so test your code a TON. His lectures are informative, you have to go to class since his uploaded slides can be confusing. Learned so much in this course and actually retained the info.

Hands down the hardest class I've ever taken (due largely to Shindler's extremely strict grading policies). Totally worth it though because you will learn SO MUCH. His lectures are very engaging and (despite what the class grading might imply) Shindler is actually really nice. Overall, pretty stressful but totally worth the work.

Lectures were very inaccessible as the slides had less information. Learnt only through reading by ourselves in order to understand project and exam concepts; the exams were very difficult and the project grading criteria was unclear. Majority of the class barely passed, despite the curve... If you want to hurt your gpa take this class.

Just a very unfair professor overall. Lectures are difficult to follow. Projects are boring and tedious and graded very harshly. Exams are very difficult. Just wait for a different professor to take this course.

Most awful professor I've ever had the displeasure of taking. Many assignments were ungraded by the end of quarter, including final. Exams + final make up 56% of the grade and are incomprehensible. No lecture recordings + posted lecture slides can't be understood. Will threaten you with academic dishonesty and an F grade over nothing. DO NOT TAKE.

We didn't get grades back for half the problem sets, the final exam, or proj 6. Nothing's on Canvas so I had to have separate reminders and I still managed to miss some zybooks. The uploaded slides are useless if you miss a lecture. The only resource for one of the projects was his incoherent slides, so you were screwed if you missed that lecture.

Extremely strict grading and tough projects. Felt like a constant pressure. Almost everything is considered "academic dishonesty" so be careful since he takes it very seriously. Lecture slides and notes were useful so it's pointless to look back at notes. He also never released final exam scores or last few assignments. Just avoid him if u can.

Difficult test cases for projects and if you have segfault or minor compile issue, it will be a straight 0. Tests are typically straightforward, but the entire class revolves around his lecture. For one topic, the only information provided was his lecture and his notes are nearly impossible to read and comprehend. Most stressful class of my life.

Honestly an amazing professor, highly recommend taking his courses! The homework and projects are a bit tricky at times but I've found it to be a great way to get you to think about the material and was very fun to work on. Lectures are also very helpful as we get notes and many opportunities to ask questions but be sure to read beforehand!

Lecture slides are just worthless examples. If you didn't get a concept in class, you will never get it since no additional resources anywhere to explain concepts. Does not help that he is a mediocre lecturer at best, convoluted storyteller at worst. Hates canvas for some reason, so deadlines and assignments are scattered.
Programming assignments were hard and grading policies were weird. He always went on tangents in lectures and only gave super vague instructions for any questions about assignments.
Goes on useless tangents, pretends to be nice and then never responds to emails. Thinks he's funny when the only thing funny is how stuff are graded. Super strict grading and no leeway.

Hard, but learned a lot. Projects (6 total) were really tough but seemed to get better as the quarter progressed. I almost gave up and failed the class, but continued to grind and got a B- in the end. Grading is super hard - many students get 0's on their projects and homework problems. Lectures are easy to follow along, Shindler is sometimes funny

engaging lectures and a very intelligent dude. he pushes students to their limits by asking some of the hardest questions on the exams/practice sets. if not enough students get them right, he removes them, giving the whole class a fat ass curve. when i thought i would've failed, I ended up with a B+ somehow. u won't know your grade till the end.
Not on canvas, assignments are scattered, and resources are hard to find. Good lecturer but goes off on tangents. Very strict grading.

Ics46 concepts are really hard, as well as the c++ projects. I did enjoy going to his lectures in person and taking his exams in person- from what i've heard.. avoid his online tests. This class was very time consuming and took a lot of effort to successfully understand and complete projects/problem sets and do well on exams. Exams are reasonable.

Very tough test cases for projects. Confusing lectures and hard to get help from the professor and TAs. You will not even know if you can pass this course until the end. Report students and give F grades without giving evidence and communication.

Take Alex and avoid this professor. He doesn't open the canvas at all so you don't know your grade until it is posted on the transcript. Project criteria are confusing and you will lose half of the points for the same mistakes. He would report and fail any student he suspected, even though some might be innocent.

Professor Shindler's 46 is a great class, although with a heavy workload. If you work hard in the class you will do well and learn a lot, but the workload can be overwhelming especially at the start of the quarter with the first few projects. Lectures are super well organized and funny - Shindler is a great prof!
Professor is nice, but he always talks lots of unrelated things when he is teaching C++ concepts, which can make very simple thing harder to understand.
His biggest quality is that he cares about students learning. The class is hard, but if you ask him he will accommodate to help you.

A horrible professor. He doesn't reply to your email except for the regrading request. There are 23 people out of 127 who get 0 on one project, which is ridiculous. Tests are really hard and tough graded. Won't take this prof again.

Shindler is a great and caring professor! He was always so supportive whenever I had stupid questions and encourages his students a lot. However, I found 45c w/ Thornton super easy and this was a big blow difficulty wise. Some projects had averages under 70%, so keep in mind that the grading is pretty strict. They're also strict on the Problem sets

He has 6 problem sets and 5 projects in total. The workload is reasonable but his class is kind of disorganized. Sometimes assignments are graded incorrectly and it took the TA days to start regrading it. It also took the TA days to response to email or question on Piazza

Professor Shindler is one of my favorite professors so far. In ICS 46 there are optional Zoom lectures and pre-recorded lecture videos. The problem sets, quizzes, and projects aren't too bad! During class, Shindler really encourages people to ask questions and has created a welcoming learning environment. He also responds to questions on Piazza.

I found Shindler to be a bit overrated. Lectures didnt cover much, werent helpful. And his projects were pretty hard. I couldnt use lectures as guidance, so I mostly had to do a lot of research on my own (though the zybook was also helpful). Good: quizzes were very similar to practice quizzes and overall workload/class was fair for 46.

Graded by 5 projects, 5 tests, 6 problem sets, and reading. The projects take around 1-2 days and he provides some tests (though you still need to write some). The tests except test 1 are easy and are based on the practice tests. He also drops the lowest test score. The problem sets are tricky but are only weighted 12% of your total grade.

This class I would say is the right amount of work. It isn't too less where you will not learn anything nor too much where you would much rather shoot your brains. Also, he is a great lecturer, and to do his projects well you need to do lectures + Zybooks. Overall great class, learnt a lot just wished he graded all the stuff a bit faster.

(Covid Course) Class is a decent amount of work but spaced out so that it is not overwhelming. Professor really cares about what he is doing and takes his job/responsibilities seriously. Projects/problem sets are reasonably difficult. Only a rating of 4 because he has a tendency to drift off topic during lectures.

Professor Shindler is a fantastic professor who you can tell really enjoys teaching. While lectures may be a bit simple at times (compared to Pattis and Thornton), the course is well balanced, and you end up with a good understanding of all the important data structures (he also uses zybooks). On a side note, his first quiz will be the hardest!
One of the most caring and accessible professors I ever had. It's super clear that the man really enjoys teaching and is always willing to hear feedback from students.

Pros: answers Q's after class, fun projects, accepts explanations in place of code on exams, sometimes funny, curve. Cons: expects too much from students given his ability to teach, notes are not helpful, lectures are pretty dry/cover very little material, LONG/FREQUENT tangents, removes pts on exams for random stuff (id not on all pgs)

Hot take but Shindler is not that great of a professor. His notes are unreadable if you didnt attend lecture , he just posts slides with solutions and no explanations for them. In addition he has a policy where you can only get 30% above your exam average on assignments. As if 40 min exams weren't hard or stressful enough( you wont finish it).

He's a funny and has a lot of original humor, yet at the same time his lectures are extremely useful and the analogies he makes to break a hard concept into something easier are so good. Quality professor.

5 projects - 30%(along with a 2% setup project) 4 Written Hws - 8% 2 Midterms - 25% Final - 35% It was only his first quarter at UCI for teaching, and hes already my favorite professor here. His lectures are entertaining and easy to understand. Hes very open to questions, and is easily accessible. His online notes kind of suck though.
He didnt release the final exam grade, he didnt release all the problem set grade. After the final, he basically ghosted us and announced nothing regarding the final grade. Why he does this??

Shindler is an awesome professor, he truly cares for his students. Lectures are accessible and engaging (you are not required to attend, there are no iclickers or anything like that). No discussion. 5 projects, 4 problem sets, 2 quizzes, 1 final. Course load is manageable, just make sure to start early and manage time wisely.

Shindler is super funny and caring during lectures. His lectures are clear and easy to follow, but are sometimes a little too basic. There are 5 program hw's, 2 midterms, and 1 final. The exams are easy b/c they are similar to the practice exams that he gives out with solutions. hw's 1-3 were hard (took at least 6 hrs each), hw's 4-5 were short tho
Excellent and passionate professor. Good explanations of concepts and clearly enjoys teaching. Projects are easier than Thornton's, and exams are very fair - no surprises.

Love Shindler so much! His lectures are actually engaging and easy to follow unlike Pattis or Thornton where they just go over specifics about the language. Projects were pretty easy just start early. Problem sets were easy. Gives practice exams for midterms/final which are really similar to the actual exam.

"Fun" professor, but lectures are confusing. Barely any notes on his slides that he posts online (if you don't go to lecture, you won't understand the notes he writes on the slides). Only good thing is that he is flexible with deadlines (asks for students' opinions), often moves back deadlines. Takes a thousand years to grade your assignments/exams
Awesome Prof! cares about his students, gives great lectures, has a fair workload, and knows his stuff!

Very well organized. Not an easy or fun experience, however, despite the potential of the material to be super interesting. She is nice and accessible, but the assignments, exams, and final are all unnecessarily stressful and rigorous. You will get an A if you put the effort in, but the struggle should be worth more

Wong-Ma's ICS 51 course is definitely on the harder side. The content is also quite difficult.
However, she is an adept lecturer and there are plenty of extra credit opportunities as well, notably on the mini-tests, course evaluation, and final.
Try hard and you will definitely get an A. I'm taking ICS 53 next quarter with her as well.

This is the first ics professor who is so on top of her game, and is an amazing lecturer. GO TO LECTURE, you will never regret going. You learn so much from her, and even though 53 is 6 units and she def does not make it easy - it was worth the information. Tests are difficult, but not horrendous and homeworks' are really long so start early.

Wong-Ma is the best ICS professor I've had yet. Her lectures are very engaging and informative, and she gives tons of practice problems to help you study for mini-tests. The mini-tests and the final project are difficult, but make you learn a lot. She offers extensive support by having regular office hours, great LAs, and long open lab sessions.

Probably one of the best lecturers at UCI (attend lecture!!). Good notes and clear project specs. Quizzes and final were very reasonable and she provides practice problems that are similar. Homeworks are difficult, but you learn a lot from them. She gives you all the resources you need to succeed.

Amazing lecturer who cares deeply about students, the material, and the class. The TAs and LAs are very generous with their time (openlab 3 days a week for the whole day). She gives you the material to succeed, you just have to put in time for labs and tests (6 unit class). Super interesting class overall and I wish every professor was like Wong-ma

Prof. Wong-ma is one of the best professors I've ever had. Her course is very well organized with tons of resources (practice problems, Canvas quizzes, in-class notes, videos) to prepare for mini-tests. Be warned: she does make it difficult as it's a 6-unit class (labs take forever), but she has engaging lectures and makes learning feel rewarding.

Prof. Wong-Ma is an exceptional lecturer. This was probably the most organized class i've ever taken. You can really tell how much time and thought goes into developing the class. has many opportunities to succeed and provides tons of practice. lectures were extremely helpful and she really makes it fun and provides a healthy environment to learn.
Goat-Ma best ics prof here

People that hate on Wong-Ma are just mad they don't attend lectures and can't keep up with the class! She's truly an amazing professor and lecturer, and you can tell she cares about her students. This is the best lower div class I've taken at UCI. There is so much help available in this class, you just have to make time for it. TAKE 51 WITH WONG-MA

This class gives out work more than any all your other classes combined. HW is difficult. Exams are difficult. If you liked 51 you would like this course. If you hated 51 then you are screwed. Never had a harder class than this.

I came into the class with gripes concerning her 8 am lectures and the difficulty of this course, but I genuinely think that she has been a great teacher. Project documentation and provided guide videos are extensive and very useful, and lectures are very helpful. This difficult class taught genuinely me a lot about systems programming & C.

Anyone rating her below a 3 is embarrassing, since it's obvious you can't bother to show up to lectures or do the homework yourself. She's an amazing lecturer who breaks down difficult concepts into easy-to-understand ways. While her assignments are difficult, she offers tons of support, such as open labs or walk-through videos to make up for it.

This definitely feels like a 6 unit class (lots of work). However, she is an amazing teacher and truly cares about her students and how they learn. She is very helpful in office hours and her TAs are helpful in Open Lab. I'm really learning a lot from this class and it feels very rewarding.
Not great lot of work for this class

She is literally the best for this class. Her way of explaining concepts is great! I would say her exams are a little difficult but don't worry she provides good review materials to study. The assignments can be difficult so start the moment it is released! Overall, take her!!!

Wong-Ma is an amazing professor who really cares about teaching. She makes it *very* clear upfront it is not an easy class and gives you all the support you need to succeed. The reason I didn't do well in the class was because I was severely depressed and NOT because the course was unfair. I would have learned nada if ICS53 was taught by any other.

Prof is super caring, and lectures were really engaging. The material itself can be tricky at times, especially when working on the projects, but Wong-Ma provides plenty of opportunity to succeed. Extra credits, and openlab are all resources to take advantage of. The exams were also on the easier side, especially compared to the projects.

Obviously a tough class but if you put in a reasonable amount of effort you'll be fine enough to pass / graduate. Despite struggling on multiple projects I felt like she gave a reasonable amount of time to complete the projects except for maybe the first 2 ish weeks when you're first learning C. Lectures are extremely helpful and she teaches well!
Explains content well. Projects take a long time. Exams are somewhat difficult. Difficult class, solid professor.

Sad to see her rating so low when she's among the best CS professors UCI has.  Yes, the workload is heavy but tests never felt unfair and there were ample resources for help.  She clearly cares for students which is rarer at UCI than you might think. Tons of extra credit.

I really enjoyed this class. I learned a lot and even though the material was difficult, it was really rewarding to learn it and apply it towards the projects. She actually cares for her students. Very motherly.

She's literally great at her job she's a great teacher and she actually gives a damn about her students unlike literally every other prof at this school everyone who gave her a low rating is just complaining about the fact that they have to do hard work in this class like what else did you expect a difficult college class to be like.

ICS 53 is a hard class. YOU CANNOT JUST CHATGPT THE HOMEWORK IN ONE DAY. The homeworks take a long time to read and understand, and require you to know the lecture material. Some of mine took 20+ hours. Prof is an amazing lecturer, I wouldn't skip lecture. There's decent EC. Grades are based on lab (easy), hw and midterm. This is a great class.
Took advantage of bad weather conditions to award extra credit to students

For her fall, it was 3 mini tests (30 min each), 9 labs, 5 homework assignments (6th extra one for ec), and a final. She had amazing lectures that helped me understand the topics better. She gives you enough prep materials for all assessments and is fair when she gives you a grade. She also provided lots of extra credits. Take this professor!

Amazing lectures that consisted of different ways to teaching the concepts which helped me understand them easier than the book. Her fall consisted of 3 mini tests (30 min each), 5 required homework assignments, 9 labs, and a final. She teaches you C the first 2 weeks and gives you enough prep materials for all assessments. Overall, amazing proff!
hope this help. this class is very hard that is it

Class is definitely tough at times but there's plenty of resources provided to make it through the class - open lab, textbook, and lecture. Homeworks, Labs, and Minitests workload comes out to just under the 6 unit workload. If you're willing to work there's a lot to be gained from this class, but be warned that this is not a free class or free A.

Excellent lecturer who does give a lot of work (6 HW projects that can take up to 20hrs each) but the homework is doable and the midterms aren't too crazy. On one, she did try to trip students up with a super small thing (i-- instead of i++ on a for loop that changes the entire outcome of the question). Overall, very passionate and knowledgable.
Don't even think about getting above A- if you are taking 3 or 4 classes including this class

This class is very hard class and has A LOT of stuff to do and I am pretty sure everyone agrees on this. There is a reason why this class is '6 units' class(think more one more time before you plan your quarter; this class is almost same as 2 classes).

This class has been an absolute nightmare. She does not care if you are busy with other classes, work, extracurriculars or preparing for interviews (which you'd think is more important!!) The deadlines are rushed and frequent; homework is challenging and time consuming. There is an assignment due every two days and tests are difficult.

AVOID

Say goodbye to your mental health. The homeworks are insanely difficult, with little guidance from the professor or lectures. The lectures teach the basics of a topic, while the homeworks require you to already be a master. She teaches C, bash, OS, and networking and expects you to be an expert instantly. Take ICS53 with any other prof if possible.

lectures are engaging, homework isn't as bad as people say - every homework is doable in 2-3 days. 6 unit class = 18 hrs a week, assuming each homework takes 20 hrs - weekly that's 3 hrs in class, 10 hrs on hw, 2 hrs on labs + overflow for studying - it's right in the expected workload. most rewarding lower div in cs!
Avoid if you can
You won't have time to work on other classes, so take it at your own risk. Homework specification documents are 20pages long on average, and confusing. Oh, there's no curve btw.
Just take this class ONLY otherwise you will get C or lower

it is 100% true that you will learn something very specific but you will spend "a lot" of time for this. just take 2 classes including this class if you want to get A- or higher.
Test is very difficult and grade is very tough. for homework, you need to spend at least whole week to get 100%.
she not like us

don't believe the hype not a great teacher (kinda annoying) learned most material by myself, lots of unnecessary work could have learned this all on youtube but still got an aaaaa french montana haaaaaaa

There is a difference between a class with difficult content and a difficult professor. ICS53 is a hard class, but Wong-Ma makes it worst. She uses the “6 units” class as the reason to make students put in (def more than 6 units of) extra work. Projects and tests are back to back, you won't have a single moment to even think about other classes.

Avoid her class if you can. Unless you have the time to study day and night and no other classes or work to worry about. 

She has no regard for students time. Way too much work is assigned in a short period of time.

Prof Wongma is a good professor, but I avoid highly recommend taking someone different for 53 if you don't care for this topic. Her class requires a lot more time than the other professors that teach 53.

Avoid her if you can, you won't have any free time for other classes, extracurriculars or life LOL

Prof. Wong-Ma is passionate but the course load is intense. The assignments are challenging, but using tools like unstuckstudy ai can really help with study prep. Overall, a rewarding class if you're willing to put in the work.

Really tough class but you definitely learn a lot. Projects are really interesting and are good enough to put on resume. You'll struggle on the projects and they take a long time so be wise with your time. There's lab hours where LA's help you which is a lifesaver.

Had her for 51 and 53. Either of these classes with her will be the most difficult and intensive class you've ever taken, but you will never learn as much as you do with Wong-Ma. I gained such a deep understanding in both classes and it genuinely pours over and helps across the board in CS. I actually wish I could take every CS class with her.

Wong-Ma is an incredible professor. Her enthusiasm and passion for CS really shows in the way she teaches and interacts with students. She doesn't just read off of the slides, she also has interactive activities to help you visualize topics. The only "bad" thing about her is how difficult the hw assignments are. But, you will learn so much with her

The class was hard with 20+ hour projects. However, I improved a lot as a programmer and student over the quarter. Even though the class was stressful and frustrating occasionally, I still think taking it with Wong-Ma was the right move.

She gets a lot of flak but if you're a good student (study, attend and pay attention in lec, start assignments early) you'll do well in this course. Except maybe the last project that one was really long (luckily she's fairly generous with credit though). Exams had nothing unexpected. Prof Wong-Ma is the goat.
Not great, actually terrible, lots of work

I was excited for this class at first... however, tedious and chaotic homework, where the information on the doc is not consequent and pieces and bits are scattered made me truly dislike it. As a senior taking this class my last quarter I can assure you the learning outcomes compared to the time spent on the assignments is so not worth it. AVOID

I do not understand a lot of the backlash against this professor. She is an amazing lecturer and I have never seen an ICS class so well organized. Take note that this is a 6 unit course, so there will be a LOT of hw and labs to complete. Weekly tests as well, but she offers many resources to help you study.

She will likely respond within a day to ed posts, but around 3 weeks to anything non related to course material: sickness, family death, etc.
Homeworks and assessments were completely unrelated except for one :D
Some effort put in by her, but focused and appealed to the wrong standards for many students learning styles

Does not deserve her low ratings. If you put in the effort to learn and attend the MULTITUDE of available office hours for help, you will get an A. She teaches difficult topics so of course the class is hard. Wouldn't want to take this class with any other prof. Super responsive on ed. Very passionate about the subject and her students' success.
pkfiree recommended this class, and as he says it's easy if you try. if you know, you know

I took Wong-Ma for two of her courses in a single quarter and the amount of work she gives requires a TON of time. I recommend her for only one of her courses at a time since it takes away from so much else you can be working on. Aside from that, I think some people enjoyed her a lot more than me, but overall she was a pretty good professor.

Spring '23 did have a rough ending bc of personal struggles for Wong-Ma, but she is a great professor, gives informative lectures, and tries to answer everyone's questions in & out of class. Lots of EC opportunities, make sure to attend lectures and utilize lab and you'll do fine in her class.

This Professor RUINED my year.  She structures the course as if it's a 15 unit class that's supposed to take up all your time. If you take this class, expect to do bad in your other classes that quarter and have NO social life WHATSOEVER. To anyone reading this, STAY AWAY FROM THIS CLASS...for your sake.

Personally not the biggest WongMa fan but I can respect her course structure and she is really there to help students out. However, the last few weeks of the class has run so sloppy and has caused unnecessary stress for everyone involved. Especially dropping an entire module the last week while also having HW5 should be criminal.

The workload for this class is unrealistic, even for 6 units. 5 assignment, each with around 20 pages worth of text and you won't finish them without multiple all nighters. Exams have C average grades.  There is extra credit and a curve but the class average with it is a B-, which is a big red flag. Save the time and stress of possible and avoid

I've taken classes that were difficult for all the wrong reasons (lack of organization, lectures don't match exams).

Professor Wong Ma's course is difficult for all the right reasons. To pass, you will need to put in the hours and learn. The course is the most organized I've taken at UCI. Lectures, homework, and exams are great and correlate well.

Her lecture is top-notch. Attendance may not be required, but missing out means losing valuable insights. Great materials are provided too. Despite her heavy workload, this 6-credit OS course is challenging. As long as you are willing to persevere in her class, the final outcome will definitely be good.

Very caring and fun professor. ICS53 is a 6 unit course so expect to put some extra time into this course compared to others; however, if you really enjoy programming, the extra work load isn't that bad. Provides healthy amount of extra credit too, and curves at the end of the course. Bottom line: if you try, you will pass.

This class teaches you MIPS assembly, then you need to figure out, learn C by yourself! Get ready to read 20 pages on each HW. All she does in the class is talk about the basics! I see a lot of ratings of people who get lower than A and say is a great professor! well honey, she is horrible! All your grade is on you, you are the one self teaching :)

Wongma trilogy completed, and 53 is the best of all the courses. Graded by minitests and several coding projects in C that give practical experience with the systems concepts. You will learn so much from this class, and while it is not easy, it is undoubtedly one of the best courses at UCI. This is nos urprise though, Wongma is a master at teaching

This professor expects you to self teach yourself everything about c, just a bunch of links in the HW and Labs for you to go and read! in the lecture time she just talks bunch of jargon and doesn't teach anything! I have no idea why she is still teaching at UCI! worst professor ever

The class was very hard, but but with professor Wong-Ma you have everything to get an A (I didn't use it tho, hence the grade). If  you have to take this class, take it with her. lecture attendance is not required, but if you wanna do good in this class, attend. She is also super helpful in office hours. Overall, amazing person and professor.

Really enjoy the class so far, loved her lectures. But I really dislike having to hunt down some minor requirements in the docs or adding or deleting a space or newline in the code to match the test case. I learn nothing doing those and they are the most consuming parts.

Difficult but very well-taught class. Lectures were not mandatory but were very high quality and essential to understanding the material. Assignments could be lengthy and difficult but grading is very clear and help is always available from classmates, TA's/tutors, and Wong-Ma herself. Highly recommend this class as Wong-Ma is very passionate!

If you want to do well you have to go to class. MIPS may not be a useful language but it does help you understand CS topics better and what is going on in memory when you code. Six unit class, you can expect it to be hard but I think Wong-Ma is the best professor for the course. Her online help isn't the most useful, better to ask TAs.

Wong-Ma tells you at the beginning of the quarter that this class has a heavy workload, but it was pretty manageable for me. If you start early on the coding, then you should be fine. There is help available Mon-Thurs from 8-5 plus Ed Discussion and resources on Canvas. She's a great lecturer and I don't regret taking this class at all.

Firstly, she is only responsive to course-related questions and nothing else. If you tell her you are struggling or have any emergencies/problems or you are sick - she doesn't care/ she doesn't even reply and you just anxiously keep waiting. Secondly, we are learning the most useless language which NO ONE will ever have to use- it's so stressful.

It's basically two classes in one, programming and conceptual. I think she's very fair and sometimes lenient on test grading. Her homework is also fair and not too difficult. 5 tests in total and 4 homework's. Bi-Weekly tests and HW. Lab is every other week. She's super organized, probably most organized professor you'll get. I recommend her.

Best instructor in the entire University. You will learn an unbelievable amount. Insanely high workload, but if you don't neglect the tests and homework, you can get an A. Don't let the difficulty scare you-take Wongma to master the material. Tons of EC, 5 major theory-based tests, 4 huge programming homeworks, and some coding/theory labs. Girlboss

Prof Wong-ma gives out a lot of work, even for a 6 unit class. Some of the homeworks took me multiple long days to complete, and were at times quite tedious. You learn a lot, but the price of free time.

Wong-Ma is a great professor. Her notes and her lectures are all informative and are really helpful. If you struggle, there's also plenty of other resources (office hours, QnA sessions, etc.) that can help you out in the class.

The class is difficult and does have a lot of work, but it is a 6 unit class so you should expect it to be difficult.

Good lecturer but the workload is a bit much. Her lectures were all online even though she attempted to push for in person learning. I guess she got lazy half-way through the quarter, but depending on your career goals and interests this class could be deemed useless in CS. There was no need to go as in depth in the material as she did. Time wasted

Right off the bat, Wong-Ma is an awesome lecturer. She is extremely well-prepared and phenomenally organized. However, her workload is insane. 2 quizzes a week, Bi-weekly tests, Labs, and extremely long homework assignments mean that this class is a huge time drain. You'll need to have a light schedule to accommodate this class. Good Luck.

Class was fine all online. She made optional lectures in person. if it's an optional lecture then why not make it accessible for everyone who wants help? Just goes to show she was only looking out for her own interests since she kept saying that she "missed" teaching in person. Homework is unnecessarily long. Should be 8 units, not 6.

While ICS 53 is a tough class, you'll definitely learn a lot with Prof Wong-Ma. My experience with the course was difficult and I had to retake it, but she definitely cares about her students and puts a ton of time into the course. The Canvas page is organized, the lecture videos are well-made, and she's a great professor!

Wong-Ma is super organized and is clear on the schedule of the entire 10 weeks. This is a 6 unit course, so expect 6 units of work; the hw projects, labs, and lectures are a lot and may feel overwhelming for some, but they're all really well made and suits the material. A good amount of extra credit for hw; the final is a partner project.

Professor Wongma really cares about her students successes. Her classes are not easy by any means, but I have noticed the difference in quality and the time she invests into her courses in contrast to other courses I have taken. While I did not do well in the course, I personally learned a lot and found it invaluable!

I've taken much harder classes at UCI from AI to ML to Compilers and OS but she makes this class unnecessarily hard by making us write C code that takes forever to debug and work. And with an intelligent systems specialization, this class could not be more useless to me and I actually learned nothing. Just wrote C code that took forever to write.

Professor Wong Ma's classes are always heavy on the workload but you leave feeling like you learned a lot. The autograder for 53 is a godsend and it's better to take the time to debug rather than spamming it. She grades fairly and reasonably because everything is provided in the homework specifications and her office hours are really helpful.

She's very accessible and responsive and holds regular open labs, office hours, and Q&A sessions. MAKE SURE TO TAKE A LIGHT LOAD BECAUSE THIS CLASS IS A LOT OF WORK! Do the extra credit if you want an A. Final project is long and hard. This class is doable. In my quarter, 45.3% of students got at least an A- and 82% of students got at least a C.

ICS 53 with Prof Wong Ma is a really hard class, but you do learn a lot, and she is an amazing teacher. She is very active on Piazza and overall wants to help you succeed. The class has weekly lecture Canvas quizzes, bi-weekly labs, and bi-weekly project assignments. Overall, the course is well-designed but quite difficult, so dont fall behind.

I worked so hard in this class. Homeworks are fair enough as long as you put in some effort. Everything is fair except for the final project. You should be very careful when it comes to choosing your partner. I finished it by myself and in the middle of the project, I was thinking why am I doing all this for my partner. It was not fair at all.

Wong-ma is a really good prof but the class is way too hard, almost to the point of it being unreasonably hard, especially if you work/have other responsibilities. The HW's take a lot of time. Quizzes/labs are straight forward and easy. Don't take any other hard classes. If you want an easy A, you might want to take a different prof. Good luck!

Very organized class, very detailed yet concise notes (15 pages every two weeks), and very passionate professor. A lot of work you need to put in, but it is a 6-unit class. There are somewhat difficult mini-tests every two weeks, but she drops the lowest grade and there are hella extra credit opportunities. She really tries to make you succeed.

I was hella scared to take her class bc of all the reviews Ive seen, but her class wasnt as bad as people made it out to be. Yes, Ill admit the workload was next level, but it is 6 units. As long as you do your work, you should honestly have no problem. Granted, maybe its her 53 class thats the actual hard one.

Really passionate professor. Course was hard but there was a lot of resources to learn from if you actually tried. Many office and lab hours for help, practice questions+practice tests,live 2 hr problem solving session with wong ma thats recorded, notes, lecture videos, etc. Lots of resources to succeed even though its a hard course.

Very passionate professor, often available and helpful on Piazza. Pretty rigorous course, but after all, it is 6 units. Prof gives clear lectures and notes, though tests (5 of them) are pretty challenging. Optional final exam (because of remote learning?). Lots of opportunities of practice problems/exams, and a good amount of EC. Highly recommend!

GOD her class is hard. I cried several times during fall quarter but this was one of the most rewarding things I've ever had to do. I'm insanely nervous and excited for her 53! Honestly, I'm in this major to become better at cs and wong ma makes me better at cs. That's enough reason for me to give her a good rating. I'm even expecting a B in 53

I literally spent at least 40 hours a week on Mips coding. The materials are not too difficult until module 6. Her tests are reasonable as long as you are able to solve the practice mini-tests that she provides. She also gives extra credits about 2  5 %, but you need to earn some of them. Overall, It was manageable, but it was also painful.

If you want to spend all of your time learning, then this course is for you (for me about 40+ hours a week). If you care about your study motivation and mental health, you should think twice. Wong-ma's lectures are extraordinary. But her workload is unnecessary, unfair, and disappointing.

Everyone says not to take her but honestly, you do learn a lot. The class does ask a lot from you (all the assignments are pretty time-consuming) but I enjoyed doing the projects. Just stay ahead of the game and you'll be fine. Her lectures are pretty useful too and she uses many visuals so it makes the material easier to understand.

I wouldnt take 53 again but I'd take Wong-ma over any professor. She is organized, reasonable, and caring. She's everything you want from a professor. My only regret is not taking advantage of open lab and office hours sooner and not starting projects sooner. You will doubt yourself but there is help available

Wong-Ma isn't a bad lecturer, she does a pretty good job at explaining stuff and I definitely learned from the class. But the homework is unbelievably hard. I was pushing 35+ hours a week on it because she makes it so unnecessarily complex. Be prepared to have a lot of work and don't overload your schedule if you take her, or you will regret it.

"You will learn a lot", about a dead 32-bit assembly language no one uses anymore. Lectures & homework don't really match up, tests even less. One of those teachers that refuses to put out a study guide too. Every assignment took more than 2 hours, last 2 homework sets took 8+. Insanely hard teacher for a class 99% of people only need for credit.

Genuinely wants you to succeed and cares a lot about it. But, it's definitely a hard class. I took it while taking ICS 33 with Pattis and I would say it's 80% of Pattis's workload power but 120% + more difficult. Start early on homework, especially #3 and #4. It took me maybe 40+ hours each. You're responsible for programming and computer architect

It's like she couldn't decide between lectures, quizzes, labs, homework, or group projects and just included all of them in the class. Deadline every other day for something different. Material isn't difficult, but assignments are long and tedious for no reason, not to mention boring. Had to write 2 separate parsers in C and learned nothing.

Amazing lectures. She explains things really well and you're going to love her if you're a visual learner. She's also really caring and is always willing to help. HOWEVER her hw projects are the absolute worst. They're really complex and take forever to complete. This is the hardest class I've ever taken and gave me a great amount of anxiety.

Professor Wong-Ma is one of the harder professors at UCI, however, she's honestly a great teacher. Difficulty wise, she's up there with Pattis, but you can tell that she genuinely cares about teaching. She also provides detailed notes that help a lot for studying, and at the end of the day, you'll learn a lot in her class.

Class was pretty hard, but she did good for an online class and was very organized. The professor and the TAs were all active on Piazza, which really helped. For this class, the best advice I could give is to start on the coding assignments early, like a week before the due date. She gives late passes, so you can miss some deadlines for a few days.

Most frustrating class I ever took. When you ask for help from the professor she just points back to her notes. If you still don't understand she just points back to the notes. It's so stupid how she only grades things and doesn't give any answers back to review for future reference. She says you don't need the book but her notes and lectures suck.

Wong-ma's class is DEFINITELY time-consuming, but she genuinely cares about her students and is an engaging professor! However, I would STRONGLY suggest avoiding her class depending on the other courses you're also taking. I took ICS 33 with Pattis at the same time and I wanted to throw myself off the curb.

ICS 51 with Prof. Wong-Ma is the UCI CS equivalent to getting 5 tattoos on the same asscheek. After finishing the course, you *may* gain something you'll appreciate (+ she's a good teacher). But in the process of taking it (esp. while doing her projects) all you'll feel and think about is pain and suffering, & you'll question your life decisions.

She only goes over concepts in the lecture videos, and will leave you clueless on how to even start your homework projects and final project. She expects you to be a god at C programming already before taking this class.

The class is 6 units, but feels like two 4 unit courses: programming in MIPS and computer architecture. There were 8 multi-questioned programming assignments, 20 quizzes, and 4 exams in 10 weeks. Not enough time for any exam; had to reissue one because of complaints. More concerned with people cheating than actually testing our knowledge/ability.

Ok let me start by saying her classes are HARD. But she's honestly a very empathetic professor. If you really show you're trying she will do everything she can to help you succeed. Her teaching style is great and helped me break down complex concepts. I don't like systems at all, but I found her class very interesting and pretty enjoyable.

Wong Ma turned out to be one of my favorite professors at UCI. There are 4 homework assignments and 4 exams which make up the bulk of your grade. She gives you everything you need through lecture notes, helpful videos, Q&A, practice exams, quizzes, lab time, and TA hours to pass this class with flying colors. It is not an easy A but I learned a lot

If you're a good programmer, prepare for a do-able challenge. If you are borderline in CS courses up to this point, prepare for a sea of suffering that makes you rethink your major (don't give up though you can do it). Hard projects, culminating in a final project where you build a multithreaded client-server chat system.

She's great at teaching and she's done a great job adjusting to online teaching. Her instructions & expectations are very clear, and she's easily accessible. However, there's So. Much. Work. There's lots of help if you need it, but you will still struggle immensely. Be prepared and don't slack off. You will learn a lot, but also suffer a lot

She doesn't get the credit she deserves, at least reflected by the rating here. She's probably among the top few competent ICS professors with a strong and clear curriculum laid out for students. Provides a sea of resources especially for remote learning, but definitely makes you think with her projects. You will come out a better engineer.

Professor Wong-Ma is definitely one of the more difficult professors to encountered in a lower division course. However, getting a good grade at the end makes you feel like you've definitely earned it. She is incredibly helpful when you need it and definitely goes through the material thoroughly.

Honestly this is what classes SHOULD feel like. Her workload isnt unreasonable. Its understandable. Theres projects/hw, midterms, and finals. Labs are essentially participation. The difficulty of her class is WAY overhyped. Dont be intimidated. Shes very kind and tries to pass as many as she can with good grades, always offering extra credit
You'll become fat because of how much you'll be sitting on your butt working for this class

She gets a lot of hate but is honestly a great teacher. She was very accommodating during covid with deadline extensions. She was super caring about her students' wellbeing. It is still a difficult class, 4 very hard coding projects + a partner final project. Start early on the code it will make life a lot easier.

Wong-Ma is one of the best professors at UCI. If you don't think so, you're probably a naive little newbie coder, wet behind the ears. CS is hard. If you can't do 53 with Wong-Ma, try a different major. This class will punish you for cutting corners. It will. Read the textbook, go to lecture, put in the work, and STOP CRYING. You will learn a lot.
Will make you Hate Computer Science.

Caring but she knows how hard the projects are, and she definitely knows how to teach properly. Projects are not really really hard but very time-consuming. Huge curve in the end because of the poor avg. You can definitely learn stuff, but be prepared for spending 10+ hrs on one single project and there are 5 throughout the quarter.

Her class is not for the faint of heart. Hard projects and dense material, and Wong Ma has strict policies. Teaches well, but you will need to work more than average to keep up. If you are open to this tho, you understanding of low-level CS, C programming/systems will improve tenfold, helpful if you wanna work somewhere like Microsoft (very C/C++)

I really wanted to believe that the other reviews were false, but beware they are not and I mean it. This will be one of the hardest classes you will ever take at UCI. Get ready to loose your mind for 10 weeks doing the hardest projects you have ever been assigned. If you can, don't take 53 with her, but I did learn a lot... not worth it though.

Wish I spent more time on this class, I got a bad grade in it but Wong Ma is still a good teacher. She knows what she's teaching. Her quizzes and programming assignments aren't too difficult at all, they just require you to prepare early for them.
Think you're good at CS? Take her class to truly find out.

Such a great professor; hands down one of my favorites. The class is difficult but you will definitely learn and she goes out of her way to make sure you are able to understand the material. Has a textbook but it's kind of optional. Start homework as early as possible so you can ask questions.
Wong Ma will make you hate computer science and depressed.

Terrible at teaching. Homework on material Never learned or covered. Her class being "Hard" makes her feel smart, that she does a better job at teaching than other professors, BUT her students Learn EVEN LESS and are forced to collab or take an F, and waste tuition money. Did we all pay for an education just to learn from Google searching? No.

A number of CS Courses here you can put in minimal effort and still do fine - this is the not the case with Wong Ma's. She's one of the few here that will make you work to earn your CS degree and actually understand CS more. If you're looking to cruise / put in no effort, this is the wrong major for you.
Extremely rude and not accommodating at all. Terrible class experience.

Wong-Ma really makes you work for the grade that you want, she has clear deadlines for labs/hw, and you should start early. Homework gets longer and harder as the quarter progresses but that is why there are open labs, go to them make friends. Her quizzes aren't that bad, just know the material. Also, read the references notes under her videos.

Professor Wong-Ma is a difficult professor, but you will come out of her class knowing more than you could ever hope for. She's so incredibly accessible because she knows how hard her material is and WANTS to help you. She might seem intense, but that's because she's passionate about this subject. Projects are laid out well and tests are fair.

Professor Wong-Ma is a great professor. If you are not willing to put work in you will not do well in her class. She expects you to struggle with the work and actually try, that is the only way to be successful. Similar to other ICS courses, you need to attend lecture to fully understand concepts and do well. Rating is low b/c students don't try.

In short: NOT EZ, but organized. Wong-ma's class is definitely not one of the easiest ones you'll get on this campus. Her grading is strict, and there are lots of work. BUT she is still so much better than those who you'll get in upper-divs. At least she has clear plans and homework for her class, and she does reply to piazza and email.
I spent 8 hours on 3 parts out of a 10 parts for assignment 4 lmaooooo. Thank you wong-ma for wasting all of the time. It's as if I don't have other classes to worry about!

she gives lots of homework and it's difficult. you really need spend a lot of time, if you not good at MIPS programming. and the lab released every Saturday 6am. which is unreasonable and Ridiculous. quiz every week. not too hard, but not easy as well. I will never go with her ICS 53 .

Probably the hardest lower-division professor you'll have - 53 with her makes it a (late in the curriculum) weeder class. Good lectures, at the price of a heavy project workload and dense exams. She has very little mercy in her grading scheme and policies, and makes you write a lot of code.

I'd recommend attending lecture since they're interesting and Wong-Ma explains material pretty clearly; plus you get extra credit. Homeworks definitely take time, though you get some automated testcases. Exam material was straightforward, but there's lots of questions packed in. Overall, she's one of the better ICS lecturers IMO.
wasted 3 months of college life for this low quality and closed minded instructor who run low quality courses.

Personally I wouldn't take her if you want an A. All the quizzes, labs, and assignments were really easy so she made the final very difficult. I would take some easier class to get the grade since I think she is terrible at gauging how to grade students. I would go to here lectures tho to actually learn.

An energetic and humorous lecturer who explains the material well and always asks if we have any questions. Super helpful at office hours, even willing to stay extra hours. Has never made me feel dumb or bad for asking a question. This is a 6 unit class, which makes her workload fair. Quizzes are way easy compared to practice problems. Lots of ec

Wongma clearly knows the material and is enthusiastic about it, but the material itself is the most boring crap I had to sit through. Homework docs were sometimes hard to understand and had errors. Workload became extremely heavy at about midterm week (ICS51 does not have a midterm). This was her first time teaching ICS51, so cut her some slack.

53 with her is probably tougher, but I'd recommend taking her for 51. She's an engaging lecturer and is responsive to students' questions. The workload is definitely manageable. 5 quizzes, 4 HW assignments, and 4 labs, all of which were pretty easy with the exception of HW 3 which was by far the most difficult.

Professor Wong-ma is trying to be funny in her class. But the effect is only making the class worse. You can fall asleep easily on her lecture. This class require you to do as much homework as two other upper level class require. Quiz is extremely difficult. TA taught nothing in class. If you don't want to destroy your life, don't take her class.

Really makes you work HARD for your grade, but in hindsight you'll see that you learned a ton. Her class is not for the faint of heart, but will give you a taste of the real rigor of CS and expose you to core CS OS concepts. Many UCI CS classes strongly lack in much needed rigor - Wong Ma's 53 is not one of those. Don't expect to be babied here.

Extremely condescending professor. I did well in the class but would never take a class with her again. Several of the projects were extremely boring and irrelevant to somebody trying to succeed in a career in systems programming.

I think Professor Wong-Ma has gotten a bad rap. This is a tough subject and you shouldn't expect to just cruise through it. Her tests are hard so you will need to study for them. However, her lectures are engaging and she knows the material thoroughly. If you want to learn the material, I recommend her class.

DO NOT take her class if you want your life easier. She tries to talk a lot of stuff in her lectures but none of them is useful. TAs suck. They are not responsible. The discussion is awful. HEAVY homework. If you have more than 3 classes, please don't take it.

A condescending instructor that does not like to listen. She blindly constructed that class with a unfair and unreasonable schedule. She is not solely following her gradings schema. BE AWARE She will give you an F if she THINK your work is not passing or "test scores is not good enough" which are subjective.

Yes, the class is difficult, you will need to study a lot, and the projects take time... but do you think computer science is supposed to be easy? Do you think you will graduate and a company will ask you to write 10 lines of code and you'll be done for the day? No. You will learn a ton in this class, she is super accessible, and she is passionate.

This is one of the best classes I took. Of course, I think this class is time consuming but not necessarily hard. You need to spend a lot of time in this class and you WILL learn some really useful skills and tools after this class.

Very passionate about teaching, but teaches the class like a drill instructor, which definitely splits student opinion on her. She's extremely strict for a class of this difficulty, so you will need to work in a sink or swim environment. OS concepts will be pounded into your head.

If you disagree this class strategy or ways of teaching, youd be told you are trashing her and the class. Or she will overwhelm you with stories that someone elses trashy comments that you wont see any proof to make you feel bad about questioning her any her class. Unprofessional
Really low quality class. This professor doesn't know how to teach operating system. Her explanations are alway on really high level, but her hw required super details low level techniques.

This was a really hard and tough class. But Wong-Ma is a very hardworking lecturer and pours in a lot of effort into teaching. Don't dodge Wong-Ma just because she's hard. If you truly have a heart to learn, I would give her a chance and take this class. You will walk out learning A LOT. She is an amazing teacher. just don't give up!

She pushes you, and sometimes frustrates you, but shes fair and teaches you a lot. Her office hours are VERY HELPFUL. Shes also very active on Piazza. Study hard for tests as theres no partial credit on MC questions (although sometimes theres EC). If you take 53 with her, let it be the only demanding class in your schedule. Overall, good prof.

Let me be honest.I am a senior student, taking a bunch of upper div classes. Until week 2, the material was super easy. I was already working so hard to catch up with other upper div classes, but I didn't drop this one because it was super easy. The workload became 10 times more after then, and my entire quarter was ruined. Be aware of the workload
good professor teaching tough material. workload is heavy and tests are difficult, sure. but wong-ma is a good professor nonetheless.

Okay, probably everyone says something terrible about her. Let's be objective a little bit. YES she is tough, YES she makes student learning, and YES there is a lot of works. But aslo please understand this is a 6 unit class and you are in a top 30 ranking school to learn one of the hardest topics -- operating system, so stop raging and think.

I never expect to be a complainer, and I deeply respect every teacher in my life. But she is ruining my life and my graduate study plan. It is spring now and I need to retake it next winter to avoid her. I understand that she and some people think it's helpful for students to actually learn, but there must be a reason for so many complains.
NIghtmare of a class. I feel so burned out after this, incredibly long and tedious hws combined with hard tests and mandatory labs.

Overall, this is a difficult class for almost everyone. Her ways of teaching did not help students to better address the course materials. Her hws could make students even struggling more. If you are a student who already have plenty experience with low level operating system, you may want to take her class.

The lecture is not mandatory attendance, but there are extra credits given in some random lectures for attending. However, you are not guaranteed to get those credits because she let students write their student email on a paper, and she may lose it. What a great professor! I know I deserve such professor because I didn't study hard in high school.
Easy class, but complete waste of time. Obfuscates easy concepts too make not hard, but tedious hws. Usually took half a day-2 days for me, not hard just very tedious. Very hard tests though.

This class is too demanding compare to other ICS classes. You would have to make great amount time available for this class in order to finish/partially finish the assignments. Her class policies are unforgiving and strict. NO dropping lowest score, no late pass. Mostly weekly assignments. NOT recommending to take with other difficult classes.

Her workload is insane. Her (major) saving grace unlike many professors here is that she's clearly knowledgable in the material, and does in fact run a very well-organized (but ridiculously strict) class. But it's torture. She can teach for sure, but she makes you pay for her teaching with ungodly 10 week suffering in C.
Took a few years off my life and a few more grey hairs for sure. Was it worth it? Not at all, unless you into embedded systems. Not practical at all for modern job market.

She is the type of professor that gives negative points if you get a question wrong on an exam. She would rather you put I dont know for 0 points instead of thinking and putting your best answer. Thats enough you need to know about Wong-Mas style of teaching, its all or nothing. Probably the biggest mistake of my college career.
For me, it was a terrible class, don't know why the require it. Most hated class I have ever taken.

This is the most difficult obstacle I have met in UCI. This class made me lost health, school life, all effort I have put for GPA, and happiness. I felt sad and upset almost every day. I do not know why I have to suffer such pain and did not get anything back. It totally ruined my life, seriously. I really want to know why?! Maybe I am too stupid
Avoid her

I did not learn very much from this class. The homework is very time consuming and in my opinion busy work that is not nearly insightful as she thinks it is. Class just had an unneeded amount of difficulty on basic principles masquerading as "rigor." Hope she changes up her style, very stubborn.

Don't take her ICS53 if you're still not comfortable with programming. If you're a decent coder, it's a solid B+ class. If you're into system programming, you'll like it. I suffered but learned a lot from this class. Pros: Real learning if you work for it, organized lectures & material, strict but fair gradings Cons: Time consuming HW, hard exam
This is not a 6 units class. More like a 12 units worth class. As a student, Should we let her know by talking to the university regarding this??
Just don't take her, you will get a F. Spending 40 hours on homework, but can't even pass any of test.
Boring lecturers. Difficulty/time consuming homework. Hash Grading. It is hard to learn anything in her class.
The class was average. Her style and attitude is bad as she will dismiss students view.

My opinion: You want to get good at basketball and I said, OK, make a ball,get all the raw materials, every dot on the ball you will draw manually, dots will be measured and must be perfect circles. Difficult , orthogonally related, but wont really make you a better player. On top of that keep insisting it's a "great experience" the entire way.

zero time for other classes because I spend all my time on her homework and prepping for her tests. Be very careful about your courseload with her, I think she truly expects that you only take her course during a given quarter

She makes this course way too demanding even though it's required, not chosen. The assignments are long/challenging and the tests are very difficult. You will have no life but will learn a lot about C. The class is also curved and well-organized. You could definitely find an easier professor, but the hate towards her on this page seems excessive

No answer for any hw or test has given. There are usually tons of students so asking question is damn hard. There are always lots of conversations going on in Piazza, but everyone always try to avoid detailed answer. For exams, they were the worst. If you prefer in-dept questions than just super tricky questions, don't take this course.

Ironically "being cancer" has entered the vernacular for something that is bad. Particularly in among tech/internet savvy circles. I have actually had cancer. While I would still rather take this class than go through that again, I did have to pause for a moment and think about it, no joke. She gives so much hw and it is very hard. Arrogant too.

Knowledgable professor and good lecturer. A lot of students find her class difficult and her harsh because she sets very expectations for her students, at the border of extreme and pushing your potential. While the assignments are tough, they teach you a lot, and you will come out a much better programmer after this class.

Not a good attitude. She will tell us in lecture that we are bad programmers and dont know anything, and then compare herself to Thornton. She will talk bad about our other professors and courses that we have taken at UCI. Not cool.

I think she is very smart but I think she also lacks empathy. She is very smart and good at C whereas many of us have been programming for maybe 2 years at most and have just learned C this quarter. Things that seems easy and take no time for her take us many many hours. I spend much more time on this class than all my other classes combined.

Worst teacher I've had at UCI. Very stubborn, not willing to adapt, somehow thinks 40 hours of hw a week is normal. Honestly believe that she forgets we have other classes when she designs assignments. Somehow thinks because she is "passionate" this specific word I have seen a lot, that is makes it okay. Very difficult tests as well.

No idea how she expects us to be prepared for assignments when we are struggling to finish the previous one. She goes over concepts for new one in labs,lec meanwhile my mind is still trying to figure out the current assignments which take me on avg 30ish hours a week. For 1 assignment no class,lab,studying included. Very hard tests. Unrealistic.

A really disorganized class with a overconfident Professor. The assignments require unreasonable amount of time. She went to lecture notes really fast and dumps everything to the students. She expects you to learn but overwhelmed students with 3 hard exam. The class policy are hash. no late work pass. no dropping lowest assignments. bad experience.

Engaging lectures and extremely knowledgeable. While with many other classes you walk away with only a superficial understanding since you don't apply the concepts but only discuss them at a high level, jwong's 53 ensures you walk away with a thorough, complete understanding. Yes, it's hard, but it's about time CS courses got more rigorous at UCI.
Tough class. Tough teacher.

It is very easy to make a class difficult. Any professor can make a class Difficult. However, being plain difficult doesnt Equal to good quality, doesnt mean inspiration, doesnt represent high quality education. A great Professor should know how to balance difficultly with other factors. This Professor certainly achieved the difficulty part.

Extremely difficult and heavy loaded class. The style is not fit everyone. Most of assignments require a deep understanding of C. You would have a total of 6 C program assignments in 10 weeks respectively 10-16 pages requirements for each. Plus 2 midterms 1 final. 15+ labs (with assignments) plus reading.

Extremely divisive professor where you will either enjoy her style or hate it like no tomorrow... there's no middle ground for how you'll feel about this class so you'll need to experience it yourself. runs the class in a no non-sense manner throughout the 10-week grind, and she's very strict.
I like her as a person. The material was so dense and she is a new professor. Its just a rough mix. Am not smart so learning from her was very hard.

I have taken Wong-Ma's 53 and 122a and they were both pleasant experiences. The difficulty of 53 is definitely overblown here, if you have any prior experience with C it is not too bad. Professor Wong-Ma is one of the best professor's at UCI. Plenty of extra credit and engaging lectures, although she gave a very difficult final.
Professor Jennifer is amazing.

Worst professor I have had here. Any discussion of her shortcomings is immediately suppressed on reddit/discord by a small group of her loyal followers who live to program C. Most people think she has unrealistic expectations on how much time should be dedicated to the class, which lead to 40+ hours of week on this single class.

The instructor failed to build a reasonable schedule for Students to actual learn the materials. Making students rushing through things. Her tone and attitude she used to when communicate with students sometimes could be harsh and thoughtless or ironic. Maybe she is still confused with how long the quarter system last.

Its unreasonable for a student to have to spend all their time on a homework like you have to do for this class. Even if it is 6 units. All your time for 1 class would make sense if it was 12 units. Sure, the professor is enthusiastic, but maybe too much. She doesn't consider that not everyone is able to be 100% invested in her class like she is.
As a student, you dont feel this classs staff and the Professor herself are standing with you. They are against you.

You will need to work for your grade in this class, but having professors like her increase the overall rigor of the UCI CS program and as a result prestige - she's organized and is extremely responsive to feedback, given how she's adjusted from her 1st 53 offering till now. She cares about students learning and rewards effort.

Has no concept or respect for student's time. I get it's a 6 unit class but the time required for even 1 homework assignment is ludicrous. More work than all my other classes combined (2cs,1in4matx). I heavily regret not taking this class with another prof when I had the chance. I don't care how "passionate" she is, workload is not fair.

Tests were absurdly hard, but curved a ton. Half the homeworks were very difficult but the other half were not too bad if you have taken 45C already. This is basically just a tough class to learn C. She gave us plenty of extra credit and now she has improved her grading system (we did not have unit tests). I've had much worse professors.
Spending a legit 35+ hours a week on 1 class and we not even at the heaviest parts yet. Just don't understand this philosophy of overloading us with work.

An overconfident teacher who thinks she is funny and good. What she says and thinks: Educating students by giving lots of homework and lab quizzes What she is actually doing: Giving us brute workload with no contribution to actual education and thinking Expectation: asked to design eiffel tower Reality:placing one brick at a time while squatting

Seems to have improved quite a bit, she's learned from last quarter. HWs now submitted on Gradescope and half the test cases are now given ahead of time, and you can be sure that your code will compile + run in Gradescope - reducing the stress significantly.

She gave more work than my 3 other upper-div CS courses combined. She grades on lots of edge cases and doesn't give partial credit. No sanity-checks given so if you made a tiny mistake you'd get half the assignment wrong. Her exams also has questions on edge cases not mentioned on her slides. You'd only know the answer if it was a bug you fixed.

Prerequisite is misleading. It is better to take this course after getting familiar with C/C++. Do the reading, because there are lots of concepts and it is hard to digest them completely within the lecture. Most of the labs are mandatory, but they help you prepare the homework.

Class is VERY difficult, especially for underclassmen. You have to master many tricky concepts in C, but its rewarding IMO. She gives you many opportunities to make up for mistakes with extra credit and a thick curve. I got 0s for 2 HWs and somehow got an A.
