Make sure u read instructions carefully in this class and dont fall behind!
She lectures well. But you will be pushed to work hard by Wong-Ma, you will think you're failing, you may hate her and cry, but at the end, she gives a HUGE curve to reward your efforts.
Was not an easy course but I learned a lot. Thick curve at the end too. Make sure you are familiar with C++ or C before taking this class though, or you're gonna have a bad time.

this class is a lot of work, but it is a 6 unit class. prof is amazing lecturer who genuinely cares about educating students. She tries her best to be fair and is very active on Piazza. Homeworks and final are hard but I much rather a prof that teaches than one that can't teach.
Hands down one of the most difficult classes I have taken at UCI. This course is nothing to play with. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS LIGHTLY, you have been warned.

One of if not the hardest courses i have taken so far. Spent countless hours and a couple of all nighters working on homework's only to still get under 50% each time. You really can not slack off one bit when taking this course , i'd suggest taking it with two other light classes instead of packing it in with other workload heavy course.

Professor Wong-Ma was a fantastic addition to UCI's ICS department. In ICS53 she teaches a difficult subject, but she teaches it well. This class may be difficult, but it is no way near impossible. Difficulty is very much exaggerated on rmp. Come in expecting difficulty, but if you read the book and go to lecture you'll be fine.

This course is like a Systems / C programming Boot camp. It's rigorous, and it will not let down on you. Wong-Ma is like a drill sergeant throwing tough homeworks and exams at you, you'll spend most of your quarter on ICS53 and ICS 53 only. Just ICS53. Good luck. Sure, youll learn, but you might not make it out in one piece.

Extremely difficult class. You may collect a bottle of tears by the end. She teaches well, but if you take this class you'll need to put a lot of time into it. Programming hws can be long and are graded harshly, and the exams are detailed and difficult (each exam successively harder than the last)
The final was extremely hard!!! This was the hardest final I've ever taken here. Huge amount of work and they were all very time consuming. Be prepared if you need to take.
I'm a jr and for me this has been the hardest class I have taken here so far here. Harder than many other infamous classes/profs. Huge amount of work, tough grading and extremely difficult tests.

Hard hws(Avgs as in the 30-50% range), I thought labs were hard too. Incredibly hard tests. Final was most difficult final I have ever taken. I would honestly suggest taking upper divs to prep for this class if she is teaching it rather than the other way around.
This class's difficulty is such that you're better off taking 143a and 132, UPPER DIVS, to prepare for this LOWER DIV

Her expectations are very high. The workload is very high. Feels like it's an upper div class in a 6 unit lower div (many upper divs aren't this hard). Lectures are great and she's passionate, but needs to more clearly state her expectations in the beginning of the quarter. EXTREMELY grueling (but educational) course.

PROS: good lectures, good piazza response time. CONS: Hws ridiculously difficult, very time consuming you won't have time to do any work for any of your other classes. Hws are graded very harshly 40% average score for Hws. She doesn't prepare you for tests. you will need to read the book(which you won't have time to do so) and also graded harshly.

Don't spend too much time in her class. You will get a bad grade anyway. I spend way much time on this class and still failing some assignment and exams. Instead, focus on other classes so you get a good grade in those classes!
Good prof Hard class

The class itself is not too difficult but her assignments were challenging because we were not given sanity check test cases like most of our previous classes. As a senior, I thought this class was not too difficult. However, it is consuming which it SHOULD be because it is a 6 unit class. Tests are fair and she actually teaches in class.

She lectures very well and teaches a well-organized course. The assignments can be tough, but they expose you to important systems programming skills. Could use a bit more clarity in the rigor of the project grading, such as providing some basic test cases. Responsive on Piazza and cares a lot about students' CS education.

This class is hard. Probably the hardest lower-division class here at UCI (and needs higher prereqs). But Wong-Ma lectures well and has been extremely responsive to feedback as she adjusts to UCI. Heavy course with lots of content to be learned. It will take a toll on you.

Do yourself a favor and take this class in the last quarter or with any other prof. Your GPA will be ruined. And you will get depression. Hws take forever to finish, and the midterms are difficult. The overall average of the class is somewhere around 65%.
Good lectures, at the cost of pain and tears. Is it worth it? Who knows, but I've never seen programming project average scores so low...

Have never had a class with this combination of 1. Lots of assignments 2. Difficult Assignments 3. Hard Grading. Usually most classes have 1 of these elements as "high" and maybe another as "medium". All three of these categories are "high" with her. She is a very nice lady and lectures well but the time requirement for this class is brutal.

She told us we were going to cry this quarter, and she was not lying. Assignments are ridiculously hard graded very harshly. The mean for the 3rd Hw was 38. Does not really prepare us for exams, she expects us to read the entire book, her slides . I will be happy to just get a D in this class so I don't have to take it again with her.
Be sure your insurance covers mental therapy because you will get depression and free like a failure in her class

She is a good teacher. Some assignments were tough, but you'll learn a lot. I think she is getting bad ratings from those who received a 0 on HW 1 just because they didn't read the requirements carefully.
One of the hardest classes at UCI and she somehow makes it even harder. Nothing you do can ever prepare you for her or anything in this class

Hardest class I have ever taken at UCI. The workload is insane. I know its a 6 unit class, but the workload is actually heavier than all of my other classes combined. I took her CS122a class and am currently taking her ICS53 class. She was fair in CS122a but idk what happened in ICS53. Do yourself a favor and take Ics53 in your last quarter.

Yes, there's a heavy workload. However, I don't think I've learned this much in a class since ICS 33 with Pattis. She has taught this class over 10 times at her previous university and the experience shows. If you are willing to put in the substantial effort, you can get an A easily. Her exams never have any surprises and her HWs have clear reqs.

It's like she doesn't know we have other classes/part time job. Absolutely insane amount of time needed for this class with the workload/difficulty. Heavier than 122B with chen li which is saying something.

Why?why?why? Why ICS keep hiring Professors like her? Her first priority seems is trying to overwhelm students and make sure they start hating the subject. Her actions also seems like she believes all the students only enrolled her class and no other classes or work need to be finished, just hers is important.

Really rough for me. It was like getting thrown in front of railroad, being told to calculate when the next train is coming, then u get ran over by the train. She just gives you to code, generalizes the objective but expects precise results, aka numerous edge cases, and doesn't teach how to code, just concepts. COOL personality. No code teaching

Started a bit rough as her expectations didn't match the skill-level of a significant proportion of the class that shouldn't be taking 53 yet in the 1st place (prereqs too low). She does care however; as the class went on, she has adjusted expectations and reduced assignment difficulties. Also took the time to regrade HW1 more generously.

Incredible amount of work/difficulty. Heavier workload than all my other classes (2 cs upper divs, 1 science elective) combined. Projects are long, hard, and graded tough. For the tests, memorize the entire C library. Try to take with someone else, her expectations are not realistic.

Basically the people in this ICS53 cycle are her guinea pigs since she's pretty new here. She's a great lecturer and definitely a caring professor; she just needs to have more focused homework assignments with clear requirements and testing. The class will be difficult, and will require you to do extensive reading and reviewing to just PASS.

This teacher gave me depression! I worked very hard (over 50 hours per week) and I'm still failing the class. Very hard hws, very hard midterms. Tells us we are going to cry this quarter. I have been crying since day one lol. Take it with any other teacher if possible or don't take other classes with it

This class will suck up a lot of your time. Although she gives excellent lectures, the programming assignments are quite challenging and you'll need to spend A LOT of time and suffering working on them. She will make you work (you'll learn Systems fundamentals through suffering).
i work so hard but im still failing the class and dont understand anything
The homeworks are challenging and take a lot of time. Nothing to review for midterm so learn everything.
What year is this? I havent seen the sun for 5 weeks now because Ive been working on 53 hws oh and somehow failing them too.
If you are comfortable with reading the whole C library as  midterm review material then this course is really good for you!
Outstanding teacher.  Very clear, very helpful, and very interesting.

Navarro was very kind and the class structure wasn't particularly confusing. Homework is just labs due weekly. Start labs early. Every lecture has multiple lecture quizzes that you take in the lecture, so attendance matters. Exams revolve around having actually understood the code syntax and applying it to examples.

Navarro taught the 5 week summer session with the same amount of assignments and rigor as a regular quarter. This means up to 10 canvas quizzes due before each lecture, which take up a LOT of time, and we do even more canvas quizzes during lecture. I would recommend her class for a regular quarter, but not for 5 week summer.

Attendance is mandatory due to her quizzes. She drops the lowest 12 so you can miss around 3 lectures. Her exams are easy and you need to just reviews labs, participation quizzes, and her slides to get a high grade on them. Labs were easy just make sure to watch out for edge cases as she uses hidden cases to test your code. She was chill & caring!

Super friendly and caring. Mandatory lectures, but allows you to miss about 3 lectures. First few labs are pretty easy but it quickly gets more and more difficult, so get a head start on them. Almost everything is graded so you have wiggle room if you don't do well on a test (also drops one test). Her lecture slides are very helpful.

Easy class so would take her again, but her class structure is questionable. Participation quizzes for each class (graded on completion), but because of the quizzes, the lectures were never finished, so after every class, there would be the second half of the lecture slides + the second half of the quizzes to finish for homework.

Easy A, not worth your time if you have any knowledge of Java and/or C/C++. Read Java documentation instead. Super nice but I think she needs to move through topics faster or make the class harder. Spends too much time on basics of Java (loops and variables) and not enough on the unique parts of it. Lab writeups are vague as well.

Professor Navarro is an amazing lecturer and a caring professor. I had a little bit of issue with my homework submission, but she is very understanding and after communication, we figured out a solution works for both sides. Her lectures are easy to understand, and the homework is very good practice that reflects what we learned.

Unlike previous quarters, it seems this quarter required students to attend in-person lectures. Weekly labs and biweekly quizzes weren't too bad (except for lab 9), but labs seemed to require you to expect edge cases. ICS 45J felt like an easy elective that doesn't give you much value except learning a new language. Certified Java Hater BTW.

Doesn't give clear criteria for labs on the lab assignment page on canvas. Everyone has to go on Ed Stem and ask questions about the vague requirements and some of them don't get answered until the last day. It's irresponsible of the professor to expect students to get points off a third party app.
good professor

Don't really have much to say but the class was good but not exceptional. The class was asynchronous with lecture time for Q&A, which I chose not to attend. Assignments and quizzes were mostly straight forward and easy to understand, mostly being several small tasks and few large projects. Nothing negative to really mention.

SUPER easy class. A bunch of HW assignments but can be done in a day. You can drop the lowest one (I recommend the GUI assignment). Tests are easy, they're basically from the slides. Straight forward class, she releases all of the work on the first day so you can technically finish the hw assignments early. Quizzes are done on a weekly basis.

Very well organized and straightforward class. 10 weekly quizzes, 10 weekly labs, biweekly lectures with participation quizzes (graded for completion). Lectures are very concise and to the point. Labs can be done in a day. Weekly quizzes are 10 multiple choice questions. Very easy if you already know Java, a little hard week 6 onward if you don't.
This professor is so kind and you can learn a lot from her class. Just take her class!!

Lots of participation quizzes that she goes over in her lectures which made them more of just busy work. Her labs were not hard at all and she drops your lowest one, which I would save for the later ones. Quizzes were not hard at all, open note very easy.

lectures have a LOT of content, projects are v easy except 1 or 2 which take awhile, class starts off ICS32 difficulty, hits close to ICS 33 difficulty by the end, lectures are actually useful to do the assignments, not much about concepts class is just focused on Java, she a nice professor n cares about teaching
The best professor in ICS school.

Pretty straight-forward class with grades coming from weekly labs, weekly quizzes, and lecture participation. It's easy to get an A if you do all the work. One complaint is that the material wasn't "drilled" into us (like in Pattis' ICS33 class) so I'll probably forget most of the material soon.

An easy professor for an easy class. Even if this is your first introduction to Java, this is probably the easiest introductory programming class at this school. She introduces new concepts very slowly, and the homework is so menial, I wrote a program to do most of it for me. Be ready to watch all the lectures though.
Nice and friendly teacher and organized for her first time teaching 45J. Class is pretty chill with weekly labs that take a few hours to finish and easy weekly quizzes based on lecture.
GOAT! We had like 5 papers for the quarter. Short lectures

Wish he kept teaching ICS46 because he is very passionate about his teaching and understanding towards students. His lectures were always recorded which was extremely helpful incase you wanted to go back to review the material. Yes the material was difficult and the quizzes were tricky but he gave a handful of opportunities to make up extra points.

I received a solid "B" by making sure I attended lecture and completing the programming projects. Prof. Gago was an amazing lecturer, but his quizzes were kind of hard to interpret. I would recommend to sit in the front of the class because he does have a thin accent and making a thorough review of the online notes.

The fact that he uses another professors material proves that he is not ready to teach this course. The tests are not too difficult and mostly multiple choice. The programming part of the tests are not from what you learn in projects. He uploads the lectures on canvas but theyre useless anyway. You have a good chance to pass but wont learn much.
The quizzes and final are worth a lot, so be sure to be prepared

Best professor ever! I actually learnt a lot and enjoyed his lectures. Don't expect an easy A, but of course A's should not be easy to get. You will need to demonstrate you deserve it on his difficult but fair quizzes. On the other hand, he gives you plenty of chances to pass the course if you work hard.

He's good, but if you have other choices, pick Thornton or Pattis who gives a really big curve. HIs quiz and tests are easier, but the issue is that a majority of students will end up with B+, B, and B-. So if you aim for an A, try a harder one with a really big curve; if you just want to pass this course, he is a better choice.

He uses another instructor's projects ( Thornton's ) and uses his notes as well but adds his own helpful power points. Lectures do help if you're confused but not mandatory if you understand the notes ( you do get extra credit if you attend least 75% of lectures ). Projects were difficult for me, but doable with enough time. Tests could be tricky.
Best teacher in the school of ICS!

Sergio is an amazing professor! - He spends a lot of time with students. He was very helpful during office hours and, when I could not make the regular hours, he was flexible enough to allow me to make an appointment. Class and projects were actually fun!

Professor Gago is an okay lecturer, but it's always hard to hear him and he uploads the lecture recordings. imo, there was barely any interaction between Gago and students outside of lecture. TA/Readers were also nowhere to be found. i guess that's normal at a research university. However, Professor Ofek was very helpful throughout the quarter.

He's very understanding and cares deeply about his students. Tries his best to make sure every student does their best. Takes his students' feedback and actually tries to improve. he's funny and lecture does not drag. he records his lectures so if you skip class you can always refer to that.

Amazing Professor. I took three courses with him at ICS. Straith forward to the point, nice and funny. He cares and tries hard to get you to learn the course topics. I wish there were more professors like him.

Sergio will make you work and stretch you but he cares a lot about his students. He is an amazing lecturer, very good at explaining concepts, and it's easy to pay attention in his class. I learnt a lot in this class and I am happy I was able to enroll with him. Many students want to take Sergio's courses. He is the best!

Data Structures is a challenging course and Professor Gago makes the concepts understandable. There is simply too much material in too little time for him to hold your hand through everything, but he posts his lectures on UCI's Canvas with notes to fill in the gaps. I personally appreciated his positivity and kindness. Many proffs ignore this.

One of the better instructors in the ICS department! He does his best to work with students, given that ICS46 was taught as a 5 week class he was fairly flexible in terms of assignment extensions and even extra credit opportunities. Projects were cumbersome so be ready to work starting with project 1. He's a very caring instructor!

He uses Thornton's projects, but he writes slides himself. Those slides are straightforward to tell you what knowledge you must grasp in this course. If you feel confused and want to know details, go read Thornton's notes. Midterm and final are all about concepts, so make sure you know how things work. Also, he has a little accent but acceptable.
Awesome Professor! I enjoyed the course and learnt a lot. Sergio really makes a good job making you learn difficult topics. I wish I could take more courses with him!

Professor Sergio is the best! He is the only CS Professor that can make the difficult concepts easy for us to understand. Alex sometimes talks too much in terms of the lecture and the notes. However, the projects Professor Sergio used from Alex is hard. We need to finish a project every week. I was so painful during these five weeks.

Just took ICS46 SS1 with him. His class is essentially thornton's, same notes and projects. Professor is kind, funny, and makes the class as painless as possible, while still teaching you the things you need to know. Tests are multiple choice and they are easy, but you still have to go through the notes and really understand everything.

Overall good professor, assignments can be tricky at times but he is very helpful if you reach out and the TAs are as well. If you're struggling on assignments/labs reach out early. The final was also very straightforward.
It's a challenging course, but you learn a lot! The professor is really nice and cares. The lectures are informative and the slides are great.

50% of your grade will be based on 4 projects. If you screw one of them, you will say goodbye to an A. If you take this course with the professor, make sure you try really really hard on the 4 projects. What's worse is that the lectures don't really help you with the projects.

The projects made this class horrible. The first project was hard. The second project was impossible. For a week I spent 5-10 hours working on the project, absolutely needs to be investigated. I want to vomit, his lectures are introductory skimming through topics while the projects require you to create an entire game by yourself. LABS OR FAIL!

In spring of 2025 he changed all of ICS 32 by adding new projects and getting rid of old ones. The new projects are ridiculously hard and have vague instructions. The TA has redid the instructions 5 times, and the class average for the last project was 13/20. Lectures are useless, he reads off old slides that have nothing to do with our projects.

The professor is great. Good lectures, sensible grade makeup, very nice, and the labs are very helpful. 

The projects are moderate. The coding part isn't hard, but everything else is. Mainly the last project, where "everything else" is ramped up to the max, those are easy to lay off for later, but will actually take the most time to do.

Great Professor. He provides some examples to help student's understanding during lectures. However, he doesn't teach that much about projects, so you will need to self-study a lot for projects. Remember, this class is not easy and you might struggle a lot. Go to lab even if it is not mandatory because there will be angels who can help you.

Tough course if ICS 31 was your first programming experience. Projects build on each other and lectures are completely unrelated to projects. Way harder than ICS 31. Labs are very helpful. However, it is very possible to get an A if you work hard and start projects EARLY. For more experienced programmers, the class would likely be an easy A.

Grade markup is lenient. 50% of your grade given to projects. 30% given to lab work. 20% final. 1.5% extra credit. No midterms or quizzes. Make sure you start the projects early as they get quite tough. Overall, great experience. Take him if you can.
The requirement of every assignment is unclear. And the content in the lecture has no relationship with the assignments.

Lecture and lab attendance are not mandatory, but you would want to go to the lab to finish your homework. Projects were CHALLENGING, especially compared to ICS31. You would definitely feel the gap between the two courses, but that is true for all profs for ICS32. There were no midterms. And his final was super easy and straightforward.

I think Moshipour was an amazing and kind professor, an amazing dude who teaches you the material well and has a sense of humor during his lectures. They can get a bit dull at times but he always provides relevant examples in class that help me understand the content when I'm doing the assignments.

Great professor! He offers a lot of extra credit opportunities and there weren't any quizzes or midterms just a final only worth 15% of the grade. The majority of your grade is based on the assignments which there are 4 of and as long as you don't start working on them last minute you will do well.

Class is basically 100% project based, each of which build off one another. Start projects as early as possible and you'll be fine. The professor was good at understanding when the class was struggling or confused and extended deadlines as necessary. Definitely a good professor! Take him if you can for ICS32.

I honestly loved his class, he gives a lot of extra credit which is really nice and his class is a project-based class which is how a computer science class should be, it's not test heavy at all. The final was only 15% of our grade and we had a sample final. I'm gonna miss this class. Take him if you can!

Lectures are held by the professor and attendance is optional. All labs and homework are done through Zybooks and lab attendance is mandatory. Lots of tedious work and the labs get really difficult toward the end. Lectures are mostly unhelpful but he sometimes tells us what is going to be on the exam. Overall, it's mostly a self-teaching class.

You don't really have to go to lectures but labs are mandatory. The course material is covered using zybook, and you will need to dedicate considerable effort to readings and labs in order to understand the concepts, as the TAs are not very helpful. You will have to rely on self-learning.

mandatory labs every week, lectures aren't mandatory. basically self taught bc I didn't attend lectures. 3 lab exams + a practice one, 1 midterm in person, 1 final in person, labs have TA and tutors to help but it is nothing like the hw. if you can avoid then i would, it is not an easy class unless you put in a lot of time to study

Not the best lecturer, and can be a bit hard to understand. I didn't use the textbook, but if you have a hard time comprehending lecture, it can help.
Definitely better than Gassko. Do every practice test, and the class shouldn't be too hard!

Good lecturer, very focused and clear. Aims the class not just as preparing you for your education, but for your future career. She covers many challenging questions for the purpose of practice, even though the tests tend to be easier and focused just on the material you need for moving on. Despite the professor's effort, TA's were disappointing.

Easy A. I got a B+ cause of personal events. Didn't attend a single lecture or discussion and studied 2 days before exams and still got a B+. 4 exams, no midterm/final. There's extra credit on the homework. I studied for exams using the slides and used ChatGPT to explain them. Do the practice exams. They're not identical, but they're helpful.

I LOVE HER SO MUCH! Genuinely cares about her students and has really easy to understand slides. She truly cares about people struggling and adapts her teaching to adapt to doubts. LOVE HER shes so sweet plz take her if you can.

BETTER THAN GASSKO 100%! Lecture skippable, textbook optional (I didn't use). Probably easiest 6D prof. Average grade at the end was an A. 4 tests (3 weighted 17% with lowest weighted 10%), no final. Be aware that HW is graded on accuracy, but it's not that hard. There are also ungraded practice exams which are pretty close to the real thing.
Easy A. TA is goated.

Teaches ok. No final which is really nice. Posts practice exams that are similar to actual exams. Exams are fairly straightforward. Slides sometimes have typos, so I recommend getting the textbook. Way better than Gassko 5/5

really nice TA's that give so much partial credit and extra credit to makeup for exams that the average is always above 90%, basically everyone get's an A in this class or A+ as long as they do the homeworks and do the practice exams. you would have to be really dumb to not get an A in 6D through her structure.

Zhang has a somewhat strong accent, which can make her a little hard to understand sometimes. But other than that, she's a nice professor. The TA's this quarter did an incredible job with managing the work and offering extra credit to the students. She uses zyBooks for her slides so she doesn't require it, however I would still recommend getting it

Very chill class. Ive taken it with Elea bozo or wtvs, and let me tell you, her coding is insane and she does not teach the class well at all. I would definitely take this professor if you can. Fair grading, fair amount of work and grading for homework, labs, and exams. I like that hw isnt graded on correctness and exams are fair and doable. :)))))

Great TAs. Way better than the other 51 professors. His practice exams are similar to his midterms. Lectures are boring. Homework and practice exams help understand the content. Highly recommend for 51 since every other 51 professor thinks it's Hunger Games.

I like that the exams actually match up with what is given to you for practice. Homework problems, discussion slides, and practice midterm are similar to exam, but not the same. Very doable. Will say the coding labs are slightly hard because you dont really learn the language in lecture, however you code up very simple problems like find max, etc.

This class is super easy. Will admit u do need to learn a little bit of assembly like more on ur own time. But the big parts are the exams and its literally similar to the homework (non coding) and the practice exam (also non coding). Very easy in my opinion

Super easy A. Lecture is not important, midterms are basically the same as the samples. Labs were kinda hard, especially since we don't learn assembly in class, but the TAs are super helpful and once you understand basic commands they're not too bad to figure out
Some people should have never become educators.

Lectures are very slow and you don't really get much from them. Your grade is two labs (which you know your score when you submit) and two exams which are almost identical to the study guide. Overall you don't learn much but you get an easy A. Silver Lining is I do know some assembly now, so if I ever need it its less daunting.

Honestly this professor is not good. His lectures are so boring that you can hear people snoring. On top of that he doesn't teach you at all how to use assembly language and expects you to do a complex lab. He doesn't even show up to his own tests. If assembly is what you are going to specialize in, do not take him and wait for a better professor
He thinks students are truly pathetic

Took it over the summer. There were two projects, two tests, and two homework assignments. The tests were based on the hw, so make sure to understand the hw. You get one sheet of notes for the tests. Prepare to look up hw questions, though, because lectures are no help. The projects take time to figure out, but they aren't that long once you do.

I have no idea what is going on in the class, and some student who has never gone to lecture has taken over his class via online discussion on canvas before every midterm. Unresponsive on piazza, useless in lecture, doesn't even show up to final or make his own final.
The class organization is terrible. No idea what is happening during the boring and dry lecture. Instructions are vague and unclear.

Terrible professor. I had him for a summer where he apparently missed the deadline to submit everyone's grades, decided to be absent for a lecture, neglected to post important and relevant grading criteria for assignments on the syllabus, designed irrelevant tests, and was absolutely unresponsive on Piazza. Many of these apply to the TA as well.

If you want an easy A+ then this proffesor is for you. Lectures are boring and dry, he doesn't really bother to help students on piazza. Didn't show-up to exams/midterms and cancelled class w/o warning. Hard to get in contact with.

Took it in the summer. Two hw's, two labs, 1 midterm, and 1 final. The hw's are relatively easy, just google what you don't know. The exams are similar to the hw's but may have 1-2 slightly harder/weirder questions, out of 11-12 problems. The labs are straightforward, start early and ask the TA for help during LAB. Discussion is important lecture.

The professor is very talented at encouraging students to do self-study very hard. The lecture is very boring and covers contents sporadically. Students need to get skills of MIPS assembly language by themselves. There are many contents outside of the lecture.

If you need this course but want to be mostly committed to your other classes, I think you should take him. Make sure to FULLY understand your HW (lecture slides/ youtube) and a bit on your labs. You don't really need to attend lecture, just go to discussion for lab help. last lab was diff so make sure to not procrastinate & final is cumulative

Very disorganized. TAs for the course do absolutely nothing to help (or teach). A disgrace to UCI ICS dept. Really struggling for faculty it seems. Get ready to teach yourself everything in this course. Good luck.

Lectures are dry and boring; half of the stuff the professor mentions is completely useless and never tested. Read the slides and do the homework/labs. The midterms and final are all based on the homework/labs, which are fairly easy but at times very unrelated to the lecture material. Despite all this, the class is still easy enough to get an A in.

You should definitely attend the lectures and pay attention, or else you'll have a hard time learning the information on your own. The 2 midterms and the final were very similar to the homework assignments, except for maybe 1 or 2 slight curveballs per test. Labs (especially lab 3) could be a bit frustrating since the instructions are unclear

He's more of a researcher than a teacher but he does know his stuff. Although, the three hour long lecture is boring especially in the summer, but you learn a lot from it. I highly recommend going over the slide on your own time. Sometimes, I got overwhelmed with new information from all the new things I learned. His test is not too hard.

ICS51 is easy A class in CS major. It is lovely I could spend much time on other heavy CS courses when I did not need to consume much time on ICS51. Professor made this class easy to understand, he tried to explain in simple way in class. You just spend 1-2 hrs/week to read textbook the parts he assign will be helpful. Easy homework and midterms.

Lectures are long and boring. He's late half of the time and he just reads off the powerpoint, which wouldn't be a problem if it was actually relevant to the exams. Discussion is where TA's teach you how to code in assembly. Exams are modeled after the homework but harder because again, what we're taught in class is hardly relevant to the tests

Class was relatively not hard if you put enough work into it.. No one went to lab hours(including me) in which the TA supposedly had to go over more material. The programming assignments can be tricky but they are an easy A if you get it working and it's 30% of your grade. Lectures tend to went off topic but overall not a bad class.

Awful! lectures are boring, and he does not do a good job of keeping students engaged. He seems to know his stuff, but he is just not a good teacher and bad at sending his message. The TA was kinda helpful, the exams were exactly the same as HW and stuff at discussion, and the final was the same as exams. Not that hard to get A if you put the time.
Lecture makes you sleepy. But I rather take him than taking Alfaro.

THis is an exceptional class & professor - but a lot of work. Still, very rewarding in the end: what other class teaches you in one quarter how computers work from transistors to the OS and compilers and everything in between. And the Prof. makes the material crystal clear. Outstanding. Best class I had, by far, at UCI!

Useless lectures. Nothing covered in lecture was helpful for any assignments. TA's practically taught and ran the course. The Assembly projects were tricky and weren't relevant to any of the lecture material subjects. Luckily the midterm and final were similar to the homework.

Professor Nicolau is relatively clear in his lectures, however he may ramble at times. But, if you bother to listen, he's not too bad. He's willing to help on the homework and labs, but doesn't want to give away too much information because, well, it's college and you're supposed to, you know, LEARN. But, the labs and homework are quite easy.

According to Professor Nicolau this class is "Trivial", if it is trivial, WHY AM I TAKING IT?? And everything that isnt trivial is going to be taught in other classes apparently. After this class, he says your education is pretty much over and UCI wants to take more classes just for money.
His english is hard to understand, but it's not that bad. He has a very encouraging attitude. But he can't teach at all!! He doesn't help with lab assignments at all either!!

Best class in CS at UCI! Now I finally get how a computer works. Excellent teacher, always ready to help,  solicits and answers questions, always available.   Material is difficult, but he is a great motivator and explains it really well.

His English is not clear and it's hard to understand his lectures. I only learnt mostly from the TA's rather than the instructor himself. He expects the students to solve the home works on a research base which does not make sence since ICS 51 is the core and basic course of computer Architecture/ assembly language!
Class is straightforward and easy if you study the material. Homework was pretty easy and so were exams.
Crazy high ego and as a result often talks down to others who have differing opinions bc his opinion is always the right one and doesn't take criticism too kindly (even when clearly in the wrong).
one of the best professors of all time.  very inspirational to community around him.  #pkfire
Handsome, humble, kind... I mean what more could you ask for? Has a big heart and an even bigger co--

Bro was an UNC and talked about aviation while saying "B2 Bombers are ICS Machines!" He went on and on about how ICS made WW2 possible and without ICS there wouldnt be UCI, because I starts with CS and UC ends with I. I loved this man more than my own mother! Great TA! I would hang out with him.

Professor Jack Langson is the epitome of the library as well as a good professor as well. Thoroughly, he provided well needed information in my lab session, providing me with the correct information to succeed not just in Computer Science, but in life. Henceforth, everybody that is a Computer Science major should consider taking him. -Steven H.

I originally had a lot of trouble in this class, but after attending a private office hour with him I was able to turn my grade from a D- to an A+. Very forgiving professor. Very well hung too ;). 10/10 Would do it again
To the nugget, how did you have a shoe?

I only rated him a 5 to keep the trend going.. however I do not get the hype for this man. He is a horrible person who doesn't care about his students in the slightest. I walked into class today and he spit on my shoe and thought it was funny for the sole reason of me being a nugget. Yes, before you make fun of me like him, my mom wrote this.

Professor Aviation is so humble. He also said he once became a supermodel but nobody else gave him any competition. His amazing pecks popped out and stared right back at me. I wanna twirl the hairs on those things so badly. Professor Aviation... I know you will like it.

If you are looking to take ICS with a subpar teacher I have news for you... PROFESSOR AVIATION LANGSON IS NOT SUBPAR!!!! He is one of the best teachers on campus and will even slide you some little gummies before his test. Vitamin gummies of course, which helped me lock in for the final. His class motto is: The class ends on a cliff-hangar!

Professor Aviation provided our class with the most interesting course topics! Who knew I needed military tactics to write code. Information like this is why Professor Langson is the best ICS 33 at UCI, providing me with such a strong foundation in ICS and battle maneuvers. HE'S A MUST!
TAKE HIM!!! Great prof if you are looking to take ICS 33. A lot better than any other professor.

Professor Aviation Langson was one of the funniest guys I have ever laid my eyes on. He always made jokes that he is going to make his new home Jack Langson library because that was his name. The jokes were not funny, but at least he tried. His passive-aggressive teaching style taught me that it was not okay to cry in ICS 33. Love him.

I recently made the best decision of my life and that was switching from Professor's Thornton's ICS 33 class into Professor Aviation's. Even though it was mid quarter, Professor Langson was especially helpful at his office hours at his apartment, and got me learning the difference between a B-1B Lance fighter and an A-10 Thunderbolt in no time!

Professor "Impeccable" Langson, or the self-proclaimed "Aviation" Langson, is a GREAT person and an even better professor. He helped me pass ICS 33 without having to code on paper (cough cough yk who). He is probably the best professor I have ever had and a great mentor. Take me on a date Professor Langson! He makes me blush. -Gary F.
Little to no respect for his students.

Took him in 2022. Amazing professor. Really caring and always there if you need. The class was pretty easy, however you will learn a lot. Final project was a group project, but it was not harda at all. If you can, take him

Amazing professor, he makes lectures fun and tries this best to explain new code. He gives you readings on the class material and gives great feedback on your code. His extension on projects were extremely generous (gave up to 5 days). Do not miss lecture as he explains code more into depth along with syntax. Would definitely recommend.
Amazing professor. I wish he taught every class in my entire major.

Baldwin was great! Very lenient late policy and many chances for extra credit. His assignments could be confusing at times but he is willing to help. There were also 3 projects you could partner with. Def recommend!
Best professor I have ever had, such a kind guy. Extensions are generous and he gives so much help to those who need it. Highly highly recommend!
Goated professor. Clear grading criteria, lectures filled with lots of information, extra credit opportunities on assignments/exams

Professor baldwin is goatedd his class was fun and he's really caring. If you put in the effort you'll be ok :) even though the concepts themselves were tougher than the previous class I enjoyed this class way more.

ICS 32 projects do take a bit of time, but Professor Baldwin is very flexible and understanding when it comes to deadlines. Do reach out to him or TAs if you are struggling. He also offered extra credit in the form of refactoring code or adding additional functionality to your project. Overall very solid professor you can't go wrong with!
I love this professor honestly.

One of my favorite professors at UCI by far. Extremely nice and willing to work with you. Projects take time but are not overly difficult. He leaves room for you to be creative and makes the class fun. Definitely would take again.

I have VERY little experience programming (i.e. started in college) but prof Baldwin was helpful, kind, and very funny. I felt much more confident in my programming skills thanks to him. As a novice, I appreciated his approachable nature as CS can be pretty intimidating. His grading is fair and projs offers lots of points/several parts for buffer

Great professor. He teaches clearly, is easy-going, and has a sense of humor. However, assignments (which count for almost all of the grade), are sometimes unclear, requiring you to ask for clarification on the forum. Grading can be harsh because of automated grading and whether the TA is having a good day.
Really chill.

Class is graded mostly by 5 projects, and a final group project. Professor, peers, and ta's are always available online to ask for help. Projects are pretty hard you need to put in the work but you have about 2 weeks for each one so if you manage your time and ask questions. Super understanding professor and clearly cares about your success.

Amazing human and amazing class. As long as you do the bare minimum of reading the course website every week and watching/attending lectures you should be 100% fine (he even gives extra credit too). One grievance I do have about the class is sometimes the assignments can be vague, so communication with peers, TAs, and Baldwin himself is key.

Baldwin's a great guy; he's super nice and willing to respond to his student's questions, whether they are during the lectures or through online messages. His lectures, however, might get a little boring. Project-based class - some projects were considerably harder than others. Prepare to spend a solid amount of time and effort on these projects.

Very chill prof. Grading consisted of 5 projects, participation, and a final project. Projects are graded toughly, but you can refactor 2 projects as a half-grade boost to your overall grade. Sometimes the project instructions are unclear, but he is always active in answering students' questions on Zulip.

An amazing professor. You will do great if you pay attention to the lectures and corresponding reading. Baldwin can be intimidating because he's monotone, but he's a great, funny guy and REALLY understanding. This was only my 2nd coding class ever and I still did well, even slacking on some of the lectures. Choose Baldwin!! absolute W professor

Learned a lot in this class. Mark's a nice guy. Class is proj-based. 5.5 projects and 1 final proj that you can do in groups. Lecture's sort of mandatory w/ in class quizzes counting for participation. Zulip board was helpful, and Mark answered a lot of Q's. Instructions were unclear sometimes. Lenient late policy. Can't go wrong w/ him.

Baldwin is a realy nice professor! Although, yes, his assignments were a little confusing but setting an office hour with TA/Professor really helps figuring out your way. Lectures are helpful in terms of getting the bare basica of the course, and assignments are pretty interesting so that was a plus for me. Recommend!

Great professor that managed to make the 5-week class manageable, without compromising on learning. Class is graded by 5 (in our case 4) project assignments and a final project, that while may seem difficult at first are all absolutely doable. Great lectures teaching the various material of the class like Classes. Clearly cares about your success!

The man is super nice and chill. Everything you need to do is clearly laid out in the labs, just make sure to read and don't be a dumbass like me. I failed one of my labs because I failed to read. This class is an easy A+, I just didn't get that because I was dealing with serious mental issues at the time. So you should be aight.

My absolute favorite class the quarter I took it. He's an amazing teacher and a great guy. Don't be afraid to ask him questions, and watch the lectures. They pretty much explain everything that you need to know. Go to the lectures, even the optional ones. Ask lots of questions, can's stress that enough. Not a difficult class but manage your time.

Course has 5 standard projects followed by the final project, mostly pretty easy if you're willing to put in some work. TA's and professor are all available and willing to regrade. Due dates are flexible and plenty opportunities for extra credit. 2 lectures a week - 1 is a quiz, the other is basically office hours. All-round great professor.

I really liked the way the professor taught his lectures. The sample code he gives is really helpful. Often I found that, I wouldn't understand a project right away but by asking questions to the TAs and professors you realize the project is a lot simpler. Take advantage of all the extra credit he gives!

Took this in Winter 2021. Generally, Mark's online notes are easy to read and follow. You got a question? Show up to his office hours and he'll get you up to pace. Overall, he's pretty understanding, and even allows regrades for the assignments (which saved my butt a few times). IIRC, he gave us two weeks for each assignment except one (one week).

Professor Baldwin is one of the best professors I've ever met in UCI. So far the best in ICS/Informatics. I love the way he designs the homework and final project. He is also very caring outside of class. We were able to use a website called zulip to discuss. It was very helpful throughout the whole quarter. Hope I can take his class again some day

One of the greatest, funniest, most easy-going people I've met. There are only a few assignments but they're important, so give them your best! Pretty accessible outside of class, especially on our class forum/Q&A site. I wish other professors were as nice as him!
Genuinely the best professor I've had so far. Baldwin is super chill and I would totally hang out with him irl if it was socially acceptable

Professor Baldwin is the best; chill and funny. It was a project-based class with five assignments. Class is mandatory once per week because there is a live quiz session, but if you show up, to all sessions, you get extra credit. The assignments weren't bad, just make sure to get a head start and don't procrastinate. Professor ACTUALLY teaches.

You must submit weekly HW + Notes (of lecture) = 30%, and online quizzes (70%) - 10 total quizzes.  If you miss 1 HW/Note, getting an A is pretty much impossible. If you miss 1 Quiz, say goodbye to A or B. The A- bracket was at 94.44% for our class, A was 96% (around). Some Quiz questions have no right answer, and everything gets graded at week 11.

Genuinely good guy, seems to care a lot about the subject matter, does his best to make lectures entertaining. It's not always easy to follow the concepts he's explaining though, textbook is a good supplement. Grades are based on weekly quizzes, first couple are hard but the rest are not bad as long as you can grasp the subject matter.
truly care about students

I thought the reviews about how this professor tanks your GPA were dramatic. They were not. After failing to implement his unique online quiz policy correctly, and punishing his students for "gaming the system" when they were just using the quiz functionality that was available, my 96.33% was downcurved to a B+. Save your GPA: don't take Hayes.

Grading inconsistent & late. New grading policy on quizzes meant they were never graded correctly, & youd have to hunt them down to get it fixed. After finals, grades submitted arent consistent w/ Canvas ones for most. Refuses to correct them if you skipped around questions on quizzes, he claims it was never meant to be allowed, but was when taking

Lectures were useful and class was super easy. New grading system made grading slow and very inconsistent, but that didn't bother much. Only issues I had was that he curved down and that he wont accept regrades due to a Canvas issue. I skipped a decent amount of lecture and got through the class, but lecture helped me understand better than the TB.

because he's teaching ics 6b again, ill give a quick rundown. His quizzes are extremely hard and unrelated to the lectures he gives in class. Extremely selfish person and almost guaranteed grading mistakes that he will not correct. I recall 2 years ago that only 10% of the class had an A and most ended up having to retake the class because of him.

Atrocious. Avoid at all costs. He seems to care about the material, but he is the worst teacher I have ever had the displeasure of being taught by. Quizzes had several mistakes (and each question is worth 2% of the final grade), content was a disorganized mess, communication was the absolute bare minimum, and cannot control his temper (see r/UCI)

Disorganized lectures & quizzes; 40-50% average grades of three quizzes among 300 students. Quizzes weigh 70% & 3-8 questions per. He blames students for being behind by a week. Super slow response to Edstem/emails. Had petition against him, dean of stud affairs & chair of ICS show up. Problem isn't solved. Look up "UCI wrong answer quiz reddit"

Wayne Hayes absolutely sucks at his job. His lectures are extremely slow and boring and he constantly makes mistakes and never takes responsibility. Highly advise not taking his ICS 6B class unless you wanna be challenged in what should be a relatively easy class to get an A.

He is bad at teaching. Thats the sum of it. ICS 6B is very hard to understand and hes not doing a good job at explaining it. Its currently week 8 and he hasnt grade anything . All of the Hw grades havent been inputted. So I can even drop this class cause I dont know what my grade is. ITS WEEK 8. He needs to do better
He spends too much time writing explicit emails and violating NASA ethics guidelines.

Ever want a professor to blame a poorly proofread quiz on canvas? Look no further! He'll scam you of a proper CS education faster than he tried to scam people by posing as a NASA scientist to market his snake oil weight loss cold vest.

extremely unclear with everything he does as a professor. changes his homework requirements on a weekly basis meaning that you might spend 3 hours for nothing. doesn't know how to teach properly and the textbook sucks. average on the quizzes is consistently 40 - 50%. take gassko or irani
Worst professor. Extremely strict with grades. Don't take his class.
it's bad. don't torture yourself and take.
The worst professor I have ever seen. Quizzes took huge part of grade and very hard. Just don't take his classes at all.

70% of the grade is based on weekly quizzes which are 10-15 minutes. It doesn't matter if know the material but skipped at least one of these quizzes. No make-up, no drop. He is completely unorganized, his handwriting is awful. Hayes behaves haughty and too confident, but in reality he does not know how to teach.

Makes you attend lectures for credit. This year, notes for the lectures were required. Quizzes you on subjects he hasn't covered yet, so show up for credit but you need the book if you want to pass the class. Also lectures are awful, you'd learn more reading the book during that time.

During lecture he copies his notes from his paper onto the board while managing to make numerous mistakes (his handwriting/organization is bad too). Homework doesn't always correlate with the lecture material. It's a hit or a miss. Midterm was fair. Studied a lot for the final and still didn't pass and it wasn't just me. The whole thing was a mess.

Easy midterm that makes you think you are at an OK position of the course, until final that weighs 50% came out with irrelevant problems. He sent students multiple emails after final and explained how the class mean and distribution were perfect and didn't need a curve, he later corrected it and gave us a curve because 2/3 would fail without it.

What a wild ride. The avg midterm grade was a B so to compensate he gave an impossible final with a 58% average. He curved after the class brought this up, my 77 in the class was a B+. In general, lectures were not useful, study through the book and momoko notes. Grind out book problems, though know there is little correlation between HW and exams.

This class was something else. Wayne has the whole 1/3 credit for blank answers for the final but, does it really help if the majority of your class fails the final anyway... and all he says is probably no curve needed. Dont get me wrong hes an ok professor but the final wasnt even that relevant to hw or lectures. Final was worth 50% btw.. woo

Be prepared to self-study a lot. Final is 50% of your grade, super complicated and irrelevant, NOTHING like the lectures, homework, or midterm. Probably the hardest final I've ever taken in my life. Save your GPA.

Do not bother going to class or even signing up for it. Hayes's lectures are verbatim from the textbook, and do not suffice to help on the homework. This quarter (Spring '18) he decided to have one of his TA's create new homework to avoid cheating. A quote from another TA: "Some of these are so hard (and irrelevant), I can't even solve it."

While I would not consider Professor Hayes a good lecturer, I do think he gets a worse reputation than he deserves. While it is true that he is not clear in his lectures or announcements, you can have professors that are far worse than him. If you want to do well though, it will be challenging. Make sure to study a lot.
A tough prof but quality because you will learn a lot
Really hard grader. Homework given every week is really easy. But exams are a lot harder. He stumps himself really often. He's funny, and a good guy, but honestly not a good lecturer.
Not a good person. It's impossible to talk to him and get any feedback Doesn't care about his students. Just go on reddit and read about him.

Mean guy. But that doesn't mean much because he's a fair and just person; he has a very fair grading policy and he will, often skeptically, give into student demands. Neither he nor the class should be any trouble to you.

Was incredibly disorganized in lectures and often forgot how to finish his own examples. Also was very condescending in office hours and occasionally in his emails to the class as well. If you have to take 6B either wait for another professor or be prepared to learn most of the material outside of his lectures because most of them are useless.

He would confuse himself during lecture and give out wrong information consistently, rather than it being a once or twice occurrence. Also, during the final, he messed up directions twice for one of the problems which caused so much time to be wasted. All in all, 200% would not take his class again. He killed my GPA and made me sad.

The only way to do well in the class is study by yourself. He would often stump himself 2 or 3 times per class. In all lectures, he would read off his notes and sometimes his notes are still filled with mistakes. Lookup ICS 6B manifesto, it lists all the things  wrong with the class

Hayes is actually a terrible professor. I didn't think it was possible to be that bad, but lesson learned. Do not take him at all cost, it is not worth your money because you self teach yourself everything. The class itself was said to be a GPA booster with other teachers, so save yourself and your GPA by avoiding Hayes.
Be ready to learn by yourself if you plan to take his class. Remember everything and do all the exercises from textbook if you want to get a good grade.
Learn by yourself, then you will get A+

The lectures were much harder to understand than just reading the textbook. He is reasonable and listens to criticism, but I would still not recommend taking this class with him when there are better and easier professors like Irani.

Worst Professor on the face of the planet. If you ever just want to ruin your GPA, this is the professor you've been looking for. His lecture notes are so unorganized and he just write all over the board which is really hard to keep track of. Out of a 300 student class, only like 30 students got an A  and by prob self study because he can't teach.
Trust me,  this is the worst prof i have ever met.

I've only been at UCI for a quarter, but honestly this is one of the worst teachers that I have ever had in the history of me going to school. He stumps himself every time he tries to do example problems that are not in his notes. Oh, and his notes are pretty much definitions that you would get out of the textbook. Good luck if you are taking him.

Wayne tends to stump himself on just about every lecture. First day of lecture was a waste: he did not address the syllabus but rather told a long tale about the importance of computers. I ended up with an A self-studying than my peers who attended class and ended up with Cs.

He just reads off definitions from his notes during lecture.  He rarely provides examples while teaching.  80% of the grade is determined by 1 midterm and 1 final, which is rare for a lower div course.  That said, his curves are generous so the class is not that difficult overall.

Prof. Hayes does not lecture about topics that are necessary to fully understand the topics that he tests on, so you will do most of your learning on your own through the textbook. Many people also skip his lecture because it is a waste of time. Lastly the professor is very egocentric and did not relay what would be on the midterm.

Extremely rude and unhelpful. Refused to give homework solutions for review before final so that he could reuse them every year. Refuses to answer more than three questions. Late to every class. Just shows quizzes on screen and scrolls them. Sometimes even forgets to make quizzes. He does not care. He hates his students and his students hate him.

This guys is the most real professor out there. He's pretty funny considering the course material is so dry. The final was hard as hell though. You need to go to discussions to have get answers for the homework which help for the weekly quizzes.

Pretty boring lecturer, not organized at all, took all of the course material from previous instructors (webpage, textbook, quizzes), rather rude and disrespectful to students who asked questions in lecture (also limited them to 3 per class), quizzed students on the wrong material, basically just a run-of-the-mill bad professor

He is so lazy he does not even print papers for quizzes,he just shows them on the screen and scrolls the window while helpless students ask him to show it again. He does not allow you to ask more than three questions in lecture.

Very disorganized and only goes over what we read in the book. We have the book already, why do we need to go over that in an hour and 20 min lecture? Very disorganized and often "has notes out of order."
Two words: Fan. Tastic.

His class was pretty interesting in terms of the material. He's a confusing and disorganized lecturer. Funny guy though! His grading is good, mostly weekly quizzes so it really helps even out your grade. The textbook is really helpful.

Take this class with someone else if you can. He fell behind in material and expected the class to do homework he hadn't covered (a week behind with homework due weekly). Ambiguous tests, tough final, messed up final grades. SKIP

Difficult class as it is and it isn't made better with this professor since it seems as if he doesn't know what he is doing half the time. 40% quiz, 10% HW, and 50% final which was extremely difficult and was nothing like the quizzes and homework like he said it would be. Even messed up the final grades for the entire class. DO NOT TAKE HIM!
Good guy. Knows his stuff. Extremely fair. The Greeks would be astonished.

Terrible professor. His quizzes and final were horribly ambiguous, which is scary, seeing as they make up your entire grade. Studying before quizzes is a must, but often doesn't help. I'm not sure that he understood the material himself. If you have the option to take this class during another quarter, I highly recommend waiting to avoid Hayes.

Okay professor.  One easy quiz per week and a hard final.  No midterm.  In class, just writes examples on the board with a brief explanation.  You either have to read the chapters and teach yourself or go in for office hours which are helpful. The overall class is not that hard.

I thought he was a decent professor.  He sometimes got confused while he was teaching, but honestly, this is a pretty confusing subject. He is very helpful when you ask specific questions. Lots of office hours. Quizzes were easy if you study.

What a horrible professor. The material is really difficult and his teaching method is copying examples to the board from the book that he doesn't even understand. No midterm, just weekly quizzes and a final, which was close to impossible.

Hayes doesn't really care about his students. His lectures are confusing at best, and he doesn't really seem to know the material himself. He simply copies examples from the book onto the board. When questioned, he can't respond effectively, because he doesn't know what he's doing. Bad teacher. Doesn't help that it's a tough course, though.

I'm three weeks into this class and I can already tell it will be a nightmare. His class is hectic and not well planned. He never explains assignments, just expects you to show up with them completed. He randomly changes due dates and has about 5 assignments in progress at once. That's not to say he's not a nice guy, but his class is too chaotic.

Prof. was not prepared to teach. Often came late. Never provided a syllabus. Assignments were not planned out. Class was three weeks behind "schedule." But you didn't know for sure since there was no schedule given out. Professor was not organized and didn't want to put forth the effort to teach his students. His research was more important to him!

Doesnt like to give partial credit. Makes material harder than Irani. Wears what looks like the same exact shirt every day (concerning?). Isnt amazing at explaining concepts (doesnt know how to explain something from a different angle), more like rambles off whats on the slides. Hardly does any real examples. Definitely not top quality professor.

He's not the best lecturer, but he's okay. 4 tests (1 drop) if you do the HW it should be very straight forward. If you do better in the final compared to the test (he uses median and standard deviation to compare), he will use the better one among those two. I had a B+ before the final, I did pretty well on the final and ended up with an A.

This professor. He literally shows up like 7 minutes late every lecture and just reads off the notes which is from your online textbook. Each homework assignment you TURN in will be due on the DAY of the lecture, and the content of that lecture is going to be FROM the notes YOU JUST READ, FOR the homework to FINISH before HIS lecture. Self study.

Doesn't really teach -- reads off slides all lecture. Our lectures are not mandatory, but he takes attendance anyway to "determine which students are showing up" which will later affect the grade curve. No midterms, but quizzes every 2 weeks (hard) and the final. (Online) readings are graded, but they're only worth 5%. Overall, 3/10
The class was really easy at first, I only showed up on quiz day. After quiz 3, it got really hard. You need to be there the day before the quiz and finals, he'll tell you what to study.
Extremely lazy and boring. Do not take this class. He's the worst professor I've ever had. Showing up to class is useless and his lectures are boring.

Reads everything off a powerpoint that's made based off an online book that is already pretty simple to understand and there are still errors on almost every slide. Quizzes and final are pretty tough but ok if you read. The only good thing is that he curves but make sure to really keep up with the class or else you'll struggle.

The structure of the class is awful. 5 quizzes for 48% and a final for 46% and the 6% of online reading that didn't  even match up with the material in class until week 6 when he changed it around. His lectures are impossible to follow, he stutters and has mistakes in almost every slide. The final was just all the leftover untested material.

Yes, he's a bad lecturer and you have to do mostly self teaching. However, his quizzes aren't too difficult and there's only 5 of them plus a final. If you do the homeworks and read the book, you should be fine for the quizzes.
Avoid at all costs! Really bad lectures, I feel like I've learning nothing from his class. The only way to pass is to teach yourself.

Worst Professor EVER! He makes me hate the subject so much and gives me no motivation to try. Because he doesn't even try. He comes to every lecture late, mistake on every single lecture slide. He never fixes any of those mistakes because I have friends that have taken his class and they said he had those same mistakes all along but he doesn't care

He only reads the lecture slides. Every lecture there is at least one mistake on a slide. Very boring. Basically, don't even attend lecture except for the ones before quizzes in order to get the quiz topics. Otherwise, it's not a hard class: just self teach yourself with the book, notes, and homework. If you can, take this class with someone else.

This professor is the worst. He is always late to lecture, he literally reads off the slides(which have multiple errors ) and guides you through the class horribly. Very unorganized and stutters a lot. Try to take a better professor. Don't waste your time with this guy.

He is a terrible professor. The worst I've had EVER. He has typos on every slide, which is really problematic especially as most of the stuff we do are proofs or logistical problems. C'mon just review the slides before lecture, quizzes are really hard, he makes his lectures more confusing than how they explain it in the book. Avoid at all costs.

He is a great professor. He answers all questions thoroughly, writes fair midterms/finals, and does a great job at helping the students who are falling behind or need to catch up for various reasons  (from personal experience - had to miss a few weeks of class). Besides, he's extremely nice and kind!

Got an A+ due to the people who give this guy a bad rating. Yeah his slides might be straight from the book, but the material is easy to understand, and the bi-weekly quizzes help you retain the material until the final (not like the material is that hard anyways). One of the easiest classes I've taken at UCI.

Lectures not helpful, teaches straight off the textbook powerpoint. Never sees you raise your hand. Stands in one place the entire lecture just reading/pointing at the powerpoint. Learned the topic on my own

Lectures are not helpful. Professor reads off slides and mumbles corrections over various errors. Bi-weekly quizzes covers only specific topics that are hardly touched on in lecture. Final is pretty much synonymous to the quizzes. I wouldn't take Dillencourt for 6D, since you can learn from reading the book through osmosis than his lecture.

VERY DIFFICULT CLASS. First quarter here and because of this class, I will start off with a low GPA. Quizzes were difficult, and the final covered concepts where you had to memorize every formula in the book. I ADVISE NOT taking this professor at all costs. Now I know not to become a CS major..

Seriously, if you're going to take ICS 6D with this him, RUN AWAY NOW. He uses the slide from the textbook and speeds through them very fast. He only reads off the lecture slides. I took ICS 6B (Boolean Algebra) before this and I swear he crammed half a quarter's worth of 6B into the first three lectures. The final hard and not like the quizzes.

Worst professor. Too many slides, does not explain things well. Lectures are confusing and jumbles topics. Uses book examples, you do not get a clear understanding of what he is teaching. Put in 12+ hrs a week studying for this class, and have a B. Averages on quizzes = 65%+. Avoid this teacher.

If you have him for ICS6D, you might as well shoot yourself in the foot now. He uses our book's publisher's PPT study material for his lectures, and he breezes through them. He can't explain what happens between each step of a problem, so if you've never seen the material he covers, you'd get lost easily.
AVOID AT ALL COST! He is not a good prof. He goes too fast over important topics and has like 100 slides per chapter. 5 quizes (44%) and 1 Final(56%). WAY TOO HARD.

Cannot teach for beans. He uses a powerpoint from the book, and doesn't bother to read it before hand to catch errors or parse out slides that we don't go over. He goes over definitions and basic stuff WAY to fast, and spends all his time on easy stuff like addition, or complicated stuff that no one understands. He uses umm way to much.

I recommend Dillencourt - he teaches out of the book very consistently and consequently just about all of his exam problems come from the book as well. I studied for his exams by doing all the odd problems in the relevant chapters(with answers) and it served me very well.
Worst professor ever
his final is so hard!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Even harder than hw and I even could not finish it.

If you enjoy lectures that only cover 5% of the material, with half the textbook assigned as homework, Baldi is the professor for you. The lectures WILL contain continuous usage of the word "obviously" when the topic is anything but. And don't worry about doing the homework he only grades one question, and if you get it wrong, too bad, no feedback!

He is the worst professor for major class I've ever seen. Facts: he does not use zybooks, which is a clear, helpful, efficient way to learn same things. He uses long, long textbook. He gives homework that takes u 15+ hours to do, 4060 questions from the textbook exercise every week. Only one of homework question will be graded,if u does wrong, 0.

A bit of an unstructured course, I personally found the lectures to be interesting enough (as much as math can be). Homework assignments were very long. Weekly quizzes had unpredictable content but generally simple. Skipped some HW assignments and got mostly C's on quizzes (above average) but there was a generous curve hence the A-. Manageable

Not good quality. His TA's were probably the worst group of TA's ever. No grades entered in timely manner, no clear explanation. Professor himself does not suffer with concept explanation clarity. Not an easy subject, but teaching it like this puts a lot of students on the verge of failing simply because the way the course is conducted is poor.

Good luck with Baldi. You're gonna cry. You're gonna fail. You don't know what's going on. You won't finish the homework. Satan just sent this guy directly from the deepest hell. He also looks like Michio Kaku, which is very intimidating. The first and second week was easy, so don't be overconfident. Starting the 3rd week, welcome to hell.

Assigns half of the text book as homework -- the even half, of course. Midterm and quizzes are easy, but if you don't start the homework at least 2-3 nights prior to the turn in date, you're screwed, brah.

Discrete is a pretty hard class to start off with, so it doesn't really help that Baldi isn't the best professor either... He went through concepts really fast, but he's a smart man, and I think the smarter kids definitely understood the things he was saying. He sometimes assumes we know more than we do, so it's easy to get left behind. DO HW!

For the first half of the quarter the class was a mess, unclear grading criteria, midterm 1 did not reflect the difficulty of homework, miscommunication etc. He switched the structure after week 5 for the better, but mandatory attendance to discussion was still useless. He saved me with the final, it was clear, similar to the hw given all quarter.

Unclear grading, structure. Gopi is really a good man, but not the class, as he said, he is passionate at lecturing, but not grading, coordinating...Discussions are useless but mandatory(facing technique issues and lack of connection and extention to material, basically reading the zybook again and again. So why wouldn't I read by myself?)

Gopi's lectures do not cover the material fast enough to catch up with the zyBooks, so you'll be doing most of the learning and practice from there. The effectiveness of the discussion sections were hit or a miss; they did not  always feel super helpful. The built in curve is 5%, so >85% A-, >75% B-, etc. 3 Midterms on week 4, 7, 10, and a final.

Gopi really care about his students and was willing to make changes as the class went on. He hasn't been teaching this class for 10 years so it was a mass at the beginning. The first midterm was terrible but the second and the third are manageable. 85% is an A-. Take him, he's a nice professor.

He is a very nice guy overall. The downsides: hard to understand him in lectures, disorganized with the material at times, and the lectures are mandatory attendance, midterms are kinda hard but overall seems very understanding! Most 6B professors aren't going to be as nice as him, so I recommend taking him in comparison :) Good luck!

I wouldn't recommend taking this class unless he changes the way the class is structured as you will be teaching yourself most of the material off the textbook and random videos as he was very disorganized. The tags are sarcastic. I found his last lecture very amusing because he said that we were all to focused on grades rather than on learning.

This professor really cared about his students. Although the class was disorganized at times he was always understanding and was there to teach you in the most understanding way possible. He was caring toward his students and was an inspiration as a professor 10/10 would recommend again.
gopi got too silly
Professor zybooks get ready to get destroyed on test :<

such an unorganized mess of a class. homework is ridiculously long and problems are way harder than the simple lecture topics. he didn't teach until like week 5 and the first midterm grade avg was a 53 before the fake "curve" which was only because he gave too many questions

6B with Gopi was absolute torture . Lecture content is different than the HW assignments which are also very long and hard but relative to the midterm are easy , the midterms are excessively hard and long and all have proofs .Attendance is mandatory he is very unorganized and discussions are useless.This course single handedly given me depression.

Better off learning from zybooks. The only thing stopping u from not going to lecture is the checkin code that goes against ur grade. Other than that, content is pretty easy. HW is for participation and midterms are kind of hard, but it is what it is.
He really doesn't teach enough. The whole class had to read the ZyBooks and self-teach everything.

Gopi is really good. You can skip the class with no effect on your grade. You can also finish your homework anytime and it does not have a hard deadline. But it is recommended to be finished because it really helped of your exam.

Gopi is a great professor for ICS 6B. He explains everything quite well (even though his examples are from the book) and his class is fair. If you do the homework and pay attention in class it isn't hard to get a good grade. Not only is he good at teaching, he's also passionate about the subject and he's sometimes a funny guy.
take it. He knows how to teach 6B and what you need from it.
take it. you'll have fun in class, you'll do as much homework as necessary, you'll still learn useful material and you'll get an A. He knows how to teach 6B and why.

He covers a lot of material in the class, and the discussion is almost necessary to understand the material. He is a brilliant man, and tries to keep the class entertaining and light hearted, but he makes sure you know the material on the tests.

This teacher is good.  Take him.  His lectures are very good.  Also, hw is very lenient; you can do as many problems as you feel (as long as its a reasonable amount).  I just kept doing half of the hw and still got full points.

Great professor. At first was difficult to understand, but you learn his accent quickly. His tests and quizzes were hard, but very fair. You do not have to memorize useless stuff, as knowing concepts is key.
